verses.english: And the golden mice corresponded to the number of all the Philistine cities across their five provinces, from the fortified city to the unwalled village, right up to the great stone on which they placed the Ark of the Lord, which was in the field of Joshua of Beth Shemesh.

verses.latin: Percussit autem de viris Bethsamitibus, eo quod vidissent arcam Domini: et percussit de populo septuaginta viros, et quinquaginta millia plebis. Et luxit populus, eo quod Dominus percussisset plebem plaga magna.
verses.english: But the Lord struck down some of the men of Beth Shemesh because they had looked inside the Ark of the Lord. He struck down seventy men from the people, and fifty thousand of the common folk. The people mourned greatly because the Lord had afflicted them with such a severe plague.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt viri Bethsamitae: Quis poterit stare in conspectu Domini Dei sancti hujus? et ad quem ascendet a nobis?
verses.english: The men of Beth Shemesh said, 'Who can stand in the presence of this holy Lord God? And to whom will He go up from us?'

verses.latin: Miserunt ergo nuntios ad habitatores Cariathiarim dicentes: Adduxerunt Philisthim arcam Domini, descendite, et reducite eam ad vos.
verses.english: So they sent messengers to the inhabitants of Kirjath Jearim, saying, 'The Philistines have returned the Ark of the Lord. Come down and take it back to your own place.'

verses.latin: Venerunt ergo viri Cariathiarim, et adduxerunt arcam Domini, et intulerunt eam in domum Abinadab in Gabaa: filium autem ejus Eleazarum sanctificaverunt ut custodiret arcam Domini.
verses.english: So the men of Kiriath-jearim came, and they brought the Ark of the Lord there. They brought it into Abinadab's house, which was on the hill. Then they consecrated Abinadab's son, Eleazar, for the sacred duty of guarding the Ark of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et factum est ex qua die mansit arca Domini in Cariathiarim, multiplicati sunt dies, et impleti sunt viginti anni, et requievit omnis domus Israël super Dominum.
verses.english: And it came to pass that from the day the Ark of the Lord remained in Kiriath-jearim, many days accumulated, and twenty full years passed by. And all the house of Israel then turned back to the Lord, seeking His rest and favor.

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel ad universam domum Israël, dicens: Si in toto corde vestro revertimini ad Dominum, auferte deos alienos de medio vestri, et Astaroth, et præparate corda vestra Domino, et servite ei soli, et eruet vos de manu Philisthinorum.
verses.english: Then Samuel spoke to all the house of Israel, saying: 'If you are truly returning to the Lord with all your heart, then you must remove all foreign gods and the goddesses of Astarte from your midst. Prepare your hearts solely for the Lord and serve Him alone. If you do this, He will deliver you from the power of the Philistines.'

verses.latin: Et abstulerunt filii Israël Baalim et Astaroth, et servierunt Domino soli.
verses.english: So the sons of Israel removed the Baalim and the Astartes, and they served the Lord alone.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Samuel: Congregamini universi Israël in Masphath, ut orem pro vobis Dominum.
verses.english: Then Samuel said: 'Gather all of Israel at Mizpah, so that I may pray to the Lord for you there.'

verses.latin: Et convenerunt in Masphath, et hauserunt aquam, et effuderunt in conspectu Domini, et jejunaverunt in die illa, et dixerunt ibi: Peccavimus Domino. Et judicavit Samuel filios Israël in Masphath.
verses.english: So they gathered at Mizpah, and they drew water and poured it out before the Lord, performing a symbolic act of pouring out their hearts. They also fasted on that day, and there they confessed, saying, 'We have sinned against the Lord.' And Samuel acted as a judge for the sons of Israel in Mizpah, hearing their disputes and providing guidance.

verses.latin: Et audierunt Philisthim quod congregati essent filii Israël in Masphath, et ascenderunt principes Philisthinorum contra Israël. Quod cum audissent filii Israël, timuerunt a facie Philisthinorum.
verses.english: Now the Philistines heard that the sons of Israel had gathered at Mizpah, so the princes of the Philistines went up against Israel to attack them. When the sons of Israel heard this, they were terrified of the Philistines.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque ad Samuel: Ne cesses pro nobis clamare ad Dominum Deum nostrum, ut salvet nos de manu Philisthinorum.
verses.english: And they said to Samuel, 'Do not cease to cry out for us to the Lord our God, that He may save us from the power of the Philistines.'

verses.latin: Et tulit Samuel agnum lactentem unum, et obtulit in holocaustum integrum Domino: et clamavit Samuel ad Dominum pro Israël, et exaudivit eum Dominus.
verses.english: So Samuel took one suckling lamb, and he offered it as a whole burnt offering to the Lord. And Samuel cried out to the Lord on behalf of Israel, and the Lord heard him, granting his prayer.

verses.latin: Factum est ergo, cum Samuel offerret holocaustum, Philisthim commoverunt prælium contra Israël: intonuit autem Dominus super Philisthim magna voce in die illa, et conturbavit eos, et cæsi sunt a facie Israël.
verses.english: It came to pass, therefore, as Samuel was offering the burnt offering, that the Philistines advanced to battle against Israel. But the Lord thundered with a great voice over the Philistines on that very day, and He threw them into confusion, and they were struck down by the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Egredientesque viri Israël de Masphath, persecuti sunt Philisthim, et percusserunt eos usque ad locum qui est subter Bethchar.
verses.english: And the men of Israel went out from Mizpah, pursued the Philistines, and struck them down all the way to the place below Beth-car.

verses.latin: Et tulit Samuel lapidem unum, et posuit inter Masphath et inter Sen: et vocavit nomen loci illius, Lapis Adjutorii. Dixitque: Hucusque auxiliatus est nobis Dominus.
verses.english: Then Samuel took one stone and set it up between Mizpah and Shen. He called the name of that place 'Stone of Help,' saying, 'Up to this point, the Lord has helped us.'

verses.latin: Et humiliati sunt Philisthim, nec ultra venerunt in fines Israël. Facta est itaque manus Domini super Philisthim cunctis diebus Samuelis.
verses.english: So the Philistines were humbled; they no longer entered the territory of Israel. Thus, the hand of the Lord was against the Philistines all the days of Samuel, holding them back and defeating them.

verses.latin: Redditæ sunt autem civitates quas tulerant Philisthim ab Israël, Israël, ab Accaron usque Geth, et terminos earum: et eruit Israël de manu Philisthinorum. Pax quoque facta est inter Israël et Amorrhæum.
verses.english: And the cities that the Philistines had taken from Israel were restored to Israel, from Ekron as far as Gath, including all their surrounding territories. Thus, Israel was delivered from the power of the Philistines. There was also peace established between Israel and the Amorites, their other neighbors.

verses.latin: Judicabat quoque Samuel Israël cunctis diebus vitæ suæ:
verses.english: Samuel continued to judge Israel throughout all the days of his life,

verses.latin: et ibat per singulos annos circuiens Bethel, et Galgala, et Masphath, et judicabat Israël in supradictis locis.
verses.english: and each year he would go on a circuit, visiting Bethel, Gilgal, and Mizpah. In these aforementioned places, he would judge Israel, addressing their legal and spiritual needs.

verses.latin: Revertebaturque in Ramatha, ibi enim erat domus ejus, et ibi judicabat Israël: ædificavit etiam ibi altare Domino.
verses.english: He would then return to Ramah, for his home was there, and there he also judged Israel. And, in Ramah, he built an altar to the Lord.

verses.latin: Non inveni.

verses.latin: Venerunt ergo viri Cariathiarim, et adduxerunt arcam Domini, et intulerunt eam in domum Abinadab in Gabaa: Eleazarum autem filium ejus sanctificaverunt ut custodiret arcam Domini.
verses.english: Therefore, the men of Kiriath-jearim came, and they brought the ark of the Lord. They carried it into the house of Abinadab, which was situated on the hill, and they consecrated his son Eleazar to guard the ark of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et factum est ex eo die quo mansit arca Domini in Cariathiarim, multiplicati sunt dies, erat quippe jam annus vicesimus, et requievit omnis domus Israël super Dominum.
verses.english: From the day that the ark of the Lord remained in Kiriath-jearim, many days passed—twenty years had already gone by. And all the house of Israel turned their hearts toward the Lord for guidance and peace.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Samuel ad universam domum Israël, dicens: Si in toto corde vestro revertimini ad Dominum, auferte deos alienos de medio vestri, et Astaroth de finibus vestris: et præparate corda vestra Domino, et servite ei soli, et eruet vos de manu Philisthinorum.
verses.english: Samuel then said to all the house of Israel: 'If you truly return to the Lord with all your heart, then remove the foreign gods from your midst, and take away the idols of Astaroth from your lands. Prepare your hearts solely for the Lord and serve Him alone, and He will deliver you from the power of the Philistines.'

verses.latin: Abstulerunt ergo filii Israël Baalim et Astaroth, et servierunt Domino soli.
verses.english: So the sons of Israel put away the idols of Baal and Astaroth, and they served the Lord alone.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Samuel: Congregamini universi in Masphath, ut orem pro vobis Dominum.
verses.english: Samuel then said, 'Gather all of yourselves at Mizpah, so that I may pray to the Lord on your behalf.'

verses.latin: Et convenerunt in Masphath: et hauserunt aquam, et effuderunt in conspectu Domini, et jejunaverunt in die illa, et dixerunt ibi: Peccavimus Domino. Et judicavit Samuel filios Israël in Masphath.
verses.english: So they gathered at Mizpah. They drew water and poured it out before the Lord as a sign of their repentance, and they fasted on that day. And they confessed there, saying, 'We have sinned against the Lord.' And Samuel presided over the sons of Israel in judgment at Mizpah, guiding them in justice and righteousness.

verses.latin: Audierunt autem Philisthim quod congregati essent filii Israël in Masphath, et ascenderunt principes Philisthinorum contra Israël. Quod cum audissent filii Israël, timuerunt a facie Philisthinorum.
verses.english: Now, the Philistines heard that the sons of Israel were gathered at Mizpah, and the rulers of the Philistines came up to attack Israel. When the sons of Israel heard this, they became very afraid at the approach of the Philistines.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque filii Israël ad Samuelem: Ne cesses pro nobis clamare ad Dominum Deum nostrum, ut salvet nos de manu Philisthinorum.
verses.english: And the sons of Israel said to Samuel, 'Do not stop crying out to the Lord our God on our behalf, that He may save us from the power of the Philistines!'

verses.latin: Et tulit Samuel agnum lactentem unum, et obtulit holocaustum integrum Domino: et clamavit Samuel ad Dominum pro Israël, et exaudivit eum Dominus.
verses.english: Then Samuel took a single suckling lamb and offered it as a whole burnt offering, completely consumed, to the Lord. And Samuel cried out to the Lord on behalf of Israel, and the Lord heard his prayer.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, cum Samuel offerret holocaustum, Philisthim institerunt prælio contra Israël: intonuit autem Dominus super Philisthim die illo voce magna, et conturbati sunt, et cæsi sunt a filiis Israël.
verses.english: Now, as Samuel was offering the burnt offering, the Philistines pressed hard in battle against Israel. But on that very day, the Lord thundered with a mighty voice over the Philistines. They were thrown into utter confusion and were struck down by the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Egredientes ergo filii Israël de Masphath, persecuti sunt Philisthim, et percusserunt eos usque ad locum sub Bethchar.
verses.english: So the sons of Israel went out from Mizpah and pursued the Philistines. They struck them down all the way to the place just below Beth-car.

verses.latin: Et tulit Samuel lapidem unum, et posuit inter Masphath et inter Sen: et vocavit nomen loci illius, Lapis Adjutorii. Dixitque: Hucusque auxiliatus est nobis Dominus.
verses.english: Then Samuel took a single stone and set it between Mizpah and Shen, and he named that place 'The Stone of Help.' He declared, 'Up to this very moment, the Lord has continually helped us!'

verses.latin: Et humiliati sunt Philisthim, nec ultra venerunt in fines Israël: facta est itaque manus Domini super Philisthim cunctis diebus Samuelis.
verses.english: Thus, the Philistines were completely humbled and no longer ventured into the territories of Israel. Indeed, the mighty hand of the Lord was against the Philistines throughout all the days that Samuel lived.

verses.latin: Redditæ sunt etiam civitates quas tulerant Philisthim ab Israël, Israëli, ab Accaron usque Geth, et terminos earum: et eruit Israël de manu Philisthinorum: pax quoque facta est inter Israël et Amorræum.
verses.english: Furthermore, the cities that the Philistines had taken from Israel, from Ekron to Gath, along with their surrounding lands, were all restored to Israel. And Israel was delivered from the power of the Philistines. Peace was also established between Israel and the Amorites.

verses.latin: Judicabat autem Samuel Israël cunctis diebus vitæ suæ.
verses.english: And Samuel continued to judge and guide Israel throughout all the days of his life.

verses.latin: Et ibat per singulos annos circuens Bethel et Galgala et Masphath, et judicabat Israël in eisdem locis.
verses.english: Year after year, he would travel in a circuit to Bethel, Gilgal, and Mizpah, and he would judge Israel in those same places.

verses.latin: Revertebaturque in Ramatha, ibi enim erat domus ejus: ibique judicabat Israël, ædificavit etiam ibi altare Domino.
verses.english: Then he would return to Ramah, for his home was there. And there he also judged Israel, and he built an altar there dedicated to the Lord.

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum senuisset Samuel, posuit filios suos judices Israel.
verses.english: Now it came to pass that when Samuel became old, he then appointed his own sons to be judges over the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Fuitque nomen filii ejus primogeniti Joel, et nomen secundi Abia, judices in Bersabee.
verses.english: And the name of his firstborn son was Joel, and the name of his second son was Abia. These two were judges in Bersabee.

verses.latin: Et non ambulaverunt filii ejus in viis suis: sed declinaverunt post avaritiam, acceperuntque munera, et perverterunt judicium.
verses.english: But his sons did not walk in Samuel's ways of righteous judgment. Instead, they turned aside after greed, accepting bribes and perverting justice.

verses.latin: Congregati ergo universi majores natu Israel, venerunt ad Samuel in Rama.
verses.english: Therefore, all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together and came to Samuel in Rama.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque ei: Ecce tu senuisti, et filii tui non ambulant in viis tuis: nunc ergo constitue nobis regem, ut judicet nos, sicut universae habent nationes.
verses.english: And they said to him: "Behold, you have grown old, and your sons do not walk in your ways. Now therefore, appoint for us a king to govern us, just as all the nations around us have kings."

verses.latin: Et displicuit sermo in oculis Samuelis, eo quod dixissent: Da nobis regem, ut judicet nos. Et oravit Samuel ad Dominum.
verses.english: This word displeased Samuel, because they had said: "Give us a king to govern us." And Samuel prayed to the Lord about this matter.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Dominus ad Samuel: Audi vocem populi in omnibus quae loquuntur tibi: non enim te abjecerunt, sed me abjecerunt, ne regnem super eos.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Samuel: "Listen to the voice of the people in all that they say to you. For they have not rejected you as their leader; rather, they have rejected Me, so that I should not reign over them as their true King."

verses.latin: Juxta omnia opera sua quae fecerunt, a die qua eduxi eos de Ægypto usque ad diem hanc: sicut dereliquerunt me, et servierunt diis alienis, ita et tibi faciunt.
verses.english: According to all their works which they have done, from the day I brought them out of Egypt even to this very day— just as they have forsaken Me and served other gods— so also are they doing to you, My servant Samuel.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo audi vocem eorum: verumtamen contestare eos, et prædic eis jus regis, qui regnaturus est super eos.
verses.english: Now therefore, listen to their voice. Nevertheless, solemnly warn them, and declare to them the rights of the king who shall reign over them.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Samuel omnia verba Domini ad populum, qui petierat a se regem.
verses.english: So Samuel spoke all the words of the Lord to the people who had asked him for a king.

verses.latin: Et ait: Hoc erit jus regis qui imperaturus est vobis: filios vestros tollet, et ponet in curribus suis, et faciet sibi equites et præcursores quadrigarum suarum.
verses.english: And he said: "This will be the nature of the king who is to reign over you: He will take your sons and appoint them for his chariots and make them his horsemen, and they will run before his chariots as heralds."

verses.latin: Et constituet sibi tribunos, et centuriones, et aratores agrorum suorum, et messores vitis, et factores armorum et curruum suorum.
verses.english: And he will appoint for himself commanders of thousands and commanders of fifties, and those to plow his fields and to reap his harvests, and to make his instruments of war and his chariots.

verses.latin: Filias quoque vestras faciet sibi unguentarias, et focarias, et panificas.
verses.english: He will also take your daughters and make them perfumers, and cooks, and bakers for his royal household.

verses.latin: Agros quoque vestros, et vineas, et oliveta optima tollet, et dabit servis suis.
verses.english: He will take your best fields, and your vineyards, and your olive groves, and give them to his servants.

verses.latin: Sed et sementem vestram, et decimas vinearum auferet, ut det eunuchis et famulis suis.
verses.english: He will also take a tenth of your seed and of your vineyards, to give to his eunuchs and his servants.

verses.latin: Servos quoque vestros, et ancillas, et juvenes optimos, et asinos vestros tollet, et ponet in opere suo.
verses.english: He will take your male and female servants, and your best young men, and your donkeys, and put them to his own work.

verses.latin: Greges vestros decimabit, vosque eritis ei servi.
verses.english: He will take a tenth of your flocks, and you yourselves will be his servants, serving him directly.

verses.latin: Et clamabitis in die illa a facie regis vestri, quem elegistis vobis: et non exaudiet vos Dominus in die illa, quia petistis vobis regem.
verses.english: And you will cry out in that day because of your king whom you have chosen for yourselves, and the Lord will not hear you in that day, because you have asked for a king for yourselves.

verses.latin: Noluit autem populus audire vocem Samuel, sed dixerunt: Nequaquam: sed rex erit super nos.
verses.english: But the people refused to listen to the voice of Samuel. Instead, they said: "No, this is not so; but a king shall be over us!"

verses.latin: Et nos erimus sicut omnes gentes: et judicabit nos rex noster, et ingredietur ante nos, et pugnabit bella nostra pro nobis.
verses.english: They continued: "And we will be like all the other nations, and our king will judge us, and he will go out before us and fight our battles for us."

verses.latin: Et audivit Samuel cuncta verba populi, et locutus est in auribus Domini.
verses.english: And Samuel heard all the words of the people, and he spoke them in the ears of the Lord.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Samuel: Audi vocem eorum, et constitue super eos regem. Et ait Samuel ad viros Israel: Unusquisque in civitatem suam revertatur.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Samuel: "Listen to their voice and appoint a king over them." Then Samuel said to the men of Israel: "Each man among you, return to his own city." This was to prepare for the selection of the king.

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum senuisset Samuel, posuit filios suos judices Israël.
verses.english: Now it happened that when Samuel had grown old, he appointed his sons to be judges over Israel.

verses.latin: Fuitque nomen filii ejus primogeniti Joël, et nomen secundi Abia, judicantium in Bersabee.
verses.english: His firstborn son was named Joel, and his second son was named Abiah. They were serving as judges in Beersheba.

verses.latin: Et non ambulaverunt filii ejus in viis ejus: sed declinaverunt post avaritiam, et acceperunt munera, perverteruntque judicium.
verses.english: But his sons did not follow his ways. Instead, they turned to pursue greed, accepted bribes, and twisted justice.

verses.latin: Irrexit itaque omnis major natu de Israël, et venerunt ad Samuelem in Ramatha.
verses.english: Therefore, all the elders of Israel gathered and came to Samuel in Ramah.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque ei: Ecce tu senuisti, et filii tui non ambulant in viis tuis: nunc ergo constitue nobis regem, ut judicet nos, sicut universae habent nationes.
verses.english: And they said to him: 'Look, you have grown old, and your sons are not following your example. So now, appoint a king for us to govern us, just as all the other nations have.'

verses.latin: Et displicuit sermo in oculis Samuelis, eo quod dixissent: Da nobis regem, ut judicet nos. Et oravit Samuel ad Dominum.
verses.english: This request displeased Samuel because they had said, 'Give us a king to govern us.' So Samuel prayed to the Lord.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Dominus ad Samuelem: Audi vocem populi in omnibus quae loquuntur tibi: non enim te abjecerunt, sed me abjecerunt ne regnem super eos.
verses.english: But the Lord said to Samuel: 'Listen to everything the people are telling you. For they have not rejected you, but they have rejected Me from being their King.'

verses.latin: Juxta omnia opera sua quae fecerunt, a die qua eduxi eos de Ægypto usque ad diem hanc: sicut dereliquerunt me, et servierunt diis alienis, sic faciunt etiam tibi.
verses.english: Just as they have done all their evil deeds from the day I brought them out of Egypt until this very day—forsaking Me and serving foreign gods—so they are doing to you now.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo audi vocem eorum: verumtamen contestare eos, et prædic eis jus regis, qui regnaturus est super eos.
verses.english: So now, listen to what they say. But solemnly warn them and tell them about the ways of the king who will reign over them.

verses.latin: Narravit ergo Samuel omnes sermones Domini populo, qui petierat a se regem.
verses.english: So Samuel told all the words of the Lord to the people who had asked him for a king.

verses.latin: Et ait: Hoc erit jus regis qui imperaturus est vobis: filios vestros tollet, et ponet in curribus suis, et faciet sibi equites et præcursores curruum suorum,
verses.english: And he said: 'This will be the manner of the king who will rule over you: He will take your sons and assign them to his chariots, making them his horsemen and his runners to go before his chariots.'

verses.latin: et constituet sibi tribunos et centuriones, et aratores agrorum suorum, et messores vitis ejus, et fabros armorum et curruum suorum.
verses.english: He will also appoint for himself commanders of thousands and commanders of fifties. He will make your sons his field workers, to plow his ground and to reap his harvest, and to make his weapons and chariots.

verses.latin: Filias quoque vestras tollet in unguentarias, et in focarias, et in panificas.
verses.english: He will also take your daughters to be perfumers, cooks, and bakers for him.

verses.latin: Agros quoque vestros, et vineas, et oliveta optima tollet, et dabit servis suis.
verses.english: He will take your best fields, vineyards, and olive groves, and give them to his own servants.

verses.latin: Sed et semina vestrorum, et vinearum decimabit, ut det eunuchis et famulis suis.
verses.english: He will also take a tenth of your grain and of your vineyards to give to his officials and servants.

verses.latin: Servos quoque vestros, et ancillas, et juvenes optimos, et asinos vestros tollet, et ponet in opus suum.
verses.english: He will take your male servants and female servants, your finest young men, and your donkeys, and use them for his own work.

verses.latin: Greges vestros decimabit, vosque eritis ei servi.
verses.english: He will take a tenth of your flocks, and you yourselves will become his slaves.

verses.latin: Et clamabitis in die illa a facie regis vestri, quem elegistis vobis: et non exaudiet vos Dominus in die illa.
verses.english: And you will cry out in that day because of your king whom you have chosen for yourselves, but the Lord will not answer you in that day.

verses.latin: Et noluit populus audire vocem Samuelis, sed dixerunt: Nequaquam: sed rex erit super nos.
verses.english: But the people refused to listen to Samuel. They said: 'Absolutely not! There must be a king over us.'

verses.latin: Et nos erimus sicut omnes nationes: et judicabit nos rex noster, et ingredietur ante nos, et pugnabit bella nostra pro nobis.
verses.english: We want to be like all the other nations. Our king will govern us, he will go out before us, and he will fight our battles for us.

verses.latin: Et audivit Samuel cunctos sermones populi, et locutus est in auribus Domini.
verses.english: Samuel heard all the words of the people and reported them to the Lord.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Dominus ad Samuelem: Audi vocem eorum, et constitue super eos regem. Et ait Samuel ad viros Israël: Vadat unusquisque in civitatem suam.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Samuel: 'Listen to what they say, and appoint a king over them.' So Samuel said to the men of Israel: 'Everyone may now return home to his own city.'

verses.latin: Erat autem vir de BenJamin nomine Cis filius Abiel filii Seror filii Bechorath filii Aphiah filii viri Jemini fortis robore.
verses.english: Now there was a man from the tribe of Benjamin named Kish, the son of Abiel, who was the son of Zeror, the son of Becorath, the son of Aphiah. He was a mighty man of valor from Benjamin.

verses.latin: Et erat ei filius nomine Saul electus et bonus, et non erat vir de filiis Israël pulchrior illo: et ab humero et supra eminebat super omnem populum.
verses.english: He had a son named Saul, a handsome young man. There was no man among the Israelites more handsome than he; he stood a head taller than any of the people.

verses.latin: Periisse autem asinas Cis patris Saul, dixit Cis ad Saul filium suum: Tolle tecum unum de pueris, et consurge, vade, et quære asinas.
verses.english: Now the donkeys of Kish, Saul’s father, had gone astray. So Kish said to Saul his son: 'Take one of the servants with you, go and search for the donkeys.'

verses.latin: Qui cum transissent montem Ephraim, et terram Salisa, et non invenissent, transierunt et terram Salim, et non erant: necnon et terram Jemini, et nihil invenerunt.
verses.english: They passed through the hill country of Ephraim, then through the land of Shalishah, but they found nothing. Next, they passed through the land of Shaalim, but the donkeys were not there. Then they passed through the land of Benjamin, and found nothing.

verses.latin: Cum vero venissent in terram Suph, dixit Saul ad puerum suum qui erat cum eo: Veni, et revertamur, ne forte pater meus dimissis asinis sollicitus sit de nobis.
verses.english: When they reached the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant who was with him: 'Come, let us turn back, lest my father, having stopped worrying about the donkeys, should now become anxious about us.'

verses.latin: Qui ait illi: Ecce vir Dei est in civitate hac, vir nobilis: omne quod loquitur, absque ambiguitate provenit: nunc ergo eamus illuc, si forte indicet nobis de via nostra, propter quam venimus.
verses.english: The servant replied: 'Look, there is a man of God in this city, a very respected man. Everything he says certainly comes true. So now, let us go there. Perhaps he can tell us where to go to find what we came for.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Saul ad puerum suum: Ecce si ierimus, quid dabimus viro Dei? Panis defecit in saccis nostris, et sportula non est ut demus homini Dei, nec quidquam habemus.
verses.english: Saul then said to his servant: 'But if we go, what can we give the man of God? We have run out of bread in our bags, and we have no present to give to the man of God. We have nothing at all.'

verses.latin: Rursum respondens puer dixit ad Saul, et ait: Ecce inventa est in manu mea quarta pars sicli argenti: demus viro Dei ut indicet nobis viam nostram.
verses.english: Again, the servant answered Saul and said: 'Look, I happen to have a fourth of a shekel of silver with me. Let’s give that to the man of God so he can tell us where to go.'

verses.latin: Olim in Israël sic loquebatur unusquisque ad proximum suum, quando ibat consulere Deum: Venite, et eamus ad videntem. Qui enim loquitur propheta, hodie vocabatur olim videns.
verses.english: This is how people used to speak in Israel: when someone went to inquire of God, they would say, 'Come, let us go to the seer.' For the one who is now called a prophet was formerly called a seer.

verses.latin: Et dixit Saul ad puerum suum: Optimus est sermo tuus: veni, eamus. Et ierunt in civitatem in qua erat vir Dei.
verses.english: Saul then said to his servant: 'That’s a good idea; come, let us go.' So they went to the city where the man of God was.

verses.latin: Cum ascenderent collem civitatis, obviae fuerunt eis puellae exeuntes ad hauriendam aquam, et dixerunt eis: Numquid est hic videns?
verses.english: As they were going up the hill to the city, they met young women coming out to draw water, and they asked them: 'Is the seer here?'

verses.latin: Quæ responderunt eis, et dixerunt: Est, ecce ante te est: festinato nunc. Hodie enim venit in civitatem, quia sacrificium est hodie populo in excelso.
verses.english: They answered them: 'Yes, he is right ahead of you. Hurry now! He came to the city today because there is a sacrifice for the people on the high place.'

verses.latin: Cuius adventu statim comedit populus: non enim comedit donec ille veniat, et benedicat hostiae: et tunc comedunt qui vocati sunt. Nunc ergo conscendite, quia hodie ipsum invenietis.
verses.english: As soon as he arrives, the people will eat. For they do not eat until he comes and blesses the sacrifice, and then those who are invited eat. So go up now, because today you will find him.

verses.latin: Et ascenderunt in civitatem. Cum autem illi ingrederentur medium civitatis, ecce Samuel egrediebatur obviam eis, ut ascenderet in excelsum.
verses.english: So they went up to the city. As they were entering the city, Samuel was coming out to meet them, on his way up to the high place.

verses.latin: Dominus autem revelaverat auriculam Samuelis ante unam diem quam veniret Saul, dicens:
verses.english: Now the Lord had secretly informed Samuel the day before Saul came, saying:

verses.latin: Hac ipsa hora cras mittam ad te virum de terra BenJamin, et unges eum ducem super populum meum Israël: et salvabit populum meum de manu Philisthinorum: quia respexi populum meum, quoniam pervenit clamor eorum ad me.
verses.english: About this time tomorrow I will send you a man from the land of Benjamin, and you shall anoint him to be commander over My people Israel. He will save My people from the power of the Philistines, for I have seen My people’s affliction, and their cry has reached Me.

verses.latin: Cumque vidisset Samuel Saul, Dominus ait ei: Ecce vir quem dixeram tibi: hic regnabit super populum meum.
verses.english: When Samuel saw Saul, the Lord said to him: 'There is the man of whom I spoke to you! This one shall rule over My people.'

verses.latin: Et accessit Saul ad Samuelem in media porta, et ait: Indica, oro, mihi ubi sit domus videntis.
verses.english: Then Saul approached Samuel in the middle of the gate and said: 'Please tell me, where is the house of the seer?'

verses.latin: Fuit vir de BenJamin nomine Cis filius Abiel filii Seror filii Bechorath filii Aphiah filii cujusdam viri Jemini fortis robore.
verses.english: There was a man from the tribe of Benjamin whose name was Kish. He was the son of Abiel, who was the son of Zeror, who was the son of Bechorath, who was the son of Aphiah. Kish was also the son of a certain Benjamite man who was mighty in strength.

verses.latin: Et erat ei filius vocabulo Saul, electus et bonus, et non erat vir de filiis Israel pulchrior illo: ab humero et sursum eminebat super omnem populum.
verses.english: Kish had a son whose name was Saul. Saul was an excellent and good man, and there was no one among the sons of Israel more handsome than him. From his shoulders upwards, he was taller than all the people.

verses.latin: Perierant autem asinae Cis patris Saul: dixitque Cis ad Saul filium suum: Sume tecum unum de pueris, et consurge, vade, et quære asinas.
verses.english: However, some of the donkeys belonging to Kish, Saul's father, had wandered off and were lost. So Kish said to his son Saul: 'Take one of the young servants with you, go out, and search for the donkeys.'

verses.latin: Qui cum pertransissent montem Ephraim, et terram Salisa, et non invenissent: transierunt etiam terram Salim, et non erant: necnon et terram Jemini, et nihil invenerunt.
verses.english: They traveled through the hill country of Ephraim, and then through the land of Shalisha, but they didn't find the donkeys there. They then crossed through the land of Shaalim, but the donkeys were not there either. Next, they went through the land of Benjamin itself, but they found nothing.

verses.latin: Cumque venissent in terram Suph, dixit Saul ad puerum suum qui erat cum eo: Veni, et revertamur, ne forte pater meus dimissus asinarum, sollicitus sit pro nobis.
verses.english: When they arrived in the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant who was with him: 'Come, let's go back now.' 'Otherwise, my father might stop worrying about the lost donkeys and start worrying about us instead.'

verses.latin: Cui respondit puer: Ecce est vir Dei in civitate hac, vir nobilis: omne quod loquitur, in eo venit: nunc ergo eamus illuc, si forte indicet nobis de via nostra, propter quam venimus.
verses.english: The servant answered him: 'Look, there's a man of God in this city. He is a very respected prophet.' 'Everything he says comes true, exactly as he says it.' 'Let's go there now; perhaps he can tell us about our journey and where to find the donkeys.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Saul ad puerum suum: Ecce si ierimus, quid dabimus viro? panis defecit in saccis nostris, et sportula non est ut demus homini Dei, nec quicquam habemus.
verses.english: Saul then said to his servant: 'But if we go, what can we give the man?' 'We've run out of bread in our bags, and we have no small gift to offer to this man of God.' 'We don't have anything at all left.'

verses.latin: Rursum respondit puer Sauli, et ait: Ecce quarta pars sicli argenti est mecum, quam dabo viro Dei ut indicet nobis viam nostram.
verses.english: The servant replied to Saul again and said: 'Look, I have a quarter of a shekel of silver with me.' 'I can give that to the man of God so he can tell us where to go.'

verses.latin: Olim haec erat consuetudo in Israel: quando ibant ad consulendum Deum, sic dicebant: Venite, et eamus ad videntem. Qui enim hodie propheta dicitur, olim vocabatur videns.
verses.english: In earlier times, this was the custom in Israel: when people went to consult God, they would say: 'Come, let's go to the seer.' This is because the one who is called a 'prophet' today was formerly called a 'seer'.

verses.latin: Et dixit Saul ad puerum suum: Optimus est sermo tuus: veni, eamus. Et ierunt in civitatem in qua erat vir Dei.
verses.english: Saul said to his servant: 'Your suggestion is an excellent one. Come, let's go.' So they went to the city where the man of God was living.

verses.latin: Cum ascenderent clivum civitatis, obviae fuerunt eis puellae exeuntes ad hauriendam aquam, et dixerunt eis: Num hic est videns?
verses.english: As they were climbing the hill leading up to the city, they met some young women coming out to draw water. Saul and his servant asked them: 'Is the seer here in this place?'

verses.latin: Quæ responderunt eis, et dixerunt: Est, ecce ante te est: festinato nunc, hodie enim est sacrificium populi in excelso.
verses.english: The young women answered them: 'Yes, he is! He's just ahead of you.' 'Hurry now, because today the people are making a sacrifice at the high place, and he will be there.'

verses.latin: Mox ut introieritis civitatem, statim invenietis eum antequam ascendat excelsum ad vescendum. Neque enim populus comedet, donec ille veniat, et benedicat hostiæ: et tunc comedent qui vocati sunt. Nunc ergo conscendite, quia hodie invenietis eum.
verses.english: As soon as you enter the city, you will find him at once, before he goes up to the high place to eat the sacrificial meal. The people will not eat until he arrives and blesses the sacrifice. Only then will those who have been invited to the feast eat. So go up now, because you will certainly find him today.

verses.latin: Et ascenderunt in civitatem. Cumque illi ingrederentur urbem, ecce Samuel egrediebatur obviam eis, ut iret in excelsum.
verses.english: So they went up to the city. As they were entering the city, behold, Samuel was coming out to meet them on his way to the high place.

verses.latin: Dominus autem revelaverat auriculæ Samuelis ante unam diem quam veniret Saul, dicens:
verses.english: Now, the Lord had revealed a message to Samuel just one day before Saul arrived, saying:

verses.latin: Hac ipsa hora cras mittam ad te virum de terra Benjamin, et unges eum ducem super populum meum Israel: et ipse liberabit populum meum de manu Philisthinorum: quia respexi populum meum, quoniam pervenit clamor eorum ad me.
verses.english: 'At this very time tomorrow, I will send you a man from the land of Benjamin.' 'You are to anoint him as the chosen leader over My people, Israel.' 'He himself will deliver My people from the hand of the Philistines, because I have looked upon My people's suffering, and their cry for help has reached Me.'

verses.latin: Cumque aspexisset Samuel Saulem, Dominus ait ei: Ecce vir quem dixi tibi: iste dominabitur populo meo.
verses.english: When Samuel saw Saul approaching, the Lord said to him: 'Behold the man of whom I spoke to you!' 'This is the one who will rule over My people, Israel.'

verses.latin: Accessit autem Saul ad Samuelem in medio portæ, et ait: Indica, quæso, mihi, ubi est domus videntis.
verses.english: Saul then approached Samuel, right in the middle of the city gate, and asked: 'Please tell me, where is the house of the seer?'

verses.latin: Et respondit Samuel Sauli, dicens: Ego sum videns: ascende ante me in excelsum, ut comedatis mecum hodie, et dimittam te mane, et omnia quæ sunt in corde tuo, indicabo tibi.
verses.english: Samuel answered Saul, saying: 'I am the seer you are looking for!' 'Go up ahead of me to the high place so you can eat the sacrificial meal with me today.' 'I will send you on your way tomorrow morning, and I will reveal to you everything that is on your heart—the things you are concerned about.'

verses.latin: Et de asinis quas perdidisti noli sollicitus esse: quia inventæ sunt. Et cujus erunt optima quæque Israel? nonne tua et omnis domus patris tui?
verses.english: And as for the donkeys you lost three days ago, don't worry about them, because they have already been found. Now, to whom will all the best things of Israel belong in the future? Is it not to you and to all the household of your father?

verses.latin: Respondens autem Saul, ait: Numquid non ego sum filius Jemini de minima tribu Israel, et cognatio mea novissima inter omnes familias de tribu BenJamin? quare ergo locutus es mihi sermonem istum?
verses.english: Saul answered, saying: 'Am I not a Benjamite, from the smallest tribe in Israel?' 'And is not my family the least significant among all the families of the tribe of Benjamin?' 'Why, then, do you speak such words to me, suggesting I am worthy of such honor?'

verses.latin: Assumens ergo Samuel Saulem et puerum ejus, introduxit eos in triclinium, et dedit eis locum primum inter eos qui fuerant invitati: erant enim quasi triginta viri.
verses.english: Then Samuel took Saul and his servant and led them into the banquet hall. He gave them the most honored place among all those who had been invited to the feast, which included about thirty men.

verses.latin: Dixitque Samuel cetero cuoco, dicens: Da partem quam dedi tibi, et præcepi tibi ut seponeres seorsum.
verses.english: Samuel then said to the cook: 'Bring the portion of the meat that I specifically told you to set aside separately.'

verses.latin: Tulit ergo cocus armum, et posuit ante Saul. Dixitque Samuel: Ecce quod residuum est, pone ante te, et comede: quia de proposito servatum est tibi, quando populum vocavi. Et comedit Saul cum Samuele in die illa.
verses.english: So the cook brought the choice cut—a leg or shoulder portion—and placed it before Saul. Samuel said: 'Look, this is what was reserved. Set it before you and eat, for it was intentionally kept for you when I invited the people to this sacrificial meal.' So Saul ate with Samuel on that day.

verses.latin: Et descenderunt de excelso in oppidum, et locutus est cum Saul in solario.
verses.english: Afterward, they came down from the high place into the town, and Samuel spoke with Saul on the rooftop of his house.

verses.latin: Et surrexerunt diluculo: et jam sole oriente vocavit Samuel Saulem in solario, dicens: Surge, ut dimittam te. Et surrexit Saul: et egressi sunt ambo, ipse et Samuel foras.
verses.english: They rose very early in the morning, and as the sun began to rise, Samuel called to Saul on the rooftop, saying: 'Get up now, so I can send you on your way.' Saul then rose, and both he and Samuel went outside the city.

verses.latin: Cumque descenderent in extremam partem civitatis, Samuel dixit ad Saul: Dic puero ut antecedat nos, et vadat: tu autem subsiste paulisper, ut ostendam tibi verbum Domini.
verses.english: As they were going down to the edge of the city, Samuel said to Saul: 'Tell your servant to go on ahead of us.' 'But you, stand still for a little while, so I can reveal to you the word of the Lord.'

verses.latin: Et tulit Samuel lenticulam olei et effudit super caput ejus, et osculatus est eum, et ait: Ecce unxit te Dominus super haereditatem suam in principem.
verses.english: Samuel took a small flask of oil and poured it over Saul’s head. He then kissed Saul, showing his acceptance and loyalty. Samuel said to Saul: "See, the Lord has anointed you—this means you are chosen and set apart—to be a prince over His inheritance, which is the nation of Israel."

verses.latin: Cum abieris a me hodie, invenies duos viros juxta sepulchrum Rachel in finibus Benjamin, in meridie: dicentque tibi: Inventae sunt asinae ad quas ieras quaerendas: et ecce dimisit pater tuus asinas, et sollicitus est pro vobis, dicens: Quid faciam de filio meo?
verses.english: As soon as you leave me today, you will find two men near Rachel’s tomb—which is located in the southern part of Benjamin’s territory. They will tell you: 'The donkeys you went searching for have been found.' And then they will add: 'Look, your father has stopped worrying about the donkeys and is now anxious about you all, saying: "What should I do about my son?"'

verses.latin: Et cum abieris inde, et ultra transieris, et veneris ad quercum Thabor: invenient te ibi tres viri ascendentes ad Deum in Bethel, duos portantes haedos, et unum ferentem tres tortas panis, et unum portantem lagenam vini.
verses.english: When you leave that place and travel a bit further, you will arrive at the oak of Tabor. Three men will meet you there, on their way to worship God in Bethel. Two of them will be carrying young goats, one will be carrying three loaves of bread, and another will be carrying a flask of wine.

verses.latin: Et salutabunt te, et dabunt tibi duos panes, et accipies de manu eorum.
verses.english: They will greet you, and then they will offer you two loaves of bread, which you must accept from their hands.

verses.latin: Post haec venies in collem Dei, ubi est statio Philisthinorum: et cum ingressus fueris ibi urbem, obviam habebis gregem prophetarum descendentium de excelso, et ante eos psalterium, et tympanum, et fistulam, et citharam, prophetantes.
verses.english: After this, you will come to the hill of God—a place where the Lord is worshipped. There is a Philistine garrison stationed there. When you enter the city, you will meet a group of prophets coming down from the high place of worship. They will have a psaltery, a drum, a flute, and a harp playing before them, and they will be prophesying—meaning they will be in a state of inspired worship, singing, and possibly speaking under divine influence.

verses.latin: Et insiliet in te spiritus Domini, et prophetabis cum eis, et mutaberis in virum alterum.
verses.english: Then the Spirit of the Lord will powerfully rush upon you. You will prophesy with them, and you will be completely changed into a different kind of man—one fit for the role of king.

verses.latin: Quando ergo venerint signa haec omnia tibi, fac quaecumque invenerit manus tua, quia Dominus tecum est.
verses.english: So when all these signs come to pass for you, act decisively and do whatever you find necessary to do, because the Lord is with you.

verses.latin: Et descendes ante me in Galgala (ego quippe descendam ad te), ut offeras holocausta, et immoles victimas pacificas: septem diebus expectabis, donec veniam ad te, et ostendam tibi quae agas.
verses.english: Then you will go down to Gilgal before me—for I will indeed come down to meet you there—so that you may offer burnt offerings and sacrifice peace offerings. You must wait for seven days until I come to you, and then I will show you what you are to do.

verses.latin: Itaque cum se separasset a Samuele, vertit ei Deus cor aliud, et venerunt omnia signa haec in die illa.
verses.english: So when Saul turned to leave Samuel, God gave him a new heart—a changed inner disposition suitable for his new calling. And all these signs Samuel foretold came to pass on that very day.

verses.latin: Et venerunt ad collem; et ecce cuneus prophetarum obviam ei, et insilivit in eum spiritus Domini, et prophetavit in medio eorum.
verses.english: When Saul and his servant arrived at the hill, suddenly a company of prophets met him. The Spirit of the Lord powerfully rushed upon him, and he began to prophesy among them.

verses.latin: Audierunt omnes qui noverant eum heri et nudiustertius, quod prophetaverat cum prophetis, et dixerunt ad invicem: Quid accidit filio Cis? num et Saul inter prophetas?
verses.english: All who had known Saul previously, recently or in the past, heard that he was prophesying with the prophets, and they said to one another in surprise: "What has happened to Kish’s son? Is Saul also among the prophets now?"

verses.latin: Et respondit alter de turba, et dixit: Et quis est pater eorum? Propterea versum est in proverbium: Num et Saul inter prophetas?
verses.english: Then one from the crowd answered and said, understanding the spiritual source of prophecy: "And who is the father of all prophets but God?" For this reason, it became a common proverb: "Is Saul also among the prophets?"

verses.latin: Et cessavit prophetare, et venit ad excelsum.
verses.english: When he finished prophesying, he went to the high place of worship.

verses.latin: Dixit autem patruus Saul ad eum, et ad puerum ejus: Quo abistis? Qui responderunt: Quaerebant asinas: quas cum non invenissemus, venimus ad Samuelem.
verses.english: Saul's uncle then asked him and his servant: "Where did you go?" They answered: "We were looking for the donkeys. When we couldn't find them, we came to Samuel."

verses.latin: Et ait patruus Saul: Indica mihi quid dixerit tibi Samuel.
verses.english: Saul’s uncle said: "Tell me, what did Samuel say to you?"

verses.latin: Et ait Saul ad patruum suum: Indicavit nobis quia inventae essent asinae. De sermone autem regni non indicavit ei, quem locutus illi fuerat Samuel.
verses.english: Saul replied to his uncle: "He merely told us that the donkeys had been found." But concerning the matter of the kingship, which Samuel had discussed with him, Saul did not tell his uncle anything.

verses.latin: Et convocavit Samuel populum ad Dominum in Maspha:
verses.english: Then Samuel summoned all the people of Israel to assemble before the Lord at Mizpah.

verses.latin: et ait ad filios Israel: Haec dicit Dominus Deus Israel: Ego eduxi Israel de Aegypto, et erui vos de manu Aegyptiorum, et de manu omnium regnorum, et eorum qui affligebant vos.
verses.english: And he said to the children of Israel: "Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: 'I myself brought Israel out of Egypt, and I rescued you from the power of the Egyptians and from the power of all the kingdoms and those who oppressed you.'"

verses.latin: Vos autem hodie projecistis Deum vestrum, qui solus salvavit vos de universis malis et tribulationibus vestris, et dixistis: Nequaquam, sed regem constitue super nos. Nunc ergo state coram Domino per tribus vestras, et per millia vestra.
verses.english: "But today you have rejected your God—the very One who alone has saved you from all your troubles and distresses. Instead, you have said: 'No, we insist, set a king over us.' Therefore, now present yourselves before the Lord, arranged by your tribes and by your family units."

verses.latin: Et applicuit Samuel omnes tribus Israel, et cecidit sors tribus Benjamin.
verses.english: So Samuel had all the tribes of Israel come forward, and by the casting of lots, the tribe of Benjamin was chosen.

verses.latin: Et applicuit tribum Benjamin et cognationes ejus, et cecidit sors familiae Metri, et cecidit sors Saul filii Cis. Et quaesierunt eum, et non est inventus.
verses.english: Then Samuel brought forward the tribe of Benjamin by its clans, and the lot fell on the Matrite family. Finally, by lot, Saul, the son of Kish, was chosen. But when they looked for him, he could not be found.

verses.latin: Et consuluerunt ultra Dominum utrum venturus esset illuc. Et respondit Dominus: Ecce absconditus est juxta sarcinas.
verses.english: So they further inquired of the Lord: "Will the man indeed come forward here?" The Lord answered: "Look, he is hiding among the baggage."

verses.latin: Et cucurrerunt, et tulerunt eum inde. Stetitque in medio populi, et altior fuit universo populo ab humero et sursum.
verses.english: So they ran and brought him out from there. When Saul stood among the people, he was taller than everyone else, from the shoulder upward, an imposing figure.

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel ad omnem populum: Certe videtis quem elegit Dominus, quoniam non sit similis illi in universo populo. Et acclamavit omnis populus, et ait: Vivat rex.
verses.english: Then Samuel said to all the people: "Do you not see the one whom the Lord has chosen? There is no one like him among all the people!" And all the people shouted with great acclaim, saying: "Long live the King!"

verses.latin: Locutus est autem Samuel ad populum legem regni, et scripsit in libro, et reposuit coram Domino: et dimisit Samuel omnem populum singulos in domum suam.
verses.english: Then Samuel spoke to the people about the rights and duties of the kingship, which he then wrote in a book and laid up before the Lord as a permanent record. After this, Samuel sent all the people away, each person returning to their own home.

verses.latin: Sed et Saul abiit in domum suam in Gabaa: et abierunt cum eo pars exercitus, quorum tetigerat Deus corda.
verses.english: Saul also went home to Gibeah, and a company of men whose hearts God had touched went with him, becoming his loyal followers.

verses.latin: Filii vero Belial dixerunt: Num salvare poterit nos iste? Et despexerunt eum, et non attulerunt ei munera: at ille dissimulabat se audire.
verses.english: But some worthless men—called "sons of Belial"—said: "How can this man save us?" They despised him and did not bring him customary gifts to honor him as king. However, Saul wisely pretended not to hear their insults.

verses.latin: Et tulit Samuel lenticulam olei, et effudit super caput ejus, et osculatus est eum, et ait: Ecce unxit te Dominus super hereditatem suam in principem.
verses.english: Then Samuel took a small flask of oil, poured it over Saul's head, and then kissed him, saying: "Look, the Lord has anointed you as prince over His own people, His inheritance."

verses.latin: Cum abieris a me hodie, invenies duos viros juxta sepulchrum Rachel in finibus Benjamin in meridie, loquentes tibi: Inventae sunt asinae quas abieras ut quaereres: et ecce invenit pater tuus asinas, et sollicitus est pro vobis, et dimisit cogitationem asinorum.
verses.english: When you leave me today, you will meet two men near Rachel's tomb, in the territory of Benjamin, towards the south. They will say to you: 'The donkeys you went to search for have been found.' And behold, your father has found the donkeys, and he is worried about you both, and has stopped thinking about the donkeys.

verses.latin: Et cum processeris inde, et ultra transieris, et veneris ad quercum Thabor: invenient te ibi tres viri ascendentes ad Deum in Bethel, unus portans tres haedos, et alter tres panis tortas, et alius lagenam vini.
verses.english: And when you have gone on from there, and passed further, and come to the oak of Tabor, three men will meet you there, going up to God at Bethel. One will be carrying three young goats, another, three loaves of bread, and another, a flask of wine.

verses.latin: Salutaverintque te, et dabunt tibi duos panes: et accipies de manu eorum.
verses.english: They will greet you and offer you two loaves of bread, and you shall take them from their hand.

verses.latin: Post haec venies in collem Dei, ubi est statio Philisthinorum: et cum ingressus fueris ibi urbem, obviam habebis cuneum prophetarum descendentium de excelso, et ante eos psalterium, et tympanum, et tibiam, et citharam, et ipsos prophetantes.
verses.english: After this, you will come to the hill of God, where the Philistine garrison is located. And when you enter the city there, you will meet a company of prophets coming down from the high place. Before them will be a psaltery, a drum, a flute, and a lyre, and they themselves will be prophesying.

verses.latin: Et insiliet in te spiritus Domini, et prophetabis cum eis, et mutaberis in virum alium.
verses.english: Then the Spirit of the Lord will rush upon you, and you will prophesy with them, and you will be changed into another man.

verses.latin: Quando ergo signa haec evenerint tibi, fac omnibus quae invenerit manus tua, quia Dominus tecum est.
verses.english: Therefore, when these signs come to pass for you, do whatever your hand finds to do, because the Lord is with you.

verses.latin: Et descendes ante me in Galgala (ego quippe descendam ad te), et offeres holocaustum, et immolabis victimas pacificas: septem diebus expectabis, donec veniam ad te, et ostendam tibi quid facias.
verses.english: And you shall go down before me to Gilgal — for I myself will come down to you there — and you shall offer burnt offerings and sacrifices of peace offerings. You shall wait seven days, until I come to you, and I will show you what to do.

verses.latin: Itaque cum se ab eo vertisset ut abiret, immutavit illi Deus cor: et venerunt omnia signa haec in die illa.
verses.english: So when he turned his back on him to depart, God changed his heart for him; and all these signs came to pass on that day.

verses.latin: Et venerunt ad collem, et ecce cuneus prophetarum obviam ei, et insilivit in eum spiritus Domini, et prophetavit in medio eorum.
verses.english: And they came to the hill, and behold, a company of prophets met him; and the Spirit of the Lord rushed upon him, and he prophesied in their midst.

verses.latin: Audierunt omnes qui noverant eum heri et nudiustertius, quod prophetaverat cum prophetis, et dixerunt ad invicem: Quid est hoc quod accidit filio Cis? num et Saul inter prophetas?
verses.english: All who knew him previously — for a long time — heard that he had prophesied with the prophets, and they said to one another: 'What is this that has happened to the son of Kish? Is Saul also among the prophets?'

verses.latin: Et respondit alter de turba, et ait: Et quis est pater eorum? Propterea versum est in proverbium: Num et Saul inter prophetas?
verses.english: And one of the crowd responded, saying: 'And who is *their* father then?' — meaning, who are *those* prophets' fathers, that they should be prophets? — For this reason, it became a common saying: 'Is Saul also among the prophets?'

verses.latin: Et cessavit prophetare, et venit ad excelsum.
verses.english: And when he had finished prophesying, he went to the high place.

verses.latin: Dixit autem patruus Saul ad eum et ad puerum ejus: Quo abistis? Qui responderunt: Quaerrere asinas: quas cum non inveniremus, venimus ad Samuelem.
verses.english: Then Saul’s uncle said to him and to his servant boy: 'Where did you go?' They answered: 'To look for the donkeys. And when we couldn't find them, we came to Samuel.'

verses.latin: Et ait patruus Saul: Indica mihi quid dixerit tibi Samuel.
verses.english: And Saul’s uncle said: 'Tell me what Samuel said to you.'

verses.latin: Et ait Saul ad patruum suum: Dixerunt nobis quia inventae essent asinae. De regno autem non indicavit ei, quod locutus esset ei Samuel.
verses.english: And Saul said to his uncle: 'He told us that the donkeys had been found.' But concerning the matter of the kingdom, he did not tell him what Samuel had said to him.

verses.latin: Et convocavit Samuel populum ad Dominum in Maspha:
verses.english: Then Samuel called the people together to the Lord at Mizpah.

verses.latin: et ait ad filios Israel: Haec dicit Dominus Deus Israel: Ego eduxi Israel de Aegypto, et erui vos de manu Aegyptiorum, et de manu omnium regnorum, et qui affligebant vos.
verses.english: And he said to the children of Israel: 'Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: I brought Israel up out of Egypt, and I delivered you from the hand of the Egyptians, and from the hand of all the kingdoms that oppressed you.'

verses.latin: Vos autem hodie projecistis Deum vestrum, qui solus salvavit vos de universis malis et tribulationibus vestris: et dixistis: Nequaquam, sed regem constitue super nos. Nunc ergo state coram Domino per tribus vestras, et per millia vestra.
verses.english: 'But today you have rejected your God, who alone saved you from all your troubles and distresses. And you have said: "No, but set a king over us!" Now therefore, present yourselves before the Lord by your tribes and by your thousands.'

verses.latin: Et applicuit Samuel omnes tribus Israel, et cecidit sors tribus Benjamin.
verses.english: So Samuel brought forward all the tribes of Israel, and the lot fell to the tribe of Benjamin.

verses.latin: Et applicuit tribum Benjamin et cognationes ejus, et cecidit sors cognationi Metri, et pervenit usque ad Saul filium Cis. Et quaesierunt eum, et non est inventus.
verses.english: Then he brought forward the tribe of Benjamin by its clans, and the lot fell to the clan of Matri. And it came down to Saul, the son of Kish. But they searched for him, and he could not be found.

verses.latin: Et consuluerunt ultra Dominum, utrum venisset illuc. Et respondit Dominus: Ecce absconditus est juxta sarcinas.
verses.english: So they inquired further of the Lord, asking if the man had come there. And the Lord answered: 'Behold, he is hidden among the baggage.'

verses.latin: Et cucurrerunt, et tulerunt eum inde. Stetitque in medio populi, et altior fuit universo populo ab umero et sursum.
verses.english: So they ran and brought him from there. And when he stood among the people, he was taller than any of the people from his shoulders upward.

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel ad omnem populum: Certe videtis quem elegit Dominus, quoniam non sit similis illi in universo populo. Et exclamavit omnis populus, et ait: Vivat rex.
verses.english: And Samuel said to all the people: 'Do you see whom the Lord has chosen, that there is no one like him among all the people?' Then all the people shouted and said: 'Long live the King!'

verses.latin: Locutus est ergo Samuel ad populum legem regni, et scripsit in libro, et reposuit coram Domino: et dimisit Samuel omnem populum, singulos in domum suam.
verses.english: Then Samuel explained to the people the rights and duties of the kingdom, and he wrote it in a book and laid it up before the Lord. And Samuel sent all the people away, each man to his own home.

verses.latin: Sed et Saul abiit in domum suam in Gabaa: et abierunt cum eo viri fortissimi, quorum tetigerat Deus corda.
verses.english: But Saul also went home to Gibeah; and with him went valiant men, whose hearts God had touched.

verses.latin: Filii vero Belial dixerunt: Num salvare poterit nos iste? Et despexerunt eum, et non attulerunt ei munera. Ille vero dissimulabat se audire.
verses.english: However, some wicked men said: 'How can this man save us?' And they despised him and brought him no presents. But he pretended not to hear.

verses.latin: Et ascendit Naas Ammanites, et pugnare cœpit adversum Jabes Galaad. Dixeruntque omnes viri Jabes ad Naas: Ine fœdus nobiscum, et serviemus tibi.
verses.english: Nahash the Ammonite advanced and began to fight against Jabesh Gilead. Then all the men of Jabesh said to Nahash: "Make a covenant with us, and we will serve you."

verses.latin: Et respondit ad eos Naas Ammanites: In hoc percutiam vobiscum fœdus, ut eruam omnium vestrum oculos dextros, et ponam vos opprobrium in universo Israël.
verses.english: And Nahash the Ammonite answered them: "I will make this covenant with you, but only if I may gouge out all of your right eyes, and make you a public disgrace in all of Israel."

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ei seniores Jabes: Dimitte nos septem diebus, ut mittamus nuntios in universos fines Israël: et si non fuerit qui nos defendat, exibimus ad te.
verses.english: And the elders of Jabesh said to him: "Give us seven days so that we may send messengers throughout all the borders of Israel. And if there is no one who can defend us, then we will surrender to you."

verses.latin: Venerunt ergo nuntii in Gabaa Saül: et locuti sunt verba hæc audiente populo: et levavit omnis populus vocem suam, et flevit.
verses.english: So the messengers came to Gibeah, the city of Saul, and spoke these words in the hearing of the people. And all the people raised their voice and wept.

verses.latin: Et ecce Saül veniebat, sequens boves de agro: et ait: Quid habet populus, quod plorat? Et narraverunt ei verba virorum Jabes.
verses.english: And behold, Saul was coming, following his oxen from the field. And he said: "What troubles the people, that they weep?" And they told him the words of the men of Jabesh.

verses.latin: Et insilivit spiritus Domini in Saül, cum audisset verba hæc: et iratus est furor ejus vehementer.
verses.english: And the Spirit of the Lord rushed upon Saul when he heard these words, and his anger burned fiercely.

verses.latin: Et assumpsit utrumque jugum boum, et in frusta concidit: misitque in omnes fines Israël per manus nuntiorum, dicens: Quicumque non exierit et secutus fuerit Saül et Samuel, sic fiet bobus ejus. Et irruit pavor Domini super populum, et egressi sunt quasi vir unus.
verses.english: And he took a pair of oxen and cut them into pieces, then sent them throughout all the borders of Israel by the hand of messengers, saying: "Whoever does not come out and follow Saul and Samuel, the same will be done to his oxen." And the fear of the Lord fell upon the people, and they came out as one man.

verses.latin: Et numeravit eos in Bezec: fueruntque filii Israël trecenta millia: viri autem Juda triginta millia.
verses.english: And he counted them at Bezek. And the sons of Israel were three hundred thousand men, but the men of Judah were thirty thousand.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt nuntiis qui venerant: Sic dicetis viris Jabes Galaad: Cras erit vobis salus, cum incaluerit sol. Venerunt ergo nuntii, et nuntiaverunt viris Jabes: et lætati sunt.
verses.english: And they said to the messengers who had come: "Thus you shall say to the men of Jabesh Gilead: 'Tomorrow, deliverance will be yours when the sun grows hot'"—meaning, after the morning attack. So the messengers came and announced it to the men of Jabesh, and they rejoiced.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt viri Jabes: Cras exibimus ad vos, et facietis nobis omne quod placuerit vobis.
verses.english: And the men of Jabesh said: "Tomorrow we will come out to you, and you may do to us whatever seems good to you."

verses.latin: Et factum est in crastinum, constituit Saül populum in tres partes: et immiserunt in media castra vigilia matutina, et percusserunt Ammanites usque dum incalesceret dies: reliqui autem dispersi sunt, ita ut non relinquerentur in eis duo pariter.
verses.english: And it happened on the next day: Saul divided the people into three companies, and they entered the midst of the Ammonite camp during the morning watch, and struck down the Ammonites until the day grew hot. But the remaining Ammonites were scattered, so that not two of them were left together.

verses.latin: Et ait populus ad Samuel: Quis est iste qui dixerat: Saül non regnabit super nos? Date viros, et interficiemus eos.
verses.english: And the people said to Samuel: "Who is this who said: 'Saul shall not reign over us?' Give us those men, and we will put them to death."

verses.latin: Et ait Saül: Non occidetur vir in die hac, quia hodie fecit Dominus salutem in Israël.
verses.english: And Saul said: "No man shall be put to death this day, because today the Lord has worked deliverance in Israel."

verses.latin: Dixit autem Samuel ad populum: Venite, et eamus in Galgala, et instauremus ibi regnum.
verses.english: Then Samuel said to the people: "Come, and let us go to Gilgal, and there let us renew the kingdom."

verses.latin: Et perrexit omnis populus in Galgala, et unxerunt ibi Saül regem coram Domino in Galgala: et immolaverunt ibi victimas pacificas coram Domino: et lætatus est ibi Saül et omnes viri Israël nimis.
verses.english: And all the people went to Gilgal, and there they anointed Saul as king before the Lord in Gilgal. And there they offered peace offerings before the Lord. And Saul and all the men of Israel rejoiced there exceedingly.

verses.latin: Et ascendit Nahas Ammonites, et pugnare cœpit contra Jabes Galaad. Dixeruntque omnes viri Jabes ad Nahas: Fac nobiscum fœdus, et serviemus tibi.
verses.english: Nahash the Ammonite marched up and began to fight against Jabesh-Gilead. All the men of Jabesh then said to Nahash: 'Make a covenant with us, and we will be your servants.'

verses.latin: Et respondit Nahas Ammonites: In hoc fœdere feriam vobiscum, ut eruam omnium vestrum oculos dextros, et ponam vos opprobrium in universo Israël.
verses.english: Nahash the Ammonite answered them: 'I will make this covenant with you only on the condition that I gouge out every one of your right eyes, and so make you a disgrace throughout all of Israel.'

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ei seniores Jabes: Da nobis septem dies, ut mittamus nuntios in universos fines Israël: et si non fuerit qui nos defendat, exibimus ad te.
verses.english: The elders of Jabesh then said to Nahash: 'Give us seven days so we can send messengers throughout all the territories of Israel. If no one comes to defend us, then we will surrender to you.'

verses.latin: Venerunt ergo nuntii in Gabaa Saulis: et locuti sunt verba hæc audiente populo: et levavit omnis populus vocem suam, et flevit.
verses.english: So the messengers came to Gibeah, Saul's city, and spoke these words in the hearing of the people. And all the people raised their voices and wept aloud because of the impending threat.

verses.latin: Et ecce Saul veniebat, sequens boves de arva: et ait Saul: Quid habet populus, quod plorat? Et narraverunt ei verba nuntiorum Jabes.
verses.english: And behold, Saul was coming back, following his oxen from the field. Saul asked: 'What troubles the people that they are weeping?' And they recounted to him the words of the messengers from Jabesh.

verses.latin: Et irruit spiritus Domini in Saul, cum audisset verba hæc: et iratus est furor ejus vehementer.
verses.english: Then the Spirit of the Lord came powerfully upon Saul when he heard these words, and his righteous anger burned fiercely.

verses.latin: Et assumens utrumque boum jugi, concidit in frusta, et misit in omnes fines Israël per manus nuntiorum, dicens: Quicumque non exierit, et secutus fuerit Saul et Samuel, sic fiet bobus ejus. Et irruit pavor Domini in populum, et exierunt quasi vir unus.
verses.english: And he took a yoke of oxen, cut them into pieces, and sent them throughout all the territories of Israel by the hand of the messengers, saying: 'Whoever does not come out and follow Saul and Samuel, so shall it be done to his oxen!' Then the fear of the Lord fell upon the people, and they came out as one unified force.

verses.latin: Et numeravit eos in Bezec: fueruntque filiorum Israël trecenta millia, virorum Juda triginta millia.
verses.english: And he mustered them at Bezek. There were three hundred thousand men from the northern tribes of Israel, and thirty thousand men from the tribe of Judah.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt nuntiis qui venerant: Sic dicetis viris Jabes Galaad: Cras erit vobis salus, cum incaluerit sol. Venerunt ergo nuntii, et nuntiaverunt viris Jabes: et lætati sunt.
verses.english: And they said to the messengers who had come: 'Thus you shall say to the men of Jabesh-Gilead: "Tomorrow, when the sun grows hot, you will have deliverance and safety."' So the messengers came and reported this to the men of Jabesh, and they rejoiced greatly.

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo viri Jabes ad Ammonitas: Cras exibimus ad vos, et facietis nobis omne quod placuerit vobis.
verses.english: Then the men of Jabesh said to the Ammonites, misleading them: 'Tomorrow we will come out to you, and you may do with us whatever you please.'

verses.latin: Et factum est in crastino, constituit Saul populum in tres partes: et intravit in media castra vigilia matutina, et percussit Ammonitas usque dum incaluisset dies: qui autem remanserant, dispersi sunt, ita ut non relinquerentur duo ex eis simul.
verses.english: And it came to pass on the next day: Saul arranged his army into three companies. They entered the middle of the Ammonite camp during the morning watch—the time just before dawn—and struck down the Ammonites until the heat of the day. Those who remained alive were so thoroughly scattered that not even two of them were left together.

verses.latin: Et dixit populus ad Samuel: Quis est iste qui ait: Saul non regnabit super nos? Date illos, et interficiemus eos.
verses.english: Then the people, emboldened by victory, said to Samuel: 'Who is it that said, "Saul shall not reign over us"? Hand them over to us, and we will put them to death!'

verses.latin: Et ait Saul: Non interficietur vir in die hac, quia hodie fecit Dominus salutem in Israël.
verses.english: But Saul, in his triumph, said: 'No man shall be put to death this day, for today the Lord has brought about this great deliverance and salvation for Israel.'

verses.latin: Dixit autem Samuel ad populum: Venite, et eamus in Galgala, et instauremus ibi regnum.
verses.english: Then Samuel said to the people: 'Come, let us go to Gilgal, a place of historical significance, and there let us publicly affirm the kingship.'

verses.latin: Et abiit omnis populus in Galgala, et unxerunt ibi Saul regem coram Domino in Galgala: et immolaverunt ibi victimas pacificas coram Domino, et lætatus est ibi Saul, et omnis vir Israël nimis.
verses.english: So all the people went to Gilgal, and there they formally anointed Saul king before the Lord in Gilgal. And there they offered peace offerings before the Lord, a sign of their renewed covenant. Saul rejoiced there, and all the men of Israel rejoiced with him exceedingly.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Samuel ad universum Israël: Ecce audivi vocem vestram juxta omnia quae locuti estis ad me, et constitui super vos regem.
verses.english: Samuel then addressed all of the people of Israel. He told them: 'I have heard all that you have asked me for, and I have set a king over you.'

verses.latin: Et nunc rex graditur ante vos: ego vero senui, et incanui: et filii mei vobiscum sunt: itaque conversatus sum coram vobis ab adolescentia mea usque ad diem hanc.
verses.english: 'And now the king leads you. As for me, I have grown old and grey, but my sons are still among you. I have lived my life among you, from my youth until this very day.'

verses.latin: Loquimini de me coram Domino, et coram christo ejus: utrum bovem cujusquam tulerim, an asinum: si quempiam calumniatus sum, si oppressi aliquem, si de manu cujusquam munus accepi: et contempsi illum hodie: et restituam vobis.
verses.english: 'Speak about me now before the Lord and before His anointed one, the king. Have I ever taken anyone's ox or donkey? Have I ever defrauded anyone or oppressed them? Have I ever taken a bribe from anyone and then ignored their case? If so, tell me, and I will restore it to you today.'

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Non es calumniatus nos, neque oppressisti nos, neque accepisti de manu cujusquam quidquam.
verses.english: They all replied: 'You have not defrauded us, nor have you oppressed us, nor have you taken anything from anyone's hand!'

verses.latin: Et ait ad eos: Testis est Dominus adversum vos, et testis est christus ejus hodie, quia non invenistis in manu mea quidquam. Et dixerunt: Testis est.
verses.english: Then Samuel said to them: 'The Lord is a witness against you, and His anointed one is a witness today, that you have found nothing wrong in my conduct.' And they said: 'He is a witness!'

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel ad populum: Dominus, qui fecit Moysen et Aaron, et eduxit patres nostros de terra Ægypti.
verses.english: Samuel then said to the people: 'The Lord, who made Moses and Aaron into leaders, is the same God who led our ancestors out of the land of Egypt.'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo state, ut judicio contendam vobiscum coram Domino ex omnibus misericordiis Domini, quas fecit vobiscum, et cum patribus vestris:
verses.english: 'Therefore, stand now, so that I may contend with you in judgment before the Lord, concerning all the gracious deeds which the Lord performed for you and for your ancestors.'

verses.latin: quomodo descendit Jacob in Ægyptum, et clamaverunt patres vestri ad Dominum, et misit Dominus Moysen et Aaron, et eduxerunt patres vestros de Ægypto, et collocaverunt eos in loco hoc.
verses.english: 'Remember how Jacob went down into Egypt, and your ancestors cried out to the Lord? And the Lord sent Moses and Aaron, and they led your ancestors out of Egypt and settled them in this place.'

verses.latin: Et obliti sunt Domini Dei sui, et tradidit eos in manu Sisara principis exercitus Asor, et in manu Philisthinorum, et in manu regis Moab, et pugnaverunt adversum eos.
verses.english: 'But then they forgot the Lord their God. So He handed them over into the power of Sisara, the commander of the army of Hasor, and into the power of the Philistines, and into the power of the king of Moab, and these nations fought against them.'

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt ad Dominum, et dixerunt: Peccavimus, quia dereliquimus Dominum, et servivimus Baalim et Astaroth: nunc ergo erue nos de manu inimicorum nostrorum, et serviemus tibi.
verses.english: 'Then your ancestors cried out to the Lord, saying: "We have sinned, for we have abandoned the Lord and served the Baalim and the Astaroth. Now therefore, deliver us from the hand of our enemies, and we will serve You!"'

verses.latin: Et misit Dominus Jerobaal, et Badan, et Jephte, et Samuel, et eruit vos de manu inimicorum vestrorum per circuitum: et habitastis confidenter.
verses.english: 'So the Lord sent Jerobaal, and Badan, and Jephte, and Samuel, and He delivered you from the hand of your enemies all around, and you lived in security.'

verses.latin: Videntesque quod Naas rex filiorum Ammon veniret adversum vos, dixistis mihi: Nequaquam, sed rex imperabit nobis. Cum Dominus Deus vester regnaret in vobis.
verses.english: 'But when you saw that Naas, the king of the children of Ammon, was coming against you, you said to me: "No, we must have a king reign over us!" You said this even though the Lord your God was already your King!'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo, ecce rex vester, quem elegistis et petistis: ecce constituit super vos Dominus regem.
verses.english: 'Now therefore, behold your king, whom you have chosen and for whom you have asked. Behold, the Lord has set a king over you.'

verses.latin: Si timueritis Dominum, et servieritis ei, et audieritis vocem ejus, et non exasperaveritis os Domini: eritis et vos, et rex vester, qui imperat vobis, sequentes Dominum Deum vestrum.
verses.english: 'If you fear the Lord, and serve Him, and listen to His voice, and do not rebel against the command of the Lord, then both you and your king who rules over you will follow the Lord your God.'

verses.latin: Si autem non audieritis vocem Domini, sed exasperaveritis sermones Domini: erit manus Domini super vos, et super patres vestros.
verses.english: 'But if you do not listen to the voice of the Lord, and if you rebel against the words of the Lord, then the hand of the Lord will be against you and against your ancestors —meaning the previous generation of kings and leaders.'

verses.latin: Sed et nunc state, et videte grandem hanc rem, quam facturus est Dominus coram oculis vestris.
verses.english: 'But now, stand still and see this great thing which the Lord is about to do before your eyes.'

verses.latin: Numquid non messis triticeæ hodie? Ego invocabo Dominum, et dabit voces, et pluvias: et scietis, et videbitis quia grande malum operati estis vobis, eo quod petieritis vobis regem.
verses.english: 'Is it not the time of the wheat harvest today? This is a time of year when it does not rain. I will call upon the Lord, and He will send thunder and rain. And you will know and see that you have done great evil in the sight of the Lord by asking for a king for yourselves.'

verses.latin: Et clamavit Samuel ad Dominum, et dedit Dominus voces, et pluvias in illa die. Et extimuit omnis populus nimis Dominum et Samuelem.
verses.english: So Samuel cried out to the Lord, and the Lord sent thunder and rain on that very day. And all the people feared the Lord and Samuel greatly.

verses.latin: Et dixit universus populus ad Samuelem: Ora pro servis tuis ad Dominum Deum tuum, ut non moriamur: addidimus enim ad universa peccata nostra malum, ut peteremus nobis regem.
verses.english: And all the people said to Samuel: 'Pray for your servants to the Lord your God, so that we may not die! For we have added to all our other sins this evil, that we asked for a king for ourselves.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Samuel ad populum: Nolite timere: vos quidem fecistis omne malum hoc, verumtamen nolite recedere a tergo Domini: sed servite Domino in omni corde vestro.
