verses.english: Samuel then said to the people: 'Do not be afraid! You have indeed done all this evil, but nevertheless, do not turn away from following the Lord. Instead, serve the Lord with all your heart.'

verses.latin: Et nolite declinare post vana, quæ non proderunt vobis, neque eruent vos, quia vana sunt.
verses.english: 'And do not turn aside after empty things, which will not profit you nor deliver you, for they are empty idols.'

verses.latin: Non enim derelinquet Dominus populum suum propter nomen suum magnum: quia juravit Dominus facere populum sibi.
verses.english: 'For the Lord will not forsake His people for His great Name's sake. This is because the Lord has sworn to make you His own people.'

verses.latin: Absit autem a me hoc peccatum in Domino, ut cessem orare pro vobis: et docebo vos viam bonam et rectam.
verses.english: 'Far be it from me to commit this sin against the Lord, that I should cease to pray for you! And I will teach you the good and the right way.'

verses.latin: Timete ergo Dominum, et servite ei in veritate, et ex toto corde vestro: vidistis enim quanta fecerit vobiscum.
verses.english: 'Therefore, fear the Lord and serve Him in truth and with all your heart. For you have seen how many great things He has done for you.'

verses.latin: Si autem perseveraveritis in malitia, et vos et rex vester pariter peribitis.
verses.english: 'But if you continue in wickedness, both you and your king will perish together.'

verses.latin: Filius unius anni erat Saul cum regnare coepisset, duobus autem annis regnavit.
verses.english: Saul was in the first year of his effective reign when he began to rule, and he reigned for two years.

verses.latin: Et elegit sibi Saul tria millia ex Israël: et erant cum Saul duo millia in Machmas, et in monte Bethel: mille autem cum Jonathan erant in Gabaa Benjamin: et reliquam plebem remisit unusquisque in tabernacula sua.
verses.english: And Saul chose for himself three thousand men from Israel. Two thousand of them were with Saul in Machmas and in the mountains of Bethel, and one thousand were with Jonathan in Gabaa of Benjamin. The rest of the people, he sent each man back to his own tent.

verses.latin: Et percussit Jonathan stationem Philisthinorum quæ erat in Gabaa. Et audierunt Philisthim: et Saul cecinit buccina in omni terra, dicens: Audiant Hebræi.
verses.english: And Jonathan struck the garrison of the Philistines that was in Gabaa. When the Philistines heard of it, Saul sounded the trumpet throughout all the land, saying: "Let the Hebrews hear this!"

verses.latin: Et audivit omnis Israël hujuscemodi famam: Percussit Saul stationem Philisthinorum, et levavit Israël odium Philisthinorum: et convocatus est populus ad Saul in Galgala.
verses.english: And all Israel heard such a report: "Saul has struck the garrison of the Philistines, and Israel has aroused the hatred of the Philistines." So the people were summoned to Saul in Galgala.

verses.latin: Porro Philisthim congregati sunt ad pugnandum contra Israël triginta millia curruum, et sex millia equitum, et reliquum vulgus sicut arena quæ est in littore maris plurima: et ascendentes castrametati sunt in Machmas ad orientem Bethaven.
verses.english: Furthermore, the Philistines gathered to fight against Israel: thirty thousand chariots, and six thousand cavalry, and the rest of their common people were as numerous as the sand on the seashore. They went up and encamped in Machmas, to the east of Bethaven.

verses.latin: Videns autem vir Israël, quod angustiarentur, et quod se arctaret populus, absconderunt se in speluncis, et in abditis, et in petris, et in antris, et in cisternis.
verses.english: However, when the men of Israel saw that they were hard-pressed, and that the people were in distress, they hid themselves in caves, and in dense thickets, and among the rocks, and in hidden places, and in cisterns.

verses.latin: Hebræi vero transierunt Jordanem in terram Gad et Galaad. Cumque adhuc esset Saul in Galgalis, omnis populus pertremuit post eum.
verses.english: Some of the Hebrews even crossed the Jordan into the land of Gad and Galaad. While Saul was still in Galgala, all the people trembled in fear, following him.

verses.latin: Et expectavit septem diebus juxta terminum quem constituerat Samuel: et non venit Samuel in Galgala, et dilapsus est populus ab eo.
verses.english: And Saul waited for seven days, according to the appointed time Samuel had established. But Samuel did not come to Galgala, and the people began to scatter from him.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Saul: Afferte mihi holocaustum et pacifica. Et obtulit holocaustum.
verses.english: Therefore, Saul said: "Bring me the burnt offering and the peace offerings." And he offered the burnt offering.

verses.latin: Cumque complesset offerens holocaustum, ecce Samuel veniebat: et exivit Saul obviam ei ut salutaret eum.
verses.english: When he had just finished offering the burnt offering, behold, Samuel was coming. And Saul went out to meet him to greet him.

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Samuel: Quid fecisti? Respondit Saul: Quia vidi quod populus dilaberetur a me, et tu non veneras juxta dies statutos, et Philisthim congregati fuerant in Machmas:
verses.english: And Samuel said to him: "What have you done?" Saul answered: "Because I saw that the people were scattering from me, and you had not come according to the appointed days, and the Philistines had gathered in Machmas,

verses.latin: dixi: Nunc descendent Philisthim ad me in Galgala, et faciem Domini non placavi. Ausus ergo transgressus hostiam obtuli.
verses.english: I said to myself: 'Now the Philistines will come down against me in Galgala, and I have not appeased the face of the Lord through prayer and sacrifice.' Therefore, I dared to transgress and offered the sacrifice."

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel ad Saul: Stulte egisti, nec custodisti mandata Domini Dei tui quæ præcepit tibi. Quod si non fecisses, jam nunc permanere fecisset Dominus regnum tuum super Israël in sempiternum:
verses.english: And Samuel said to Saul: "You have acted foolishly. You have not kept the commandments of the Lord your God, which He commanded you. For if you had not done this, the Lord would now have established your kingdom over Israel forever.

verses.latin: nunc autem regnum tuum non stabit. Quæsivit Dominus sibi virum juxta cor suum: et præcepit ei Dominus ut esset dux super populum suum, eo quod non servaveris quod præcepit Dominus.
verses.english: But now, your kingdom will not last. The Lord has sought for Himself a man after His own heart, and the Lord has appointed him to be a leader over His people, because you have not kept what the Lord commanded."

verses.latin: Et surrexit Samuel, et ascendit de Galgalis in Gabaa Benjamin. Et reliqui populi ascenderunt post Saul occurrentis populo, qui permanserat de viris fortissimis.
verses.english: And Samuel rose up and went from Galgala to Gabaa of Benjamin. And the rest of the people went up after Saul, who was meeting with the people that remained from among the strongest men.

verses.latin: Et numeravit Saul populum, qui inventi fuerant cum eo, quasi sexcentos viros.
verses.english: And Saul numbered the people who were found with him, about six hundred men.

verses.latin: Et ascendit statio Philisthinorum ad transmeandum saltum Machmas.
verses.english: And a company of the Philistines went up to pass through the pass of Machmas.

verses.latin: Erat autem una pars in Bethoron, et alia ibat ad Ephram in terram Sual, et tertia pergebat ad terminum super vallem Oheb.
verses.english: Now one part of them was in Bethoron, and another went to Ephra into the land of Sual, and the third went on towards the boundary above the valley of Oheb.

verses.latin: Faber ferrarius non inveniebatur in omni terra Israël: siquidem Philisthim providissent, ne forte facerent Hebræi gladium aut lanceam.
verses.english: There was not a single blacksmith to be found in all the land of Israel, because the Philistines had ensured that the Hebrews would not be able to make a sword or a spear.

verses.latin: Sed descendebat omnis Israël ad Philisthim, ut exacueret unusquisque vomerem suum, et ligonem, et securim, et sarculum.
verses.english: Instead, all the men of Israel had to go down to the Philistines, so that each man could sharpen his plowshare, and his mattock, and his axe, and his hoe.

verses.latin: Et retusæ erant acies vomerum, et ligonum, et tridentium, et securium, et stimulo boum corrigebantur.
verses.english: And the edges of their plowshares, and mattocks, and three-pronged spears, and axes were dull. And they were sharpened by the Philistines' oxen goads.

verses.latin: Cumque pervenisset dies prælii, non est inventus gladius et hasta in manu totius populi, qui erat cum Saul et Jonathan, excepto Saul et Jonathan filio ejus.
verses.english: And when the day of battle arrived, no sword or spear was found in the hand of all the people who were with Saul and Jonathan, except for Saul and his son Jonathan.

verses.latin: Egressa est autem statio Philisthinorum, ut transcenderet Madian.
verses.english: Now a garrison of the Philistines went out to cross over to Madian.

verses.latin: Et factum est quasi post dies aliquot, dixit Ionathan filius Saul ad adolescentem armigerum suum: Veni, et transeamus ad stationem Philisthinorum, quæ est trans convallem. Patri autem suo hoc indicare noluit.
verses.english: Some days later, it happened that Jonathan, son of Saul, said to his young armor-bearer, "Come, let us cross over to the Philistine outpost that is across the valley." Jonathan, however, did not wish to tell his father about this plan.

verses.latin: Porro Saul morabatur in extremitate Gabaa sub malo granato, quæ est in Magron: et populus cum eo erat quasi sexcentorum virorum.
verses.english: Meanwhile, Saul was staying on the outskirts of Gibeah, under a pomegranate tree in Migron. The men with him numbered about six hundred.

verses.latin: Et Achias filius Achitob fratris Ichabod filii Phinees, filii Heli sacerdotis Domini in Silo, portabat ephod. Sed et populus ignorabat quo abisset Ionathan.
verses.english: Ahiah, son of Ahitub, brother of Ichabod, who was the son of Phinehas, who was the son of Eli, the Lord’s priest in Shiloh, was wearing the ephod. But even the people did not know where Jonathan had gone.

verses.latin: Erant autem inter ascensus per quos tentabat Ionathan transire ad stationem Philisthinorum, eminentes scopuli ex utraque parte, et quasi in modum dentium acutorum utrinque prærupta: nomen uni Boses, et nomen alteri Sene.
verses.english: There were two prominent rocky crags on either side of the pass Jonathan intended to use to cross over to the Philistine outpost. These jagged rocks looked like sharp teeth, steep on both sides. One was named Bozez, and the other Sene.

verses.latin: Unus scopulus ad aquilonem eminens, ex adverso Machmas: et alter ad meridiem, ex adverso Gabaa.
verses.english: One crag jutted out to the north, facing Michmas, and the other faced south, opposite Gibeah.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Ionathan ad adolescentem armigerum suum: Veni, transeamus ad stationem incircumcisorum horum, si forte faciat Dominus pro nobis: quia non est difficile Domino salvare vel in multis, vel in paucis.
verses.english: Then Jonathan said to his young armor-bearer, "Come, let us cross over to the outpost of these uncircumcised Philistines. Perhaps the Lord will act on our behalf. For it is not difficult for the Lord to bring salvation, whether by means of many soldiers or by only a few."

verses.latin: Et ait ei armiger: Fac quæcumque placet animo tuo: perge quo libet, ego tecum sum, sicut vult animus tuus.
verses.english: And his armor-bearer said to him, "Do whatever seems good to you. Go wherever you wish, for I am with you, just as you desire."

verses.latin: Et ait Ionathan: Ecce transimus ad viros istos: cum apparuerimus eis,
verses.english: Then Jonathan said, "Look, we are crossing over to these men, and when we show ourselves to them,"

verses.latin: si sic locuti fuerint: Manete donec veniamus ad vos: stemus in loco nostro, nec ascendamus ad eos.
verses.english: "if they say to us, 'Wait until we come to you,' then we will stay where we are and not climb up to them."

verses.latin: Si autem hoc dixerint: Ascendite ad nos: ascendamus: quia tradidit eos Dominus in manu nostra. Hoc erit nobis signum.
verses.english: "But if they say, 'Come up to us,' then we will climb up, because that will be a sign for us that the Lord has delivered them into our hands."

verses.latin: Apparuit igitur uterque stationi Philisthinorum: et dixerunt Philisthim: Ecce Hebræi egrediuntur de cavernis in quibus absconditi fuerant.
verses.english: So both of them showed themselves to the Philistine outpost, and the Philistines said, "Look! The Hebrews are coming out of the caves where they have been hiding!"

verses.latin: Et locuti sunt viri de statione ad Jonathan et ad armigerum ejus, dixeruntque: Ascendite ad nos, et ostendimus vobis rem. Et ait Jonathan ad armigerum suum: Sequere me, tradidit enim Dominus eos in manu Israel.
verses.english: Then the men of the outpost called out to Jonathan and his armor-bearer, saying, "Come up to us, and we will show you a thing or two!" Jonathan then said to his armor-bearer, "Follow me, for the Lord has delivered them into the hand of Israel."

verses.latin: Ascendit ergo Jonathan manibus et pedibus, et armiger ejus post eum. Et ruerunt coram Jonathan: et armiger ejus interficiebat succedentes.
verses.english: So Jonathan climbed up, using both his hands and his feet, with his armor-bearer right behind him. The Philistines fell before Jonathan, and his armor-bearer killed those who were close behind him.

verses.latin: Facta est igitur plaga prima quam percussit Jonathan et armiger ejus, quasi viginti virorum in media parte jugeri, quæ aratur boum jugo.
verses.english: In that first attack, Jonathan and his armor-bearer killed about twenty men in a very small area of land—roughly the space a yoke of oxen could plow in half a day.

verses.latin: Et factum est miraculum in castris per agros, sed et omnis populus eorum qui fuerant ad prædandum, obstupuit, et trementes abiit: sed et statio, et vastatores, obstupuerunt.
verses.english: A great panic spread through the Philistine camp and across the fields. All the men who had gone out to plunder were stunned and fled, trembling with fear. Even the soldiers at the outpost and the raiders themselves were struck with terror.

verses.latin: Et viderunt speculatores Saul in Gabaa Benjamin, ecce multitudo prostrata, et huc illucque diffugiens.
verses.english: Saul’s watchmen in Gibeah of Benjamin saw that the Philistine multitude was routed and scattered, fleeing in every direction.

verses.latin: Et ait Saul ad populum qui erat cum eo: Requirite, et videte quis abierit ex nobis. Cumque requisissent, repertum est non affuisse Jonathan et armigerum ejus.
verses.english: Then Saul said to the people with him, "Check and see who among us has left." When they checked, they found that Jonathan and his armor-bearer were not there.

verses.latin: Et ait Saul ad Achiam: Applica arcam Dei. (Erat enim ibi arca Dei in die illa cum filiis Israel.)
verses.english: Then Saul said to Ahiah, "Bring the Ark of God near." —For the Ark of God was with the children of Israel on that day.

verses.latin: Cumque loqueretur Saul ad sacerdotem, tumultus magnus accidit in castris Philisthinorum: et paulatim crescens, in majus extollebatur. Et ait Saul ad sacerdotem: Contrahe manum tuam.
verses.english: While Saul was still speaking to the priest, the commotion in the Philistine camp grew louder and more intense. So Saul said to the priest, "Withdraw your hand! Stop consulting the Ark!"

verses.latin: Conclamavit ergo Saul et omnis populus qui erat cum eo, et venerunt usque ad locum certaminis: et ecce versus fuerat gladius uniuscujusque ad proximum suum, et cædes magna nimis.
verses.english: Then Saul and all the people who were with him raised a war cry and rushed to the battle scene. There, they found the Philistines’ swords were turned against each other, and a very great slaughter was underway.

verses.latin: Sed et Hebræi qui fuerant cum Philisthim heri et nudiustertius, et ascendere cum eis simul in castris, reversi sunt ut essent cum Israel, qui erant cum Saul et Jonathan.
verses.english: Furthermore, the Hebrews who had been with the Philistines for some time—having even gone up with them into their camp—now turned back to join the Israelites who were with Saul and Jonathan.

verses.latin: Omnes etiam Israelitæ qui se absconderant in monte Ephraim, audientes quod fugissent Philisthim, se junxerunt cum eis in pugnam: et multiplicati sunt quasi decem millia virorum.
verses.english: All the Israelites who had hidden themselves in the hill country of Ephraim, hearing that the Philistines were fleeing, joined them in the pursuit. So the number of fighting men grew to about ten thousand.

verses.latin: Et salvavit Dominus in die illa Israel. Certamen autem pervenit usque ad Bethaven.
verses.english: Thus, the Lord saved Israel on that day. The battle, however, continued all the way to Beth-aven.

verses.latin: Et viri Israel fatigati sunt in die illa. Adjuraverat autem Saul populum, dicens: Maledictus vir qui comederit panem usque ad vesperam, donec ulciscar de inimicis meis. Et non comedit omnis populus panem.
verses.english: The men of Israel were exhausted that day, because Saul had bound the people with an oath, saying, "Cursed be the man who eats any food before evening, before I have avenged myself on my enemies!" So none of the people tasted any food.

verses.latin: Et omnis terræ plebs venit in saltum, in quo erat mel super faciem terræ.
verses.english: All the common people of the land came into a forest where there was wild honey on the ground.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est populus saltum, et ecce affluebat mel: et nemo tetigit manu sua ad os suum: timuit enim populus juramentum.
verses.english: When the people entered the forest, they saw honey dripping everywhere, yet no one put a hand to his mouth to eat it, for the people feared the oath.

verses.latin: Porro Jonathan non audierat cum adjuraret pater ejus populum: extenditque extremum virgæ quæ erat in manu ejus, et intinxit in favo mellis: et convertit manum suam ad os suum, et illuminati sunt oculi ejus.
verses.english: Jonathan, however, had not heard when his father put the oath on the people. So he stretched out the end of the staff that was in his hand, dipped it into a honeycomb, and put his hand to his mouth. Immediately, his eyes brightened, and his strength returned.

verses.latin: Et respondit unus de populo, et ait: Jurejurando constrinxit pater tuus populum, dicens: Maledictus homo, qui comederit panem hodie. Defecerat autem populus.
verses.english: Then one of the people replied, "Your father solemnly bound the people with an oath, saying, 'Cursed be the man who eats any food today!' That is why the people are so faint."

verses.latin: Dixitque Jonathan: Turbavit pater meus terram. Vidistis ipsi quia oculi mei illuminati sunt, eo quod gustavi paululum de hoc melle.
verses.english: Jonathan then said, "My father has brought trouble upon the land. See how my eyes brightened and my strength returned just because I tasted a little of this honey!"

verses.latin: Quanto magis si comedisset populus de præda inimicorum suorum quam reperit: nonne major facta fuisset plaga in Philisthæos?
verses.english: "How much greater a blow might have been struck against the Philistines if the people had been allowed to eat freely from the spoils they found, instead of being starved!"

verses.latin: Percusserunt ergo in die illa Philisthæos a Machmas usque Ajalon. Et defecit populus nimis.
verses.english: On that day, they struck down the Philistines from Michmas all the way to Aijalon. By then, the people were utterly exhausted.

verses.latin: Et irruit populus ad prædam: sumpseruntque oves et boves et vitulos, et occiderunt in terra: et comedit populus cum sanguine.
verses.english: The people then rushed greedily for the spoils. They took sheep, oxen, and calves, slaughtered them directly on the ground, and ate the meat with the blood still in it—a violation of God’s Law.

verses.latin: Nuntiaveruntque Sauli dicentes: Ecce populus peccat Domino comedens cum sanguine. Qui ait: Prævaricati estis: revolvite ad me statim huc lapidem magnum.
verses.english: Then someone reported to Saul, "Look, the people are sinning against the Lord by eating meat with the blood still in it!" He replied, "You have transgressed! Roll a large stone here to me at once!"

verses.latin: Et ait Saul: Dispergimini in populum, et dicite eis: Unusquisque convertat ad me bovem suum et arietem suum, et occidite super istum, et comedite: et non peccabitis Domino comedentes cum sanguine. Convertit ergo omnis populus unusquisque bovem suum in manu sua, et adduxerunt ad Saul, et occiderunt ibi.
verses.english: Saul then said, "Go out among the people and tell them, 'Each man is to bring his ox or his ram to me at once, and slaughter it here, and eat it. Do not sin against the Lord by eating meat with the blood still in it!'" So every one of the people brought his ox with his own hand to Saul and slaughtered it there.

verses.latin: Et ædificavit Saul altare Domino: hocque primum altare ædificavit Domino.
verses.english: Saul also built an altar to the Lord. This was the first altar he built to the Lord.

verses.latin: Et dixit Saul: Irruamus in Philisthæos nocte, et vastemus eos usque ad lucem, nec relinquamus ex eis virum. Dixitque populus: Omne quod tibi videtur bonum, fac. Et ait sacerdos: Accedamus huc ad Deum.
verses.english: Then Saul said, "Let us go down after the Philistines by night and plunder them until morning, and let us not leave a single man among them." The people replied, "Do whatever seems good to you." But the priest said, "Let us come near to God here to inquire of Him."

verses.latin: Et consuluit Saul Dominum: Num persequar Philisthæos? et trades eos in manu Israel? Et non respondit ei in die illa.
verses.english: So Saul inquired of the Lord, "Shall I pursue the Philistines? Will You deliver them into the hand of Israel?" But the Lord did not answer him on that day.

verses.latin: Et ait Saul: Applicate huc omnes angulos populi: et scitote, et videte per quem acciderit peccatum hoc hodie.
verses.english: Then Saul said, "Gather all the chiefs and leaders of the people here, and find out how this sin occurred today."

verses.latin: Quia vivit Dominus salvator Israel, si per Ionathan filium meum factum est, absque ulla retractione morietur. Et non respondit ei omnis populus.
verses.english: He swore an oath, "As the Lord, the Savior of Israel, lives, if this sin was committed by my own son Jonathan, he must surely die without fail!" But none of the people answered him.

verses.latin: Et ait ad universum Israel: Vos estote in unam partem, et ego cum Jonatha filio meo ero in parte altera. Et respondit populus ad Saul: Bonum est quod tibi videtur.
verses.english: Then he said to all Israel, "You stand on one side, and I and my son Jonathan will stand on the other side." The people responded to Saul, "Do what seems good to you."

verses.latin: Et dixit Samuel ad Saul: Me misit Dominus ut ungerem te regem super populum ejus Israël: nunc ergo audi vocem Domini.
verses.english: Samuel said to Saul: "The Lord sent me on a mission to anoint you as king over His people, Israel. Therefore, you must listen to the voice of the Lord now."

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Recensui omnia quæ fecit Amalec Israeli: quomodo restitit ei in via cum ascenderet de Ægypto.
verses.english: "Thus says the Lord of Armies: 'I have carefully observed all that Amalek did to Israel, specifically how they ambushed and fought against them on their journey when they came up out of Egypt.'"

verses.latin: Nunc ergo vade, et percute Amalec, et demolire universa ejus: non parcas ei, sed interfice a viro usque ad mulierem, et parvulum et lactentem, et bovem et ovem, et camelum et asinum.
verses.english: "Now, therefore, go and attack Amalek. Utterly destroy everything they possess; do not spare them. You must kill every person—from man to woman, from small child to infant—and every animal—ox and sheep, camel and donkey."

verses.latin: Igitur præcepit Saul populo, et numeravit eos quasi agnos: ducentorum millium peditum, et decem millium virorum Juda.
verses.english: So Saul gave orders to the people and counted them all, numbering them carefully: there were two hundred thousand foot soldiers, and ten thousand men from the tribe of Judah.

verses.latin: Cumque venisset Saul usque ad civitatem Amalec, tetendit insidias in torrente.
verses.english: When Saul arrived at the city of Amalek, he set up an ambush in the wadi, the valley floor near the city.

verses.latin: Dixitque Saul Cineæ: Abite, et recedite, et de cæteris Amalecitis descendite: ne forte involvam vos cum eo. Vos enim fecistis misericordiam cum omnibus filiis Israël, cum ascenderent de Ægypto. Et recessit Cineus de medio Amalec.
verses.english: And Saul said to the Kenites: "Go now, depart, and separate yourselves from among the other Amalekites, so that I do not destroy you along with them. For you showed kindness to all the children of Israel when they came up from Egypt." So the Kenites departed from among the Amalekites.

verses.latin: Percussit ergo Saul Amalec ab Hevila donec venias Sur, quæ est contra Ægyptum.
verses.english: So Saul attacked Amalek from Havilah all the way to Shur, which lies opposite Egypt.

verses.latin: Et apprehendit Agag regem Amalec vivum: omne vero vulgus interfecit in ore gladii.
verses.english: He captured Agag, the king of Amalek, alive, but all the rest of the people he put to death with the edge of the sword.

verses.latin: Et pepercit Saul et populus Agag, et optimis gregibus ovium, et armentorum, et vestibus, et arietibus, et universis quæ pulchra erant: nec voluerunt disperdere, quæ reproba fuerant et infirma, interfecerunt.
verses.english: But Saul and the people spared Agag, and they spared the best of the flocks of sheep and herds of cattle, and the finest garments, and the rams—indeed, everything that was valuable. They did not want to destroy these. However, all the worthless and weak animals, they did kill.

verses.latin: Factum est autem verbum Domini ad Samuel, dicens:
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came to Samuel, saying:

verses.latin: Pœnitet me quod constituerim Saul regem: quia dereliquit me, et verba mea opere non implevit. Contristatus est autem Samuel, et clamavit ad Dominum tota nocte.
verses.english: "I am deeply grieved that I have made Saul king, for he has turned away from me and has not carried out my commands." Samuel was greatly saddened by this news, and he cried out to the Lord all through the night.

verses.latin: Cumque de nocte surrexisset Samuel ut iret ad Saul mane, nuntiaverunt Samuel, dicentes: Venit Saul in Carmelum, et erexit sibi fornicem triumphantem, et reversus est, transiitque, et descendit in Galgala.
verses.english: When Samuel rose early in the morning to go to Saul, people reported to Samuel, saying: "Saul went to Carmel, and there he set up a triumphal monument for himself. Then he turned back, passed on, and went down to Gilgal."

verses.latin: Venit autem Samuel ad Saul, et dixit ei Saul: Benedictus tu Domino: implevi verbum Domini.
verses.english: When Samuel came to Saul, Saul said to him, "May you be blessed by the Lord! I have carried out the Lord's command."

verses.latin: Dixitque Samuel: Et quæ est hæc vox gregis ovium, quæ percutit aures meas, et armentorum vox quam ego audio?
verses.english: But Samuel said, "Then what is this sound of sheep bleating in my ears, and the lowing of cattle that I hear?"

verses.latin: Et ait Saul: De Amalec adduxerunt ea: pepercit enim populus optimis ovibus et armentis, ut immolarentur Domino Deo tuo: cætera vero trucidavimus.
verses.english: Saul answered, "They brought them from the Amalekites, for the people spared the best of the sheep and cattle to offer as sacrifices to the Lord your God. The rest we utterly destroyed."

verses.latin: Dixit autem Samuel ad Saul: Sine me, et indicabo tibi quæ locutus sit Dominus ad me nocte. Et dixit ei: Loquere.
verses.english: Then Samuel said to Saul, "Stop! Let me tell you what the Lord said to me last night." And Saul said to him, "Speak."

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel: Nonne cum esses parvulus in oculis tuis, caput in tribubus Israël factus es? Et unxit te Dominus regem super Israël,
verses.english: And Samuel said: "Though you considered yourself small and insignificant in your own eyes, were you not made the leader of the tribes of Israel? And the Lord anointed you king over Israel."

verses.latin: et misit te Dominus in viam, et dixit: Vade, et interfice peccatores Amalecitas, et pugna contra eos usque ad internecionem.
verses.english: "And the Lord sent you on a mission, saying: 'Go and utterly destroy the sinful Amalekites, and fight against them until they are completely annihilated.'"

verses.latin: Quare ergo non obedisti voci Domini: sed ad prædam conversus es, et fecisti malum in oculis Domini?
verses.english: "Why then did you not obey the voice of the Lord? Instead, you turned to the plunder and did what was evil in the sight of the Lord!"

verses.latin: Et ait Saul ad Samuel: Immo obedivi voci Domini, et perrexi in via per quam misit me Dominus, et adduxi Agag regem Amalec, et Amalecitas interfeci.
verses.english: Saul said to Samuel: "But I did obey the voice of the Lord! I went on the mission the Lord sent me on. I brought back Agag, the king of Amalek, and I utterly destroyed the Amalekites!"

verses.latin: Tollens autem populus de præda, oves et boves, primum eorum quæ interficienda erant, ut immolet Domino Deo suo in Galgalis.
verses.english: "But the people took from the spoil, from among the sheep and cattle, the very best of those things that were designated for utter destruction, with the intention of sacrificing them to the Lord your God in Gilgal."

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel: Numquid vult Dominus holocausta et victimas, et non potius obedire voci Domini? Melius est enim obedire quam victimas immolare: et auscultare magis quam offerre adipem arietum.
verses.english: And Samuel said: "Does the Lord truly desire burnt offerings and sacrifices, rather than obedience to His voice? For indeed, to obey is better than to offer animal sacrifices, and to listen attentively is better than to offer the fat of rams."

verses.latin: Quoniam quasi peccatum ariolandi est non obedire: et quasi scelus idololatriæ nolle acquiescere. Pro eo ergo quod abjecisti sermonem Domini, abjecit te Dominus ne sis rex in Israël.
verses.english: "For rebellion is like the sin of divination, and stubbornness is like the wickedness of idolatry. Therefore, because you have rejected the word and command of the Lord, the Lord has rejected you from being king over Israel."

verses.latin: Dixitque Saul ad Samuel: Peccavi, quia prævaricatus sum sermonem Domini, et verba tua, timens populum, et obediens magis voci eorum.
verses.english: Then Saul said to Samuel: "I have sinned, because I transgressed the command of the Lord and your instructions. I did this because I feared the people, and I listened to their voices more than to God's."

verses.latin: Nunc igitur, tolle, obsecro, peccatum meum, et revertere mecum, ut adorem Dominum.
verses.english: "Now therefore, I beg you, forgive my sin and return with me, so that I may worship the Lord."

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel ad Saul: Non revertar tecum: quia abjecisti sermonem Domini, et abjecit te Dominus ne sis rex super Israël.
verses.english: And Samuel said to Saul: "I will not return with you, for you have rejected the command of the Lord, and the Lord has rejected you from being king over Israel."

verses.latin: Et conversus est Samuel ut abiret: et apprehendit Saul oram pallii ejus, et scidit.
verses.english: As Samuel turned to leave, Saul grabbed the edge of his robe, and it tore.

verses.latin: Et ait ad eum Samuel: Scidit Dominus regnum Israël a te hodie, et dedit illud proximo tuo, meliori te.
verses.english: And Samuel said to him: "Just as this robe is torn, the Lord has torn the kingdom of Israel away from you today, and He has given it to a neighbor of yours who is better than you."

verses.latin: Porro Triumphator in Israël non parcet, et pœnitentia flectetur: neque enim homo est ut agat pœnitentiam.
verses.english: Furthermore, the Eternal and Victorious One in Israel does not lie, nor does He change His mind, for He is not a man who feels regret or alters His plans.

verses.latin: Et ille ait: Peccavi: sed honora me nunc coram senioribus populi mei, et coram Israël, et revertere mecum, ut adorem Dominum Deum tuum.
verses.english: And Saul said: "I have sinned. But please honor me now before the elders of my people and before Israel, and return with me, so that I may worship the Lord your God."

verses.latin: Reversus ergo Samuel secutus est Saul: et adoravit Saul Dominum.
verses.english: So Samuel turned back and followed Saul, and Saul worshipped the Lord.

verses.latin: Et dixit Samuel: Adducite ad me Agag regem Amalecitarum. Et adductus est ad eum Agag pinguissimus, et tremens, et dixit: Certissime separata est amaritudo mortis.
verses.english: Then Samuel said: "Bring me Agag, the king of the Amalekites." And Agag, who was very well-fed, was brought to him, and he was trembling. Agag said: "Surely the bitterness of death has passed now"—meaning he thought the danger was over.

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel: Sicut fecit gladius tuus mulieres absque liberis, sic absque liberis erit mater tua inter mulieres. Et in frusta concidit Samuel Agag coram Domino in Galgalis.
verses.english: And Samuel said: "Just as your sword has made many women childless, so now your mother will be childless among women." Then Samuel cut Agag into pieces before the Lord in Gilgal.

verses.latin: Abiit autem Samuel in Ramatha: Saul vero ascendit in domum suam in Gabaa Saul.
verses.english: Then Samuel went to Ramah, but Saul went up to his house in Gibeah of Saul.

verses.latin: Et non vidit Samuel ultra Saul usque ad diem mortis suæ: verumtamen lugebat Samuel Saul: et Dominum pœnitebat quod constituisset Saul regem super Israël.
verses.english: Samuel never saw Saul again until the day of his death. However, Samuel continued to grieve deeply for Saul. And the Lord was sorrowful that He had made Saul king over Israel.

verses.latin: Et dixit Samuel ad Saul: Me misit Dominus ut ungerem te regem super populum ejus Israël: nunc ergo audi vocem Domini.
verses.english: And Samuel said to Saul: "The Lord Himself sent me on a mission to anoint you as king over His people, Israel. Therefore, now listen to the voice of the Lord."

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Recensui omnia quæ fecit Amalec Israeli: quomodo restitit ei in via cum ascenderet de Ægypto.
verses.english: The Lord of armies declares this: 'I have carefully recalled all that Amalec did to Israel, how he resisted him on the way when he came up out of Egypt.'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo vade, et percute Amalec, et demolire universa ejus: non parcas ei, sed interfice a viro usque ad mulierem, et parvulum atque lactentem, bovem et ovem, camelum et asinum.
verses.english: 'Now therefore go and attack Amalec, and utterly destroy all that belongs to him. Do not spare him, but put to death every person, from man to woman, from little child to nursing infant. Also put to death every ox and sheep, every camel and donkey.'

verses.latin: Præcepit itaque Saul populo, et recensuit eos quasi agnos: ducentorum millium peditum, et decem millium virorum Juda.
verses.english: So Saul summoned the people and counted them, as if they were lambs. There were two hundred thousand foot soldiers, and ten thousand men from Judah.

verses.latin: Cumque venisset Saul ad civitatem Amalec, tetendit insidias in torrente.
verses.english: And when Saul came to the city of Amalec, he set an ambush in the valley—along the dry riverbed.

verses.latin: Dixitque Saul Cinæo: Abite, et recedite de Amalec, ne forte involvam te cum eo. Tu enim fecisti misericordiam cum omnibus filiis Israël cum ascenderent de Ægypto. Et recessit Cinæus de medio Amalec.
verses.english: Then Saul said to the Kenites: 'Go, and depart from Amalec, lest by chance I should involve you with them in their destruction. For you showed kindness to all the children of Israel when they came up out of Egypt.' So the Kenites departed from the midst of Amalec.

verses.latin: Percussitque Saul Amalec ab Hevila donec venias Sur, quæ est contra Ægyptum.
verses.english: Saul then attacked Amalec from Havilah all the way to Shur, which faces Egypt.

verses.latin: Et apprehendit Agag regem Amalec vivum: omne vero vulgus interfecit in ore gladii.
verses.english: And he seized Agag, the king of Amalec, alive. But he put all the ordinary people to death with the edge of the sword.

verses.latin: Et pepercit Saul et populus Agag, et optimis gregibus ovium et armentorum, et vestibus et arietibus, et universis quæ pulchra erant, nec voluerunt disperdere, quicquid vero vile fuit et reprobum, hoc demoliti sunt.
verses.english: But Saul and his people spared Agag, as well as the best of the flocks of sheep and herds of cattle, and the garments, and the rams—indeed, everything that was good and valuable. They did not want to utterly destroy these things. But everything that was vile and contemptible, that they utterly destroyed.

verses.latin: Factum est autem verbum Domini ad Samuel, dicens:
verses.english: Now the word of the Lord came to Samuel, saying:

verses.latin: Pœnitet me quod constituerim Saul regem: quia dereliquit me, et verba mea opere non implevit. Contristatus est autem Samuel, et clamavit ad Dominum tota nocte.
verses.english: 'I regret that I made Saul king, because he has forsaken me and has not carried out my commands. Samuel was deeply saddened by this, and he cried out to the Lord all that night.

verses.latin: Cumque de nocte surgeret Samuel, ut iret ad Saul mane, nuntiatum est Samueli, quod venisset Saul in Carmelum, et erexisset sibi fornicem triumphantem, et reversus fuisset, abiissetque Galgala.
verses.english: When Samuel rose in the night to go to Saul in the morning, it was reported to Samuel, by someone, that Saul had come to Carmel, and had set up a triumphant arch for himself, and had then turned back and gone to Gilgal.

verses.latin: Venit ergo Samuel ad Saul, et Saul offerebat holocaustum Domino de primitiis, quæ attulerat ex Amalec.
verses.english: So Samuel came to Saul. And Saul was offering a burnt offering to the Lord from the first-fruits of the spoil that he had brought back from Amalec.

verses.latin: Et dixit Samuel: Quod ergo hic est rugitus iste gregum, qui resonat in auribus meis, et vociferatio armentorum quam ego audio?
verses.english: And Samuel said: "What then is this bleating of the flocks that echoes in my ears, and the lowing of the herds that I hear?"

verses.latin: Et ait Saul: De Amalec adduxerunt ea: pepercit enim populus optimis ovibus et armentis, ut immolarentur Domino Deo tuo, cetera vero disperdimus.
verses.english: And Saul said: "They brought these things from Amalec. For the people spared the best sheep and cattle, so that they might be sacrificed to the Lord your God. The rest, however, we utterly destroyed."

verses.latin: Dixit autem Samuel ad Saul: Sine me, et indicabo tibi quæ locutus sit Dominus ad me nocte. Et dixit ei: Loquere.
verses.english: Then Samuel said to Saul: "Allow me, and I will declare to you what the Lord has spoken to me during the night." And Saul said to him: "Speak."

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel: Nonne cum parvulus esses in oculis tuis, caput factus es in tribubus Israël? et unxit te Dominus regem super Israël,
verses.english: And Samuel said: "Although you may have been small in your own estimation, were you not made the head over the tribes of Israel? And the Lord anointed you king over Israel.

verses.latin: et misit te Dominus in viam, et ait: Vade, et interfice peccatores Amalec, et pugnabis contra eos usque ad internecionem.
verses.english: And the Lord sent you on a journey and said: 'Go and put to death the sinners of Amalec, and you shall fight against them until their complete destruction.'

verses.latin: Quare ergo non audisti vocem Domini: sed ad prædam conversus es, et quod malum erat in oculis Domini, hoc fecisti?
verses.english: Why then did you not listen to the voice of the Lord? Instead, you turned to plunder and did what was evil in the eyes of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et ait Saul ad Samuelem: Immo audivi vocem Domini, et ambulavi in via per quam misit me Dominus, et adduxi Agag regem Amalec, et Amalec interfeci.
verses.english: And Saul said to Samuel: "Indeed, I did listen to the voice of the Lord. I walked in the way by which the Lord sent me, and I brought back Agag, the king of Amalec, and I utterly destroyed Amalec.

verses.latin: De spoliis autem sumpsit populus oves et boves, primum eorum quæ cæsa sunt, ut immolarent Domino Deo suo in Galgalis.
verses.english: But the people took from the spoils some sheep and cattle, the very best of those that were to be slain, in order to sacrifice them to the Lord your God in Gilgal."

verses.latin: Dixit autem Samuel: Numquid vult Dominus holocausta et victimas, et non potius ut obediatur voci Domini? Melius est enim obedire quam victimas immolare: et auscultare magis quam offerre adipem arietum.
verses.english: But Samuel said: "Does the Lord desire burnt offerings and sacrifices, and not rather that His voice be obeyed? Truly, to obey is better than to offer sacrifices, and to listen is better than to offer the fat of rams.

verses.latin: Quoniam quasi peccatum ariolandi est non obedire: et quasi scelus idololatriæ nolle adquiescere. Pro eo ergo, quod abjecisti sermonem Domini, abjecit te Dominus ne sis rex in Israël.
verses.english: For rebellion is like the sin of divination, and stubbornness is like the wickedness of idolatry. Therefore, because you have rejected the word of the Lord, the Lord has also rejected you from being king over Israel."

verses.latin: Dixitque Saul ad Samuelem: Peccavi, quia prævaricatus sum sermonem Domini, et verba tua, timens populum, et obediens voci eorum.
verses.english: Then Saul said to Samuel: "I have sinned, because I have violated the command of the Lord and your words, fearing the people and obeying their voice."

verses.latin: Nunc ergo quæso, ut auferas peccatum meum, et revertaris mecum, ut adorem Dominum.
verses.english: "Now therefore, I beg you, forgive my sin, and return with me, so that I may worship the Lord."

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel ad Saul: Non revertar tecum, quia projecisti sermonem Domini, et projecit te Dominus ne sis rex super Israël.
verses.english: And Samuel said to Saul: "I will not return with you, because you have cast aside the word of the Lord, and the Lord has cast you aside from being king over Israel."

verses.latin: Et conversus est Samuel ut abiret: et apprehendit Saul oram pallii ejus, et scidit eam.
verses.english: And as Samuel turned to go away, Saul seized the edge of his cloak, and it tore.

verses.latin: Et ait ad eum Samuel: Scidit Dominus regnum Israël a te hodie, et dedit illud proximo tuo meliori te.
verses.english: And Samuel said to him: "The Lord has torn the kingdom of Israel away from you today, and has given it to a neighbor of yours who is better than you."

verses.latin: Porro triumphator in Israël non parcet, et pœnitentia non flectetur: neque enim homo est ut pœnitentia flectatur.
verses.english: Furthermore, the Victorious One in Israel—that is, God—will not relent, and will not be swayed by repentance. For He is not a man that He should be swayed by repentance.

verses.latin: Et ille ait: Peccavi: sed honora me nunc coram senioribus populi mei, et coram Israël, et revertere mecum, ut adorem Dominum Deum tuum.
verses.english: And Saul said: "I have sinned. But honor me now before the elders of my people and before Israel, and return with me, so that I may worship the Lord your God."

verses.latin: Reversus ergo Samuel secutus est Saul, et adoravit Saul Dominum.
verses.english: So Samuel returned and followed Saul, and Saul worshipped the Lord.

verses.latin: Et dixit Samuel: Adducite ad me Agag regem Amalec. Et adductus est ad eum Agag pinguissimus, et tremebat, et dixit: Putas ne amaritudo mortis separata est?
verses.english: And Samuel said: "Bring Agag, the king of Amalec, to me." And Agag was brought to him—Agag was very fat and trembling, and he said: "Surely the bitterness of death is now past?"

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel: Sicut fecit gladius tuus mulieres absque liberis, sic absque liberis erit inter mulieres mater tua. Et in frusta concidit Samuel Agag coram Domino in Galgalis.
verses.english: And Samuel said: "Just as your sword made women childless, so your mother will be childless among women." And Samuel cut Agag into pieces before the Lord in Gilgal.

verses.latin: Abiit autem Samuel in Ramatha: Saul vero ascendit in domum suam in Gabaa Saul.
verses.english: Then Samuel went to Ramah. But Saul went up to his own house in Gibeah of Saul.

verses.latin: Et non vidit Samuel ultra Saul usque ad diem mortis suæ: verumtamen lugebat Samuel Saulem: et Dominum pœnitebat quod constituisset Saul regem super Israël.
verses.english: And Samuel never saw Saul again until the day of his death. Nevertheless, Samuel mourned for Saul, and the Lord regretted that He had made Saul king over Israel.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Samuel: Usquequo luges Saul, cum ego projecerim eum ne regnet super Israel? Imple cornu tuum oleo, et veni ut mittam te ad Isai Bethlehemitem: quoniam providi mihi in filiis ejus regem.
verses.english: The Lord then said to Samuel: "How long will you mourn for Saul, since I have already rejected him from reigning over Israel? Fill your horn with oil, and come, so I may send you to Jesse, the man from Bethlehem. For I have prepared a king for Myself among his sons."

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel: Quomodo vadam? audiet enim Saul, et interficiet me. Et ait Dominus: Vitulum de armento tolles in manu tua, et dices: Ad immolandum Domino veni.
verses.english: Samuel replied: "How can I go? For Saul will hear about it and will kill me." The Lord answered: "Take a calf from the herd with you in your hand, and say: 'I have come to offer a sacrifice to the Lord.'"

verses.latin: Et vocabis Isai ad victimam: et ego ostendam tibi quid facias, et unges quemcumque monstravero tibi.
verses.english: And invite Jesse to the sacrifice. Then I will show you what you must do, and you shall anoint the one whom I point out to you.

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Samuel sicut locutus est ei Dominus. Et venit Bethlehem: et admirati sunt seniores civitatis, et occurrentes ei dixerunt: Pacificus ne est ingressus tuus?
verses.english: So Samuel did exactly as the Lord had told him. He arrived in Bethlehem. The elders of the city were astonished at his coming; they hurried to meet him and asked: "Is your arrival for peace?"

verses.latin: Et ait: Pacificus: ad immolandum Domino veni, sanctificamini et venite mecum ut immolem. Sanctificavit ergo Isai et filios ejus, et vocavit eos ad sacrificium.
verses.english: Samuel said: "Yes, it is for peace. I have come to offer a sacrifice to the Lord. Sanctify yourselves and come with me so I may perform the sacrifice." So he sanctified Jesse and his sons, and invited them to the sacrifice.

verses.latin: Cumque ingressi essent, vidit Eliab, et ait: Num coram Domino est Christus ejus?
verses.english: When they had entered, Samuel saw Eliab. And Samuel thought to himself: "Surely this is the Lord's Anointed One, standing here before the Lord."

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Samuel: Ne respicias vultum ejus, neque altitudinem staturae ejus: quoniam abjeci eum, nec juxta intuitum hominis ego judico: homo enim videt ea quæ parent, Dominus vero intuetur cor.
verses.english: But the Lord said to Samuel: "Do not look at his appearance or at the height of his stature, because I have rejected him. For I do not judge according to what a human judges: a human sees what is visible, but the Lord looks at the heart."

verses.latin: Et vocavit Isai Abinadab, et adduxit eum coram Samuel. Qui ait: Nec hunc elegit Dominus.
verses.english: Then Jesse called Abinadab and brought him before Samuel. But Samuel said: "The Lord has not chosen this one either."

verses.latin: Et adduxit Isai Samma, de quo ait: Nec hunc elegit Dominus.
verses.english: Next, Jesse brought Shamma. And Samuel said: "The Lord has not chosen this one either."

verses.latin: Adduxit ergo Isai septem filios suos coram Samuel: et ait Samuel ad Isai: Non elegit Dominus ex his aliquem.
verses.english: So Jesse brought seven of his sons before Samuel. But Samuel said to Jesse: "The Lord has not chosen any of these."

verses.latin: Et dixit Samuel ad Isai: Numquid jam completi sunt filii tui? Qui respondit: Adhuc restat parvulus, et pascit oves. Et ait Samuel ad Isai: Mitte et adduc eum: quoniam non sedebimus donec veniat huc.
verses.english: Then Samuel asked Jesse: "Are all your sons here?" Jesse answered: "There is still the youngest one left, and he is tending the sheep." Samuel said to Jesse: "Send for him and bring him here, because we will not sit down to eat until he comes."

verses.latin: Misit ergo et adduxit eum. Erat autem rufus, et pulcher aspectu, decoraque facie. Et ait Dominus: Surge, unge eum: ipse est enim.
verses.english: So Jesse sent for him and brought him in. Now he was ruddy, with beautiful eyes and a handsome face. And the Lord said: "Arise, anoint him, for this is he."

verses.latin: Tollens ergo Samuel cornu olei, unxit eum in medio fratrum ejus: et directus est spiritus Domini in David a die illa et deinceps. Et surrexit Samuel, et abiit in Ramatha.
verses.english: Then Samuel took the horn of oil and anointed him in the presence of his brothers. And the Spirit of the Lord was powerfully present with David from that day forward. Then Samuel arose and went back to Ramah.

verses.latin: Spiritus autem Domini recessit a Saul, et vexabat eum spiritus nequam a Domino.
verses.english: Now the Spirit of the Lord had departed from Saul, and an evil spirit tormented him, sent by the Lord to afflict him.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt servi Saul ad eum: Ecce spiritus nequam a Domino vexat te.
verses.english: Saul's servants said to him: "Behold, an evil spirit from God is tormenting you."

verses.latin: Jubeat ergo dominus noster, et quærant servi tui coram te virum scientem citharizare, ut cum spiritus Domini malus arripuerit te, decantet manu sua, et levius feras.
verses.english: "Let our lord command your servants who are before you to seek out a man who is skilled at playing the lyre, so that when the evil spirit from God seizes you, he may play with his hand, and you may find relief."

verses.latin: Et ait Saul ad servos suos: Provident mihi ergo aliquem virum bene psallentem, et adducite eum ad me.
verses.english: Saul said to his servants: "Then provide me with a man who plays well, and bring him to me."

verses.latin: Et respondens unus de pueris, ait: Ecce vidi filium Isai Bethlehemite, scientem psallere, et fortissimum, et virum bellicosum, et prudentem in sermonibus, et virum pulchrum: et Dominus est cum eo.
verses.english: Then one of the young men answered and said: "Behold, I have seen a son of Jesse the Bethlehemite who is skilled in playing, and a mighty man of valor, and a warrior, and prudent in speech, and a handsome man. And the Lord is with him."

verses.latin: Misit ergo Saul nuntios ad Isai, dicens: Mitte ad me David filium tuum, qui est in pascuis.
verses.english: So Saul sent messengers to Jesse, saying: "Send me David your son, who is with the sheep in the pastures."

verses.latin: Tulit ergo Isai asinum panis, et lagunculam vini, et hœdum caprarum, et misit per manum David filii sui ad Saul.
verses.english: Then Jesse took a donkey laden with bread, a skin of wine, and a young goat, and sent them by the hand of David his son to Saul, as a gift.

verses.latin: Et venit David ad Saul, et stetit coram eo: et dilexit eum vehementer, et factus est ejus armiger.
verses.english: So David came to Saul and stood before him. Saul loved him dearly, and David became his armor-bearer.

verses.latin: Misitque Saul ad Isai, dicens: Stet David in conspectu meo: invenit enim gratiam in oculis meis.
verses.english: Saul then sent word to Jesse, saying: "Let David remain in my service, for he has found favor in my eyes."

verses.latin: Igitur cum arriperet Saul spiritus malus a Domino, David tollebat citharam, et percutiebat manu sua: et refocillabatur Saul, et levius habebat: recedebat enim ab eo spiritus malus.
verses.english: Therefore, whenever the evil spirit from the Lord came upon Saul, David would take up his lyre and play with his hand. Then Saul would be refreshed and feel better, for the evil spirit would leave him.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Samuel: Usquequo luges Saul, cum ego projecerim eum ne regnet super Israel? Imple cornu tuum oleo, et veni, ut mittam te ad Isai Bethlehemitem: quoniam providi mihi in filiis ejus regem.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Samuel: 'How long will you mourn for Saul? —I have already rejected him from reigning over Israel. Fill your anointing horn with oil, and come, so that I may send you to Jesse the Bethlehemite, for I have chosen for myself a king from among his sons.'

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel: Quomodo vadam? audiet enim Saul, et interficiet me. Et ait Dominus: Vitulam de armento assumes in manu tua, et dices: Ad immolandum Domino veni.
verses.english: And Samuel said: 'How can I go? For Saul will hear of it, and he will kill me.' And the Lord said: 'Take a young heifer from the herd with you in your hand, and say: 'I have come to offer a sacrifice to the Lord.''

verses.latin: Et vocabis Isai ad victimam, et ego ostendam tibi quid facias: et unges quemcumque monstravero tibi.
verses.english: And you shall invite Jesse to the sacrifice, and I will show you what to do. You are to anoint the one whom I show you.

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Samuel sicut locutus est ei Dominus. Et venit Bethlehem, et admirati sunt seniores civitatis, et occurrentes ei dixerunt: Pacificus est ingressus tuus?
verses.english: So Samuel did as the Lord commanded him. And he came to Bethlehem, and the elders of the city were astonished. They came to meet him and asked: 'Is your coming peaceful?'

verses.latin: Et ait: Pacificus: ad immolandum Domino veni: sanctificamini, et venite mecum ad sacrificium. Sanctificavit ergo Isai et filios ejus, et vocavit eos ad sacrificium.
verses.english: And he said: 'It is peaceful. I have come to offer a sacrifice to the Lord. Purify yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice' —this involves ritual cleansing. So Jesse purified himself and his sons, and invited them to the sacrifice.

verses.latin: Cumque introissent, vidit Eliab, et ait: Num coram Domino est Christus ejus?
verses.english: When they came in, Samuel saw Eliab and thought: 'Surely the Lord's Anointed is before Him!' —Samuel initially judged by outward appearance.

verses.latin: Et ait Dominus ad Samuel: Ne respicias vultum ejus, neque altitudinem staturae ejus: quoniam abjeci eum, nec enim juxta intuitum hominis judico: homo enim videt ea quae patent, Dominus vero intuetur cor.
verses.english: But the Lord said to Samuel: 'Do not look at his appearance or his height, for I have rejected him. I do not judge as man judges. For man sees what is visible, but the Lord sees the heart.'

verses.latin: Et vocavit Isai Abinadab, et adduxit eum coram Samuel. Qui ait: Nec hunc elegit Dominus.
verses.english: Then Jesse called Abinadab and brought him before Samuel. And Samuel said: 'The Lord has not chosen this one either.'

verses.latin: Et adduxit Isai Samma: de quo ait: Etiam hunc non elegit Dominus.
verses.english: Then Jesse brought Shammah, of whom Samuel said: 'The Lord has not chosen this one either.'

verses.latin: Adduxit ergo Isai septem filios suos coram Samuel: et ait Samuel ad Isai: Non elegit Dominus ex his.
verses.english: So Jesse brought his seven sons before Samuel. And Samuel said to Jesse: 'The Lord has not chosen any of these.'

verses.latin: Et dixit Samuel ad Isai: Numquid jam reliqui sunt filii tui? Qui respondit: Remanet adhuc parvulus, et pascit oves. Et ait Samuel ad Isai: Mitte, et adduc eum: quoniam non sedebimus priusquam veniat huc.
verses.english: Then Samuel said to Jesse: 'Are these all your sons who remain?' And Jesse replied: 'There still remains the youngest, and he is tending the sheep.' And Samuel said to Jesse: 'Send for him and bring him here, for we will not sit down to eat until he comes here.'

verses.latin: Misit ergo, et adduxit eum. Ipse autem rufus erat, et pulcher aspectu, decoraque forma. Et ait Dominus: Surge, unge eum: ipse est enim.
verses.english: So Jesse sent and brought him in. He was reddish, with beautiful eyes, and a handsome appearance. And the Lord said: 'Arise, anoint him, for this is the one.'

verses.latin: Tulit ergo Samuel cornu olei, et unxit eum in medio fratrum ejus: et directus est spiritus Domini in David a die illa et deinceps: et surrexit Samuel, et abiit in Ramatha.
verses.english: Then Samuel took the horn of oil and anointed him in the presence of his brothers. And the Spirit of the Lord came upon David mightily from that day forward. Then Samuel arose and went to Ramah.

verses.latin: Spiritus autem Domini recessit a Saul, et vexabat eum spiritus nequam a Domino.
verses.english: Now the Spirit of the Lord had departed from Saul, and an evil spirit sent by the Lord tormented him —this doesn't imply God is evil but rather that He allowed or ordained this affliction as a consequence of Saul's disobedience.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt servi Saul ad eum: Ecce spiritus nequam a Domino vexat te.
verses.english: And Saul's servants said to him: 'Behold, an evil spirit from the Lord is tormenting you.'

verses.latin: Jubeat ergo dominus noster, et quaerant servi tui, aliquem scientem psallere cithara, et quando te arripuerit spiritus nequam a Domino, psallat manu sua, et relevaberis.
verses.english: 'Let our lord command, and your servants will search for someone who can play the lyre well. Then, when the evil spirit from the Lord takes hold of you, he can play with his hand, and you will be relieved' —the music would soothe and distract, perhaps creating a more peaceful internal state.

verses.latin: Et ait Saul ad servos suos: Provident mihi ergo aliquem bene psallentem, et adducite eum ad me.
verses.english: And Saul said to his servants: 'Find me now someone who plays well, and bring him to me.'

verses.latin: Et respondens unus de pueris, ait: Ecce vidi filium Isai Bethlehemitae, scientem psallere, et fortissimum, et virum bellicosum, et prudentem in sermonibus, et virum pulchrum: et Dominus est cum eo.
verses.english: Then one of the young men answered and said: 'Behold, I have seen a son of Jesse the Bethlehemite, who is skilled in playing the lyre, and he is a mighty warrior, and a man of war, and prudent in speech, and a handsome man. And the Lord is with him' —this is high praise, acknowledging David's diverse talents and God's favor.

verses.latin: Misit ergo Saul nuntios ad Isai, dicens: Mitte ad me David filium tuum, qui est in pascuis.
verses.english: So Saul sent messengers to Jesse, saying: 'Send me your son David, who is with the sheep.'

verses.latin: Tulit ergo Isai asinum panis, et lagenam vini, et hoedum de capris, et misit per manum David filii sui Saul.
verses.english: So Jesse took an ass loaded with bread, and a flask of wine, and a young goat, and sent them by the hand of David his son to Saul —these were gifts appropriate for a vassal presenting his son to a king.

verses.latin: Et venit David ad Saul, et stetit coram eo: et dilexit eum vehementer, et factus est ejus armiger.
verses.english: And David came to Saul and stood before him. And Saul loved him greatly, and he became his armor-bearer —this was an important position of trust and proximity to the king.

verses.latin: Misitque Saul ad Isai, dicens: Stet David in conspectu meo: placuit enim mihi.
verses.english: And Saul sent word to Jesse, saying: 'Let David remain in my service, for he has found favor in my sight' —meaning, he has pleased me or I am pleased with him.

verses.latin: Igitur quandocumque spiritus a Domino malus arripiebat Saul, David tollebat citharam, et percutiebat manu sua, et refocillabatur Saul, et levius habebat: recedebat enim ab eo spiritus malus.
verses.english: Therefore, whenever the evil spirit from the Lord seized Saul, David would take his lyre and play it with his hand. Then Saul would be refreshed and feel better, for the evil spirit would depart from him.

verses.latin: Congregantes autem Philisthim agmina sua in praelium, convenerunt in Socho Judae, et castrametati sunt inter Socho et Azeca in finibus Dommim.
verses.english: Now the Philistines gathered their armies for battle. They assembled at Socoh, which belongs to Judah, and they encamped between Socoh and Azekah, in Ephes-dammim.

verses.latin: Saul autem et viri Israel congregati venerunt in vallem Terebinthi, et instruxerunt aciem contra Philisthim.
verses.english: Saul and the men of Israel assembled and came to the Valley of Elah, and they drew up their battle line against the Philistines.

verses.latin: Et Philisthim stabant super montem ex hac parte, et Israel stabat super montem ex alia parte: vallis autem erat inter eos.
verses.english: The Philistines stood on a mountain on one side, and Israel stood on a mountain on the other side. And there was a valley between them.

verses.latin: Et egressus est vir spurius de castris Philisthinorum, nomine Goliath, de Geth, altitudinis sex cubitorum et palmi.
verses.english: Then a champion came out of the Philistine camp, named Goliath, from Gath. His height was six cubits and a span —approximately nine feet nine inches tall.

verses.latin: Et cassis aerea erat in capite ejus, et lorica squamata induebatur. Porro pondus loricae ejus quinque millia siclorum aeris:
verses.english: He had a bronze helmet on his head, and he was clothed with a scale-armor breastplate. The weight of his breastplate was five thousand shekels of bronze —approximately one hundred and twenty-five pounds of bronze.

verses.latin: et ocreae aereae erant in lacertis pedum ejus, et clypeus aereus tegebat humeros ejus.
verses.english: And he had bronze greaves on his legs, and a bronze shield was carried between his shoulders.

verses.latin: Et hastile hastae ejus quasi liciatorium texentium, et lancea ejus sexcentos siclos ferri. Porro armiger ejus antecedebat eum.
verses.english: The shaft of his spear was like a weaver's beam, and his spearhead weighed six hundred shekels of iron —approximately fifteen pounds. And his armor-bearer went before him.

verses.latin: Stansque clamavit adversum acies Israel, et dixit eis: Quare venistis parati ad praelium? numquid ego Philisthaeus, et vos servi Saul? Eligite ex vobis virum, et descendat ad singulare certamen.
verses.english: Then he stood and cried out to the armies of Israel, and said to them: 'Why have you come out and drawn up for battle? Am I not a Philistine, and you servants of Saul? Choose a man for yourselves, and let him come down to me for single combat!'

verses.latin: Si potuerit pugnare mecum, et percusserit me, nos servi erimus vobis: si autem ego praevaluero, et percussero eum, vos servi eritis nobis, et servietis nobis.
verses.english: 'If he is able to fight with me and defeat me, then we will be your servants. But if I prevail and defeat him, then you will be our servants, and you will serve us.'

verses.latin: Et dixit Philisthaeus: Ego exprobravi agminibus Israel hodie: date mihi virum, et inibo singulare certamen cum eo.
verses.english: And the Philistine said: 'I have defied the armies of Israel today! Give me a man, that we may fight in single combat!'

verses.latin: Audiens autem Saul et universus Israel sermones Philisthaei hujuscemodi, conturbati sunt, et pertimuerunt vehementer.
verses.english: When Saul and all Israel heard these words from the Philistine, they were dismayed and greatly afraid —the challenge was terrifying due to Goliath's immense size and weaponry.

verses.latin: David autem erat filius viri Ephrataei de Bethlehem Juda, cujus nomen erat Isai, et habebat octo filios: et vir in diebus Saul senex et grandaevus inter viros.
verses.english: Now David was the son of an Ephrathite man from Bethlehem in Judah. His name was Jesse, and he had eight sons. And in the days of Saul, the man Jesse was old and well advanced in years among men —this clarifies Jesse's age and prominence in his community.

verses.latin: Abierant itaque tres filii ejus majores post Saul ad praelium: et nomina eorum: primogenitus Eliab, secundus Abinadab, tertius Samma.
verses.english: And Jesse's three oldest sons had gone after Saul to the battle. Their names were: the firstborn Eliab, the second Abinadab, and the third Shammah.

verses.latin: David autem erat minimus. Tribus ergo majoribus secutis Saul,
verses.english: David was the youngest. So while the three oldest followed Saul,

verses.latin: David abierat, et reversus fuerat a Saul, ut pasceret gregem patris sui in Bethlehem.
verses.english: David had gone away and returned from Saul's service. He went back to feed his father's flock in Bethlehem —this explains why David was not immediately present at the battle, indicating a period of time has passed.

verses.latin: Procedebat vero Philisthaeus mane et vespere, et stabat quadraginta diebus.
verses.english: And the Philistine came forward morning and evening. He stood challenging for forty days —this emphasizes the prolonged terror and the immense pressure on the Israelite army.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Isai ad David filium suum: Sume fratribus tuis modium parapsidis, et decem panes istos, et curre in castra ad fratres tuos.
verses.english: Then Jesse said to David his son: 'Take for your brothers this ephah of roasted grain, and these ten loaves of bread. And hurry to the camp to your brothers.'

verses.latin: Congregantes autem Philisthiim agmina sua in prælium, convenerunt in Socho Juda, et castrametati sunt inter Socho et Azeca in finibus Ephesdommim.
verses.english: Now the Philistines gathered their armies for battle. They assembled at Socho in Judah, and they set up their camp between Socho and Azeca, in the territory of Ephesdammim.

verses.latin: Saul vero et viri Israël congregati venerunt in vallem Terebinthi, et castrametati sunt ex adverso Philisthinorum.
verses.english: But Saul and the men of Israel gathered together. They came to the Valley of Terebinth and set up their camp opposite the Philistines.

verses.latin: Et steterunt Philisthiim super montem ex hac parte, et Israël stetit super montem ex altera parte : vallisque erat inter eos.
verses.english: The Philistines stood on a mountain on one side, and Israel stood on a mountain on the other side. A valley was between them.

verses.latin: Et egressus est vir spurius de castris Philisthinorum nomine Goliath, de Geth, altitudinis sex cubitorum et palmi.
verses.english: Then a mighty warrior came out from the Philistine camp, whose name was Goliath, from Gath. He was six cubits and a palm in height—an incredible height for a man.

verses.latin: Et cassis ænea erat in capite ejus, et lorica squamata induebatur : et pondus loricæ ejus quinque millia siclorum æris :
verses.english: A bronze helmet was on his head, and he wore a coat of scaled armor. The weight of his armor was five thousand shekels of bronze.

verses.latin: et ocreæ æneæ erant in cruribus ejus, et clypeus æneus tegebat humeros ejus.
verses.english: Bronze greaves were on his legs, and a bronze shield protected his shoulders.

verses.latin: Et hasta ejus sicut liciatorium texentium : et lanceolæ ejus quasi sexcenti sicli ferri erant. Et armiger ejus antecedebat eum.
verses.english: The shaft of his spear was like a weaver's beam, and his spearhead weighed six hundred shekels of iron. His shield-bearer walked before him.

verses.latin: Stansque clamavit adversum acies Israël, et dixit eis : Quare venistis parati ad præliem ? numquid non ego sum Philisthæus, et vos servi Saul ? eligite ex vobis virum, et descendat ad singulare certamen.
verses.english: He stood and shouted at the battle lines of Israel, saying to them: "Why have you come out prepared for battle? Am I not a Philistine, and are you not servants of Saul? Choose a man from among yourselves, and let him come down for single combat."

verses.latin: Si potuerit pugnare mecum, et percusserit me, erimus vobis servi : si autem ego prævaluero, et percussero eum, vos eritis nobis servi, et servietis nobis.
verses.english: "If he can fight with me and defeat me, then we will be your servants. But if I overpower him and defeat him, then you will be our servants and you will serve us."

verses.latin: Et adjecit Philisthæus : Ego exprobravi agminibus Israël hodie : date mihi virum, et inibo singulare certamen cum eo.
verses.english: And the Philistine added: "I have defied the armies of Israel today! Give me a man, and I will enter into single combat with him!"

verses.latin: Audiens autem Saul et universus Israël sermones Philisthæi hujuscemodi, perturbati sunt, et timuerunt nimis.
verses.english: When Saul and all Israel heard these words from the Philistine, they were greatly troubled and became very afraid.

verses.latin: David vero erat filius viri Ephratæi de Bethlehem Juda, cujus nomen erat Isai, qui habebat octo filios : et ipse vir in diebus Saul senex et grandævus inter viros.
verses.english: Now David was the son of an Ephrathite man from Bethlehem in Judah, whose name was Jesse. Jesse had eight sons. And during the time of Saul, this man was old and advanced in years among men.

verses.latin: Et abiissent tres filii Isai majores natu post Saul ad prælium : et nomina eorum : primogenitus Amnadab, secundus Abinadab, tertius Samma.
verses.english: And Jesse's three eldest sons had gone to battle with Saul. Their names were: the firstborn Amnadab, the second Abinadab, and the third Shammah.

verses.latin: David autem erat minimus. Tribus ergo majoribus natu secutis Saul,
verses.english: But David was the youngest. So the three eldest had followed Saul.

verses.latin: David abierat, et reversus fuerat a Saul, ut pasceret gregem patris sui in Bethlehem.
verses.english: David had gone and returned from Saul to tend his father's flock in Bethlehem.

verses.latin: Procedebat vero Philisthæus mane et vespere, et stabat quadraginta diebus.
verses.english: The Philistine came forward morning and evening. And he stood there for forty days, challenging them daily.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Isai ad David filium suum : Accipe fratribus tuis epham paropsidum, et decem panes istos, et curre in castra ad fratres tuos.
verses.english: Now Jesse said to his son David: "Take this ephah of parched grain for your brothers, and these ten loaves of bread. And hurry to the camp, to your brothers."

verses.latin: Et decem formellas casei has deferes ad tribunum : et fratres tuos visitabis, si recte agant, et quæ te referant.
verses.english: "And these ten cheeses you shall bring to the commander (tribune). And visit your brothers, see how they are doing, and bring back word from them."

verses.latin: Saul autem, et illi, et omnes viri Israël, erant in valle Terebinthi, pugnantes adversum Philisthiim.
verses.english: Now Saul, and his men, and all the men of Israel, were in the Valley of Terebinth, engaged in war against the Philistines.

verses.latin: Igitur David de nocte consurgens, dimisit gregem patri suo, et tollens onera processit sicut præceperat ei Isai : et venit ad munitionem, cum exercitus egrederetur ad pugnam, et vociferaretur in certamine.
verses.english: So David rose early in the morning, leaving the flock with a keeper for his father. And taking the provisions, he went as Jesse had commanded him. He arrived at the camp just as the army was going out to the battle line and shouting the war cry.

verses.latin: Et Israël et Philisthiim acies direxerant, acies ex adverso ad aciem.
verses.english: And Israel and the Philistines had drawn up their battle lines, arrayed line against line.

verses.latin: Et relinquens David vasa quæ attulerat sub manu custodis sarcinarum, cucurrit ad locum certaminis, et interrogabat fratres suos si recte agerent.
verses.english: David left the things he had brought in the care of the baggage keeper. He ran to the battle line and asked his brothers how they were doing.

verses.latin: Adhuc eo loquente, ecce ille vir spurius, Goliath nomine, Philisthæus de Geth, ascendebat de castris Philisthinorum : et loquebatur juxta pristina verba : et audivit David.
verses.english: While he was still speaking, behold, that mighty warrior named Goliath, the Philistine from Gath, was coming up from the Philistine camp. And he spoke according to his previous words, and David heard him.

verses.latin: Omnes autem Israëlitarum viri, cum vidissent virum, fugerunt a facie ejus, et timuerunt nimis.
verses.english: Now all the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from his presence and were greatly afraid.

verses.latin: Et dixit unusquisque ad proximum suum : Numquid vidistis virum istum, qui ascendit ? ad exprobrandum enim Israël ascendit. Virum ergo quem percusserit rex, divitiis magnis augebit, et filiam suam dabit ei, et domum patris ejus faciet absque tributo in Israël.
verses.english: And everyone said to his neighbor: "Have you seen this man who has come up? He has certainly come up to defy Israel. The man who strikes him down will be greatly enriched by the king, and the king will give him his daughter, and he will make his father's house free from tribute in Israel."

verses.latin: Et ait David ad viros qui stabant secum, dicens : Quis est hic Philisthæus incircumcisus, qui exprobravit agminibus Dei viventis ? Et quæ erit merces viri qui percusserit eum, et abstulerit opprobrium de Israël ?
verses.english: And David said to the men who stood by him, saying: "Who is this uncircumcised Philistine, who has defied the armies of the living God? And what will be the reward for the man who strikes him down and removes this disgrace from Israel?"

verses.latin: Et redixit ei populus juxta verbum pristinum, dicens : Hæc dabuntur viro qui percusserit eum.
verses.english: And the people repeated to him the former words, saying: "These things will be given to the man who strikes him down."

verses.latin: Audiit autem Amnadab frater ejus major, loquentem ipsum ad alios : et iratus est furore contra David, et ait : Quare venisti huc ? et cui reliquisti pauculas oves in deserto ? ego scio superbiam tuam, et nequitiam cordis tui : quia ut videres prælium, venisti.
verses.english: Now Amnadab, his eldest brother, heard him speaking to the others. And he became angry with David, and he said: "Why have you come down here? And to whom have you left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know your pride and the wickedness of your heart, because you have come down only to see the battle."

verses.latin: Et ait David : Quid feci ? numquid non sermo est ?
verses.english: And David said: "What have I done now? Was it not just a question?"

verses.latin: Et declinavit ab eo, loquens ad alterum juxta verbum prius : et respondit ei populus verbum pristinum.
verses.english: And he turned away from Amnadab and spoke to another man with the same question as before. And the people gave him the same answer as before.

verses.latin: Audita sunt autem verba quæ locutus est David, et nuntiata in conspectu Saul. Cumque audisset, accersivit eum.
verses.english: Now the words which David spoke were heard. And they were reported in the presence of Saul. And when Saul heard, he sent for him.

verses.latin: Et ait David ad Saul : Non concidat cor cujusquam in hoc : ego servus tuus ibo, et pugnabo adversum Philisthæum hunc.
verses.english: And David said to Saul: "Let no one's heart fail because of this. I, your servant, will go and fight against this Philistine."

verses.latin: Et dixit Saul ad David : Non vales resistere Philisthæo isti, nec pugnare adversum eum : quia puer es, et iste vir bellator est ab adolescentia sua.
verses.english: And Saul said to David: "You are not able to stand against this Philistine, nor to fight against him. For you are but a boy, and he has been a warrior from his youth."

verses.latin: Dixitque David ad Saul : Pastor erat servus tuus patri suo, gregis, et cum veniret leo vel ursus, et raperet arietem de medio gregis,
verses.english: And David said to Saul: "Your servant was tending his father's flock as a shepherd. And when a lion or a bear came and carried off a ram from the middle of the flock,"

verses.latin: persequabar et interficiebam, et eruam illum de ore ejus : et si consurgeret contra me, arripiam mentum ejus, et suffocabo, et interficiam illum.
verses.english: "I would pursue it and strike it down, and rescue the ram from its mouth. And if it rose up against me, I would seize its jaw, and choke it, and kill it."

verses.latin: Nam et leonem et ursum ego servus tuus interfeci : igitur et Philisthæum hunc incircumcisum, sicut unum ex illis confringam. Quia lacessivit acies Dei viventis.
verses.english: "Indeed, your servant has killed both a lion and a bear. Therefore, this uncircumcised Philistine I will destroy just like one of them, because he has defied the armies of the living God."

verses.latin: Et adjecit David : Dominus qui eruit me de manu leonis, et de manu ursi, ipse me eruet de manu Philisthæi hujus. Et ait Saul ad David : Vade, et Dominus sit tecum.
verses.english: And David added: "The Lord, who rescued me from the paw of the lion and from the paw of the bear, He himself will rescue me from the hand of this Philistine." And Saul said to David: "Go, and may the Lord be with you."

verses.latin: Et induit Saul David vestimentis suis, et clypeum æneum posuit in capite ejus, et vestivit eum lorica.
verses.english: And Saul clothed David with his own garments. And he put a bronze helmet on his head, and he clothed him with a coat of mail.

verses.latin: Accinctusque David gladio ejus super vestem suam, cœpit probare si posset incedere, quia non erat assuetus. Et dixit David ad Saul : Non possum sic incedere, quia non sum assuetus. Et deposuit ea.
verses.english: And David girded his sword over his garments. He began to try walking, for he was not accustomed to it. And David said to Saul: "I cannot go with these, for I am not accustomed to them." And he took them off.

verses.latin: Et tulit baculum suum, quem semper habebat in manibus : et elegit sibi quinque limpidissimos lapides de torrente, et posuit eos in sacculo pastorali, quem habebat secum, et fundam manu tenuit : et processit adversum Philisthæum.
verses.english: And he took his staff, which he always held in his hands. And he chose for himself five smooth stones from the stream. And he put them in his shepherd's bag which he had with him. And he held his sling in his hand, and he went forward against the Philistine.

verses.latin: Congregaverunt autem Philisthim agmina sua in prælium, et convenerunt in Soccho Judæ, et castrametati sunt inter Soccho et Azeca in Ephes Dammim.
verses.english: Now the Philistines gathered their armies for war. They assembled in Socco of Judah, setting up their camp between Socco and Azeca, in a place called Ephes Dammim.
