verses.english: So David left them with the king of Moab, and they stayed with him for all the days that David was in his stronghold.

verses.latin: Dixitque Gad propheta ad David: Noli manere in praesidio, proficiscere, et vade in terram Juda. Et profectus David, venit in silvam Hareth.
verses.english: Then Gad the prophet said to David: "Do not remain in this stronghold; depart and go into the land of Judah." So David left and came into the forest of Hereth.

verses.latin: Et audivit Saul quod apparuisset David, et viri qui erant cum eo, nunc autem Saul morabatur in Gabaa, et sedebat in nemore, quod est in Rama, habens lanceam in manu sua, et universi servi ejus circumstabant eum.
verses.english: Now Saul heard that David had been discovered, along with the men who were with him. At that time, Saul was staying in Gibeah, sitting under a tamarisk tree on a high place in Ramah, with his spear in his hand, and all his servants were standing around him.

verses.latin: Dixitque Saul ad servos suos, qui circumstabant eum: Audite, obsecro, filii Jemini: numquid omnibus vobis dabit filius Isai agros et vineas, et universos vos faciet tribunos et centuriones:
verses.english: Saul said to his servants who stood around him: "Listen, I beg you, sons of Jemini! Will the son of Jesse give all of you fields and vineyards, and make all of you commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds?

verses.latin: quare conjurastis omnes contra me, et non est qui mihi renuntiet, cur ineat federis filius meus cum filio Isai? nec est qui vicem meam doleat ex vobis, nec qui annuntiet mihi: eo quod suscitavit filius meus servum meum adversum me insidiantem mihi usque hodie?
verses.english: Why have all of you conspired against me? No one among you reports to me that my son has made a covenant with the son of Jesse. No one among you grieves for me or informs me that my son has incited my servant to ambush me, as he has done even to this very day."

verses.latin: Respondensque Doeg Idumaeus, qui assistebat, et primus erat inter servos Saul, ait: Vidi filium Isai in Nobe apud Achimelech filium Achitob pontificem:
verses.english: Then Doeg the Edomite, who was standing there and was the chief among Saul's servants, answered and said: "I saw the son of Jesse in Nob, with Ahimelech, the son of Ahitub, the high priest.

verses.latin: qui consuluit pro eo Dominum, et cibaria dedit ei, sed et gladium Goliath Philisthaei.
verses.english: Ahimelech consulted the Lord for him, and also gave him provisions and even the sword of Goliath the Philistine."

verses.latin: Misit ergo rex ad Achimelech sacerdotem filium Achitob, et ad omnem domum patris ejus, sacerdotum qui erant in Nobe, qui universi venerunt ad regem.
verses.english: So the king sent for Ahimelech the priest, the son of Ahitub, and for his father's entire household, the priests who were in Nob. They all came to the king.

verses.latin: Et ait Saul: Audi, fili Achitob. Qui respondit: Praesto sum, domine.
verses.english: Saul said: "Listen, son of Ahitub!" And he answered: "I am ready, my lord."

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eum Saul: Quare conjurastis adversum me, tu et filius Isai? et dedisti ei panem et gladium, et consuluisiti pro eo Deum, ut consurgeret adversum me, insidiator usque hodie?
verses.english: Saul said to him: "Why have you conspired against me, you and the son of Jesse? You gave him bread and a sword, and you consulted God for him, so that he might rise up against me as an enemy, as an ambusher, even to this day?"

verses.latin: Respondensque Achimelech regi, ait: Et quis in omnibus servis tuis sicut David, fidelis, et gener regis, et pergens ad imperium tuum, et honoratus in domo tua?
verses.english: Ahimelech answered the king, saying: "And who among all your servants is as faithful as David? He is the king's son-in-law, always ready to obey your command, and honored in your own household!

verses.latin: Numquid hodie cepi consulere pro eo Deum? Absit hoc a me: ne suspicetur rex in servum suum, neque in omnem domum patris mei: non enim scivit servus tuus de hoc negotio quidquam minus aut plus.
verses.english: Is this the first time I began consulting God for him? Absolutely not! Let the king not suspect anything against his servant, nor against my father's entire household; for your servant knew nothing about this matter, neither little nor much."

verses.latin: Et ait rex: Morte morieris, Achimelech, tu, et omnis domus patris tui.
verses.english: And the king said: "You shall surely die, Ahimelech, you and all of your father's household!"

verses.latin: Et ait rex emissariis, qui circumstabant eum: Convertimini, et interficite sacerdotes Domini: quia manus eorum cum David est, et scientes fugisset, non indicaverunt mihi. Et noluerunt servi regis extendere manum suam in sacerdotes Domini.
verses.english: Then the king said to his bodyguards, who stood around him: "Turn around and kill the priests of the Lord, because their loyalty is with David; they knew he had fled, yet they did not inform me." But the king's servants refused to raise their hands against the Lord's priests.

verses.latin: Et ait rex Doeg: Convertere tu, et irrue in sacerdotes. Et conversus Doeg Idumaeus, irruit in sacerdotes, et interfecit in die illa octoginta quinque viros vestitos ephod.
verses.english: So the king said to Doeg: "You turn, and fall upon the priests!" And Doeg the Edomite turned, and he attacked the priests, killing on that day eighty-five men who wore the linen ephod, a sacred garment worn by priests.

verses.latin: Nobe quoque civitatem sacerdotum percussit in ore gladii, viros et mulieres, parvulos et lactentes, bovem et asinum et ovem, in ore gladii.
verses.english: He also struck Nob, the city of the priests, with the edge of the sword, killing men and women, children and nursing infants, as well as oxen, donkeys, and sheep, all by the edge of the sword.

verses.latin: Evicit autem unus filius Achimelech filii Achitob, nomen ejus Abiathar, et fugit ad David.
verses.english: However, one son of Ahimelech, the son of Ahitub, escaped. His name was Abiathar, and he fled to David.

verses.latin: Et annuntiavit David quod interfecisset Saul sacerdotes Domini.
verses.english: He reported to David that Saul had killed the Lord's priests.

verses.latin: Et ait David ad Abiathar: Sciebam in die illa, quod cum Doeg Idumaeus esset ibi, proculdubio nuntiaret Saul: ego sum reus omnium animarum domus patris tui.
verses.english: David said to Abiathar: "I knew on that day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would surely report it to Saul. I am responsible for the loss of all the lives of your father's household.

verses.latin: Mane mecum, ne timeas: quicumque enim quaesierit animam meam, quaeret et animam tuam, mecumque salvaberis.
verses.english: Stay with me; do not be afraid. For whoever seeks my life will also seek your life, and with me, you will be safe."

verses.latin: Et nuntiaverunt David dicentes: Ecce Philisthiim oppugnant Ceila, et ipsi diripiunt areas.
verses.english: Then people brought news to David, saying: "Listen! The Philistines are attacking Keilah, and they are looting the threshing floors."

verses.latin: Et consuluit David Dominum, dicens: Si vadam, et percutiam Philisthiim istos? Et dixit Dominus ad David: Vade, et percuties Philisthiim, et salvabis Ceila.
verses.english: So David consulted the Lord, saying: "Should I go and strike down these Philistines?" And the Lord said to David: "Go, and you will strike down the Philistines, and you will save Keilah."

verses.latin: Et dixerunt viri qui erant cum David ad eum: Ecce nos hic in Judaea consistentes, timemus: quanto magis si iremus in Ceila, et in aciem contra agmina Philisthinorum?
verses.english: But the men who were with David said to him: "Look, we are afraid even here in Judah. How much more will we be afraid if we go to Keilah and face the armies of the Philistines?"

verses.latin: Rursum ergo David consuluit Dominum. Responditque ei Dominus, et ait: Surge, et vade in Ceila: quia ego tradam Philisthiim in manu tua.
verses.english: So David again consulted the Lord. And the Lord answered him and said: "Rise up, and go to Keilah, because I will deliver the Philistines into your hand."

verses.latin: Abiit ergo David, et viri ejus in Ceila, et pugnavit adversum Philisthiim, et minavit jumenta eorum, et percussit eos plaga magna: et salvavit David habitatores Ceila.
verses.english: Therefore David and his men went to Keilah, and he fought against the Philistines, and he drove off their livestock, and he struck them with a great slaughter; and so David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum fugisset Abiathar filius Achimelech ad David in Ceila, ephod in manu ejus deferens.
verses.english: Now it happened that when Abiathar, the son of Ahimelech, fled to David in Keilah, he was carrying the ephod in his hand.

verses.latin: Et nuntiatum est Saul quod venisset David in Ceila, dixitque Saul: Tradidit Deus eum in manus meas: conclususque est, introgressus urbem quæ portas habet et vectes.
verses.english: And it was reported to Saul that David had come to Keilah, and Saul said: "God has delivered him into my hands, for he is shut in, having entered a city that has gates and bars."

verses.latin: Et præcepit Saul omni populo ut ad bellum descenderet in Ceila, et obsideret David et viros ejus.
verses.english: And Saul commanded all the people to go down to war in Keilah and to besiege David and his men.

verses.latin: Porro David, cum scisset quod pararet ei Saul clam malum, dixit ad Abiathar sacerdotem: Applica ephod.
verses.english: However, David, when he knew that Saul was secretly preparing evil against him, said to Abiathar the priest: "Bring the ephod here."

verses.latin: Et ait David: Domine Deus Israël, audivit famam servus tuus quod Saul quærat venire ad Ceila, ut evertat urbem propter me.
verses.english: And David said: "O Lord God of Israel, Your servant has heard the report that Saul seeks to come to Keilah to destroy the city on account of me."

verses.latin: Si tradent me viri Ceila in manus ejus? Et si descendet Saul, sicut audivit servus tuus? Domine Deus Israël, indica servo tuo.
verses.english: "Will the men of Keilah deliver me into his hands? And will Saul come down, as Your servant has heard? O Lord God of Israel, tell Your servant."

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus: Tradent.
verses.english: And the Lord said: "They will deliver you."

verses.latin: Et surrexit David, et viri ejus quasi sexcenti, et egressi sunt de Ceila, et incerti quo irent, vagabantur. Nuntiatumque est Saul quod fugisset David de Ceila, et intermisit iter.
verses.english: So David and his men, about six hundred of them, rose up and went out from Keilah, and they wandered about, uncertain where to go. And it was reported to Saul that David had fled from Keilah, so he halted his journey.

verses.latin: Mansit autem David in deserto, in locis munitissimis: mansit quoque in monte deserto Ziph. Quærebant ergo eum Saul cunctis diebus: et non tradidit eum Deus in manus ejus.
verses.english: But David remained in the wilderness, in very fortified places; he also remained on the desert mountain of Ziph. So Saul searched for him every day, but God did not deliver him into his hands.

verses.latin: Et vidit David quod egressus esset Saul ut quæreret animam suam: porro David erat in deserto Ziph in silva.
verses.english: And David saw that Saul had come out to seek his life. Now David was in the wilderness of Ziph, in the forest.

verses.latin: Et surrexit Jonathas filius Saul, et abiit ad David in silvam, et confortavit manus ejus in Deo: dixitque ei:
verses.english: Then Jonathan, Saul's son, rose up and went to David in the forest, and he strengthened David's hand in God, and said to him:

verses.latin: Ne timeas, quia non te apprehendet manus Saul patris mei, et tu regnabis super Israël, et ego ero secundus tibi: sed et Saul pater meus scit hoc.
verses.english: "Do not be afraid, for the hand of Saul my father will not seize you. You will reign over Israel, and I will be second to you. Even my father Saul knows this."

verses.latin: Percussit ergo David et Jonathas fœdus coram Domino: mansitque David in silva: Jonathas autem reversus est in domum suam.
verses.english: So David and Jonathan made a covenant before the Lord. And David remained in the forest, but Jonathan returned to his home.

verses.latin: Ascenderunt autem Ziphei a David ad Saul in Gabaa, dicentes: Nonne David latitat apud nos in locis tutissimis in silva, in colle Hachila, quæ est ad dexteram deserti?
verses.english: Now the Ziphites went up from David to Saul in Gibeah, saying: "Is not David hiding among us in the very strongholds in the forest, on the hill of Hachilah, which is to the right of the desert?"

verses.latin: Nunc ergo, si desiderasti anima tua ut descendas, descende: et nostri est officii ut tradamus eum in manus regis.
verses.english: "Now then, if your soul desires to come down, come down. It is our duty to deliver him into the king's hands."

verses.latin: Et ait Saul: Benedicti vos a Domino, quia doluistis vicem meam.
verses.english: And Saul said: "May you be blessed by the Lord, because you have felt sorrow for my plight."

verses.latin: Ite igitur, et præparate vos, et scitote, et considerate de loco ejus ubi versatur, aut quis eam viderit: aut quis de loco ejus, si vere ibi est, me scire faciat.
verses.english: "Go therefore, and prepare yourselves, and find out and carefully observe the place where he stays, or who has seen him; or if he is truly there, let someone make me know his exact location."

verses.latin: Considerate, et scitote de omnibus latibulis, in quibus latitat: et revertimini ad me ad certum locum, ut vadam vobiscum. Quod si fuerit in terra, perscrutabor eum in cunctis millibus Judæ.
verses.english: "Observe closely and know all the hiding places in which he hides, and return to me at a certain place, so that I may go with you. For if he is in the land, I will search for him among all the thousands of Judah."

verses.latin: Et surrexerunt, et abierunt in Ziph ante Saul. David autem et viri ejus erant in deserto Maon, in campestribus ad dexteram Jesimon.
verses.english: So they rose up and went to Ziph ahead of Saul. But David and his men were in the wilderness of Maon, in the plain to the right of Jeshimon.

verses.latin: Descendit ergo Saul et comites ejus ad inquirendum: quod cum nuntiatum esset David, descendit ad petram et mansit in deserto Maon. Quod cum audisset Saul, persecutus est David in deserto Maon.
verses.english: So Saul and his companions went down to search. And when this was reported to David, he went down to the rock and remained in the wilderness of Maon. When Saul heard this, he pursued David into the wilderness of Maon.

verses.latin: Et ibat Saul ad latus montis hujus, et David cum viris suis ad latus montis illius: porro David festinabat ut fugeret a facie Saul, et Saul cum exercitu suo circuibat David, et viros ejus ut caperet.
verses.english: And Saul went on one side of this mountain, and David with his men on the other side of that mountain. Now David was hurrying to flee from Saul, and Saul with his army was encircling David and his men to capture them.

verses.latin: Nuntius igitur venit ad Saul, dicens: Festina, et veni, quoniam irruerunt Philisthiim super terram.
verses.english: Then a messenger came to Saul, saying: "Hurry and come, for the Philistines have raided the land!"

verses.latin: Reversus est ergo Saul, cessavitque persequi David: ob hanc causam vocaverunt locum illum, Petram dividentem.
verses.english: So Saul returned and stopped pursuing David. For this reason, they called that place "The Dividing Rock."

verses.latin: Ascendit ergo David inde, et mansit in locis munitissimis Engaddi.
verses.english: Therefore David went up from there and remained in the strongholds of En-Gedi.

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum reversus esset Saul, prosequens Philisthæos, nuntiatum est ei dicentes: Ecce David in deserto Engaddi est.
verses.english: Now it happened that when Saul returned from pursuing the Philistines, a message was brought to him, saying: 'Indeed, David is in the wilderness of Engedi!'

verses.latin: Assumpsit ergo Saul tria millia virorum selectorum de cuncto Israël, et abiit ad investigandum David, et viros ejus, usque ad abruptissimas petras, quæ caprearum sunt.
verses.english: So Saul took three thousand chosen men from all of Israel and went to seek out David and his men, going as far as the most rugged rocks, where the wild goats dwell.

verses.latin: Et venit ad caulas ovium, quæ in via erant, et spelunca erat ibi. Ingressusque est Saul, ut purgaret ventrem: porro David et viri ejus in interioribus speluncæ latitabant.
verses.english: And he came to the sheepfolds that were along the way, and there was a cave there. Saul entered it to relieve himself. Now, David and his men were hiding in the inner parts of the cave, deep inside.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque viri David ad eum: Ecce dies, de qua locutus est Dominus ad te: Ego dabo tibi inimicum tuum, ut facias ei sicut placuerit in oculis tuis. Surrexit ergo David, et præcidit oram chlamydis Saul silenter.
verses.english: And David's men said to him: 'Behold, this is the very day of which the Lord spoke to you, saying: 'I will deliver your enemy into your hand, so that you may do to him whatever seems right in your eyes!'' Therefore, David rose up and quietly cut off the hem of Saul's cloak.

verses.latin: Post hæc percussit cor David, eo quod abscidisset oram chlamydis Saul.
verses.english: After this, David's conscience struck him, because he had cut off the hem of Saul's cloak, recognizing it as a disrespectful act against God's anointed.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad viros suos: Propitius sit mihi Dominus, ne faciam hanc rem domino meo uncto Domini, ut extendam manum meam in eum, quoniam christus Domini est.
verses.english: And he said to his men: 'May the Lord be merciful to me, that I should not do this thing to my lord, the Lord's anointed, by laying my hand on him. For he is the Christ—the anointed one—of the Lord!'

verses.latin: Et confregit David viros suos sermonibus, et non permisit eos ut consurgerent in Saul: porro Saul consurgens de spelunca, pergebat viam suam.
verses.english: And David restrained his men with these words, and he did not permit them to rise up against Saul. Meanwhile, Saul rose from the cave and continued on his way.

verses.latin: Surrexit autem et David post eum: et egressus de spelunca clamavit post tergum Saul, dicens: Domine mi rex.
verses.english: However, David also rose after him and, coming out of the cave, he cried out behind Saul, saying: 'My lord, O King!'

verses.latin: Et Saul respexit post se: et inclinans se David pronus in terram, adoravit.
verses.english: And Saul looked behind him. Then David bowed himself with his face to the ground and worshipped, showing profound respect.

verses.latin: Et dixit David ad Saul: Quare audis verba hominum loquentium et dicentium: Ecce David quærit malum tuum?
verses.english: And David said to Saul: 'Why do you listen to the words of men who speak and say: 'Behold, David seeks your harm?' These are false accusations.

verses.latin: Ecce hodie viderunt oculi tui, quod tradiderit te Dominus in manu mea in spelunca, et cogitavi ut occiderem te, sed pepercit tibi oculus meus.
verses.english: Behold, today your own eyes have seen that the Lord delivered you into my hand in the cave. I considered killing you, but my eye spared you; I had compassion on you.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Non extendam manum meam in dominum meum, quia christus Domini est.
verses.english: And I said: 'I will not lay my hand on my lord, because he is the Christ—the anointed one—of the Lord!'

verses.latin: Quin potius, pater mi, vide et cognosce hanc oram chlamydis tuæ in manu mea, quoniam cum præciderem oram tuam, nolui extendere manum meam in te.
verses.english: Look rather, my father, and acknowledge this hem of your cloak in my hand. For when I cut off your hem, I refused to lay my hand on you.

verses.latin: Animadverte, et vide quoniam non est in manu mea malum, neque iniquitas, neque peccatum, neque deliqui in te: sed tu insidiaris animæ meæ, ut auferas eam.
verses.english: Understand this, and see that there is no evil in my hand, nor injustice, nor any sin on my part, and I have committed no offense against you. Yet you lie in wait for my very life, to take it away.

verses.latin: Judicet Dominus inter me et te, et ulciscatur me Dominus de te: manus autem mea non sit in te.
verses.english: May the Lord judge between me and you, and may the Lord avenge me against you, but my hand shall not be against you. I will not take justice into my own hands.

verses.latin: Sicut et prov. vetus est: Ab impiis egredietur impietas: manus autem mea non sit in te.
verses.english: Just as the old proverb says: 'Wickedness proceeds from the wicked.' But my hand shall not be against you.

verses.latin: Quem persequeris rex Israël? Quem persequeris? Canem mortuum, an pulicem unum?
verses.english: Whom are you pursuing, O King of Israel? Whom are you pursuing? A dead dog, or a single flea? These are insults, showing how little of a threat I am.

verses.latin: Sit Dominus judex, et judicet inter me et te, et videat, et judicet causam meam, et liberet me de manu tua.
verses.english: May the Lord be judge, and may He judge between me and you. May He see and decide my cause, and deliver me from your hand.

verses.latin: Cum autem complesset David loquens sermones istos ad Saul, dixit Saul: Numquid vox hæc tua est, fili mi David?
verses.english: Now when David had finished speaking these words to Saul, Saul said: 'Is this your voice, my son David?'

verses.latin: Et levavit Saul vocem suam, et flevit.
verses.english: And Saul raised his voice and wept aloud.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad David: Justior es me: tu enim reddidisti mihi bona, ego autem reddidi tibi mala.
verses.english: And he said to David: 'You are more righteous than I, for you have rendered good to me, while I have rendered evil to you.'

verses.latin: Tu enim indicasti hodie quæ feceris mihi bona: quomodo tradiderit me Dominus in manu tua, et non occideris me.
verses.english: For you have shown today the good things you have done for me: how the Lord delivered me into your hand, and yet you did not kill me.

verses.latin: Neque enim invenit homo inimicum suum, et dimisit in via bona: sed reddat tibi Dominus hoc pro eo quod hodie operatus es in me.
verses.english: For no one finds his enemy and lets him go on a good way; instead, may the Lord repay you for the good you have done to me today.

verses.latin: Mortuus est autem Samuel, et congregatus omnis Israël planxit eum: et sepelierunt eum in domo sua Ramatha. David autem surrexit, et descendit in desertum Pharan.
verses.english: Samuel died, and all Israel gathered and mourned for him. They buried him at his home in Ramatha. David then got up and went down into the desert of Paran.

verses.latin: Erat autem vir in Maon, et possessiones ejus in Carmel: et vir ille dives nimis, et habebat pecora tria millia, et mille capras: eratque opus illi in Carmel ad tonsuram gregis sui.
verses.english: There was a man in Maon whose possessions were in Carmel. This man was extremely rich; he owned three thousand sheep and a thousand goats. He was in Carmel for the shearing of his flock.

verses.latin: Nomen viri Nabal, et nomen uxoris ejus Abigail, mulier prudentissima et bona, vir vero ejus durus, et pessimus: et ipse de genere Caleb.
verses.english: The man's name was Nabal, and his wife's name was Abigail. She was a very prudent and good woman, but her husband was a harsh and wicked man. He was of the lineage of Caleb.

verses.latin: Audivit autem David in deserto quod tonderet Nabal oves suas.
verses.english: David heard in the desert that Nabal was shearing his sheep.

verses.latin: Et misit decem juvenes, dixitque eis: Ascendite in Carmel, et venientes ad Nabal, interrogate eum ex nomine meo pacem:
verses.english: So David sent ten young men, and said to them: 'Go up to Carmel, and when you come to Nabal, ask him in my name how he fares and wish him peace.'

verses.latin: Et haec dicetis: Vivas, frater mi, et sint tibi omnia prospera, et domui tuae universa, et omnibus quae tua sunt.
verses.english: And say this: 'Live well, my brother, and may all things prosper for you, for your whole household, and for all that is yours.'

verses.latin: Audivi quod tonsores habeas. Pastores tui fuerunt nobiscum in deserto: nunquam eos molestiis affecimus, neque aliquid de eis perditum est universis diebus, quibus fuerunt in Carmel.
verses.english: 'I have heard that you have shearers. Your shepherds were with us in the desert; we never harmed them, nor was anything lost from them all the days they were with us in Carmel.'

verses.latin: Interroga pueros tuos, et dicent tibi. Inveniant ergo juvenes mei gratiam in oculis tuis: pro eo quod in die bona venimus, quodcumque fuerit in manu tua, da servis tuis, et filio tuo David.
verses.english: 'Ask your young men, and they will tell you. Therefore, may my young men find favor in your eyes. Since we have come on a good day, please give whatever you have at hand to your servants and to your son David.'

verses.latin: Cum venissent ergo pueri David, locuti sunt ad Nabal omnia verba haec ex nomine David: et siluerunt.
verses.english: When David's young men came, they spoke all these words to Nabal in David's name, and then they waited in silence.

verses.latin: Respondens autem Nabal servis David, ait: Quis est David? et quis est filius Isai? Hodie increverunt servi qui fugiunt a dominis suis.
verses.english: Nabal answered David's servants, saying: 'Who is David? And who is the son of Jesse? Today there are many servants who are running away from their masters!'

verses.latin: Ergo panem meum, et aquas meas, et carnes quas mactavi tonsoribus meis, tollam, et dabo viris, quos ignoro unde sint?
verses.english: 'Therefore, shall I take my bread, my water, and the meat which I have butchered for my shearers, and give it to men of whom I do not even know where they come from?'

verses.latin: Reversi sunt ergo pueri David semitam suam: et venientes retulerunt ei omnia verba Nabal.
verses.english: So David's young men turned back on their way, and when they came, they reported all of Nabal's words to him.

verses.latin: Et dixit David viris suis: Accingatur unusquisque gladio suo. Et accincti sunt unusquisque gladio suo. Accinctus est et David gladio suo: et ascenderunt post David quasi quadringenti viri, ducenti autem manserunt ad sarcinas.
verses.english: And David said to his men: 'Let each one gird on his sword.' And each one girded on his sword. David also girded on his sword. About four hundred men went up after David, while two hundred remained with the baggage.

verses.latin: Unus autem de adolescentibus nuntiavit Abigail uxori Nabal, dicens: Ecce David misit nuntios de deserto, ut salutarent dominum nostrum: et abegit eos.
verses.english: However, one of the young men told Abigail, Nabal's wife, saying: 'Behold, David sent messengers from the desert to greet our master; but he drove them away with insults.'

verses.latin: Et viri optimi fuerunt nobis, et non afflixerunt nos, neque aliquid ultra sublatum est nobis cuncto tempore quo fuimus cum eis in deserto.
verses.english: 'And these men were very good to us. They did not afflict us, nor was anything taken from us all the time we were with them in the desert.'

verses.latin: Quasi murus erant nobis nocte et die, cunctis diebus quibus fuimus secum, pastores nostros pascentes.
verses.english: 'They were like a protective wall to us both night and day, all the days we were with them, while our shepherds were pasturing the sheep.'

verses.latin: Igitur nunc scito, et cogita quid facias, eo quod complete sit malitia adversum dominum nostrum, et adversum domum tuam: et ipse est filius Belial, ita ut nemo possit loqui ei.
verses.english: 'Therefore, know now and consider what you should do. For evil is determined against our master and against your whole household. Our master Nabal is such a worthless man that no one can speak to him, so you must act.'

verses.latin: Festinavit itaque Abigail, et tulit ducentos panes, et duos utres vini, et quinque arietes assumptos in coctura, et quinque sata parapsidum, et centum ligaturas uvae passae, et ducentas massas ficorum, et imposuit super asinos.
verses.english: So Abigail quickly prepared and took two hundred loaves of bread, two skins of wine, five roasted sheep, five measures of parched corn, a hundred clusters of raisins, and two hundred cakes of figs, and loaded them upon donkeys.

verses.latin: Et dixit pueris suis: Antecedite me: ecce ego sequar vos. Nabal autem viro suo non indicavit.
verses.english: And she said to her young men: 'Go on ahead of me; behold, I will follow you.' But she did not tell her husband Nabal about this.

verses.latin: Cumque sederet Abigail in asino, et descenderet juxta tegimen montis, apparuit David et viri ejus descendentes contra eam, et occurrit eis.
verses.english: As Abigail rode on her donkey and was coming down under the cover of the mountain, David and his men appeared, coming down towards her, and she met them.

verses.latin: Dixerat autem David: Vere frustra custodivi omnia quae hujus fuerunt in deserto, et nihil periit de universis quae pertinent ad eum: et reddidit mihi malum pro bono.
verses.english: Now David had been saying to his men: 'Truly, it was in vain that I guarded all that belonged to this man in the desert, and that nothing was lost of all that pertains to him. For he has returned evil to me for good.'

verses.latin: Haec faciat Deus inimicis David, et haec addat, si de omnibus quae pertinent ad eum, reliquero de masculo usque ad mingentem ad parietem usque mane.
verses.english: 'May God do this to David's enemies, and more also, if by morning I leave alive even one male belonging to Nabal, even one who pisses against a wall' —meaning not a single male would survive to urinate on the walls of their home, ensuring total destruction.

verses.latin: Vidit autem Abigail David, et festinavit, et desiluit de asino, et cecidit coram David in faciem suam, et adoravit super terram.
verses.english: When Abigail saw David, she hurried and dismounted from her donkey, and she fell before David on her face and prostrated herself on the ground in supplication.

verses.latin: Et cecidit ad pedes ejus, et ait: In me sit, domine mi, haec iniquitas: loquatur obsecro ancilla tua, audiente te, et audi verba ancillae tuae.
verses.english: And she fell at his feet and said: 'Let this iniquity be upon me alone, my lord. I beg you, let your handmaid speak in your hearing, and please listen to the words of your handmaid.'

verses.latin: Ne, quaeso, ponat dominus meus cor suum super virum istum Belial Nabal: quoniam juxta nomen suum, stultus est: Nabal stultus nomen ejus, et stultitia est cum eo. Ego autem ancilla tua non vidi pueros domini mei, quos misisti.
verses.english: 'Please, my lord, do not take to heart this worthless man Nabal. For as his name is, so he is: 'Nabal' means 'fool,' and foolishness is indeed with him. As for me, your handmaid, I did not see the young men of my lord whom you sent.'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo, domine mi, vivit Dominus, et vivit anima tua, quia prohibuit Dominus te ne venires in sanguinem, et salvavit manum tuam tibi: et nunc fiant sicut Nabal, inimici tui, et qui quaerunt domino meo mala.
verses.english: 'Now therefore, my lord, as the Lord lives and as your soul lives, the Lord has restrained you from shedding blood and has saved your hand from taking vengeance for yourself. And now, let your enemies and those who seek evil for my lord become like Nabal.'

verses.latin: Et nunc hanc benedictionem, quam attulit ancilla tua tibi domino meo, da servis tuis, qui sequuntur te.
verses.english: 'And now, accept this gift, which your handmaid has brought to you, my lord, and give it to the young men who follow you.'

verses.latin: Remitte iniquitatem ancillae tuae: in providentia enim faciet Dominus domino meo fideliter, quia proelia Domini tu proeliaris, et mala non sunt inventa in te omnibus diebus vitae tuae.
verses.english: 'Please forgive the offense of your handmaid. For the Lord will surely make a faithful and enduring house for my lord, because you fight the battles of the Lord, and no evil has been found in you all the days of your life.'

verses.latin: Si enim surrexerit homo persequens te, et quaerens animam tuam, erit anima domini mei custodia vincta in fasciculo viventium apud Dominum Deum tuum: animam vero inimicorum tuorum quasi in impetu et in turbine proiciet.
verses.english: 'If indeed a man should rise up to pursue you and seek your life, the life of my lord will be bound up in the bundle of the living with the Lord your God, held securely in His protection. But the lives of your enemies, He will sling out as from the hollow of a sling in a whirlwind, scattering them to destruction.'

verses.latin: Cum ergo fecerit Dominus domino meo omnia quae locutus est de te bona, et constituerit te ducem super Israël,
verses.english: 'When therefore the Lord has done for my lord all the good things He has spoken concerning you, and has appointed you leader over Israel —meaning when you become king—'

verses.latin: non erit tibi in singultum, et in scrupulum cordis domino meo, quod effuderis sanguinem frustra, aut ultus sis pro te: et cum benefecerit Dominus domino meo, recordaberis ancillae tuae.
verses.english: 'This will not be a cause for stumbling or a pang of regret in your heart, my lord, that you would have shed blood without cause, or avenged yourself. And when the Lord has dealt well with my lord, you will remember your handmaid.'

verses.latin: Et dixit David ad Abigail: Benedictus Dominus Deus Israël, qui misit te hodie obviam mihi, et benedictum eloquium tuum.
verses.english: And David said to Abigail: 'Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, who sent you this day to meet me, and blessed be your counsel.'

verses.latin: Et benedicta sapientia tua: et tu benedicta, quae prohibuisti me hodie ne irem in sanguinem, et ulciscere me manu mea.
verses.english: 'And blessed be your wisdom, and blessed are you, who have prevented me this day from going to shed blood and from avenging myself with my own hand.'

verses.latin: Alioquin vivit Dominus Deus Israël, qui prohibuit me ne malum tibi facerem: nisi cito venisses obviam mihi, non remansisset Nabal de mingentibus ad parietem usque in mane.
verses.english: 'Otherwise, as the Lord God of Israel lives, Who has restrained me from doing evil to you: had you not come quickly to meet me, surely by morning, Nabal would not have been left with even one male who pisses against a wall, ensuring total annihilation.'

verses.latin: Suscepit ergo David de manu ejus quae attulerat ei: et dixit illi: Vade in pace in domum tuam: ecce audivi vocem tuam, et honoravi faciem tuam.
verses.english: So David received from her hand what she had brought to him, and he said to her: 'Go in peace to your house. Behold, I have heard your voice and respected your plea.'

verses.latin: Venit ergo Abigail ad Nabal: et ecce festum in domo ejus, quasi convivium regis: et cor Nabal laetum erat, eo quod ebrius esset nimis: et non indicavit ei verbum ex omnibus usque mane.
verses.english: So Abigail came to Nabal, and behold, there was a feast in his house, like the feast of a king. And Nabal's heart was merry, because he was excessively drunk. So she did not tell him anything at all until the morning.

verses.latin: Mane autem facto, digesto mero Nabal, indicavit ei uxor sua verba haec: et attonitum est cor ejus intra eum, et quasi lapis factus est.
verses.english: But in the morning, when Nabal had sobered up from the wine, his wife told him these things. And his heart died within him from shock, and he became like a stone.

verses.latin: Et factum est quasi post dies decem, percussit Dominus Nabal, et mortuus est.
verses.english: And it happened, after about ten days, that the Lord struck Nabal, and he died.

verses.latin: Audivit autem David quod mortuus esset Nabal, et ait: Benedictus Dominus, qui judicavit causam opprobrii mei de manu Nabal, et servum suum custodivit a malo, et malitiam Nabal retorsit Dominus in caput ejus. Misit ergo David, et locutus est ad Abigail ut acciperet eam sibi in uxorem.
verses.english: When David heard that Nabal was dead, he said: 'Blessed be the Lord, who has judged the cause of my reproach from the hand of Nabal, and has kept His servant from evil, and has returned Nabal's wickedness upon his own head.' So David sent and spoke to Abigail, to take her to himself as a wife.

verses.latin: Venerunt ergo servi David ad Abigail in Carmel, et locuti sunt ad eam, dicentes: David misit nos ad te, ut acciperet te sibi in uxorem.
verses.english: So David's servants came to Abigail at Carmel, and they spoke to her, saying: 'David has sent us to you, to take you to himself as a wife.'

verses.latin: Mortuus est autem Samuel, et congregatus omnis Israël planxit eum: et sepelierunt eum in domo sua in Ramatha. David autem surrexit, et descendit in desertum Pharan.
verses.english: Samuel died, and all of Israel gathered together and mourned for him. They buried him at his home in Ramah. David then rose up and went down into the wilderness of Paran.

verses.latin: Erat vir in excelso Maon, et possessio ejus in Carmelo, et vir ille dives nimis: erantque ei pecora tria millia, et capræ mille: et accidit ut tonderet oves suas in Carmelo.
verses.english: There was a man in the highlands of Maon whose property was in Carmel, and that man was exceedingly wealthy. He had three thousand sheep and one thousand goats, and it so happened that he was shearing his sheep in Carmel.

verses.latin: Nomen viri Nabal: et nomen uxoris ejus Abigail, mulier prudentissima et bona, vir autem ejus durus et pessimus: et ipse de genere Caleb.
verses.english: The man’s name was Nabal, and his wife’s name was Abigail. She was a very prudent and good woman. Her husband, however, was hard-hearted and evil, and he was a descendant of Caleb.

verses.latin: Audivit autem David in deserto quod tonderet Nabal oves suas.
verses.english: David heard in the wilderness that Nabal was shearing his sheep.

verses.latin: Et misit decem juvenes, et dixit eis David: Ascendite in Carmelum, et pergite ad Nabal, et salutate eum ex me pacifice.
verses.english: So David sent ten young men and told them: “Go up to Carmel and approach Nabal. Greet him on my behalf with good wishes and peace.”

verses.latin: Et sic dicetis: Vivas, et tu, et domus tua, et omnia quæ tua sunt, sint prospera.
verses.english: And this is what you are to say: 'May you live long and prosper, and may your household and all that belongs to you also prosper.'

verses.latin: Modo audivi quod tonderent pastores tui. Habes in Carmelo pastores meos?
verses.english: 'I have just heard that your shepherds are shearing. Do you have my shepherds in Carmel — (meaning, those who have been protecting your flock)?'

verses.latin: Non confundentur. Rogant te juvenes tui, ut quodcumque invenerint, tribuas servis tuis, et filio tuo David.
verses.english: 'They — (my men who have been protecting your flock) — will not be put to shame. Your young men ask you to give whatever you find to your servants and to your son David.'

verses.latin: In die bona venimus: quodcumque fuerit in manu tua, da servis tuis, et filio tuo David.
verses.english: 'We have come on a good day. Whatever is at hand, please give it to your servants and to your son David.'

verses.latin: Cum venissent ergo juvenes, nunciaverunt Nabali omnia verba hæc ex nomine David: et siluerunt.
verses.english: So when the young men arrived, they conveyed all these words to Nabal in David’s name, and then they fell silent, waiting for his response.

verses.latin: Respondens autem Nabal servis David, ait: Quis est David? et quis est filius Isai? Hodie multi servi fugiunt a dominis suis.
verses.english: Nabal answered David’s servants, saying: “Who is this David? And who is the son of Jesse? Today, many servants are running away from their masters. — (I won't help such men).”

verses.latin: Nunquid igitur panem meum, et aquas meas, et carnes quas mactavi tondentibus gregem meum, sumam, et dabo viris quos nescio unde sint?
verses.english: “Am I then to take my bread, my water, and the meat that I have slaughtered for those who are shearing my flock, and give it to men of whom I do not know where they come from? Absolutely not.”

verses.latin: Reversi sunt ergo juvenes David, et retulerunt ei omnia verba Nabali.
verses.english: So David’s young men turned back and reported all of Nabal’s words to him.

verses.latin: Et dixit David juvenibus suis: Accingatur unusquisque gladio suo. Et accincti sunt singuli gladiis suis: accinctus est et ipse David gladio suo: et ascenderunt cum David quasi quadringenti viri, ducenti autem manserunt ad sarcinas.
verses.english: Then David said to his young men: “Let each man strap on his sword!” And each man strapped on his sword. David himself also strapped on his sword. About four hundred men went up with David, while two hundred remained behind to guard the supplies.

verses.latin: Uni autem de pueris nunciavit Abigail, dicens: Ecce David misit nuncios de deserto, ut salutarent dominum nostrum: et ille impegit in eos.
verses.english: But one of Nabal’s young men had told Abigail, Nabal’s wife, saying: “Behold, David sent messengers from the wilderness to greet our master — (respectfully and with good intent) — but he violently lashed out at them.”

verses.latin: Et viri boni erant nimis, et non sunt nobis molesti, neque aliquid de nostro rapuerunt cunctis diebus quos conversati sunt nobiscum, cum essemus in agro.
verses.english: “Yet, they were very good men. They caused us no trouble at all, nor did they take anything from our possessions during all the days they were with us when we were in the field.”

verses.latin: In muro erant nobis die ac nocte, cunctis diebus quibus fuimus cum eis pastores ovium.
verses.english: “They were a wall of protection for us, day and night, throughout all the days we were with them while we were shepherds of the sheep.”

verses.latin: Quamobrem nunc cogita, et vide quid agas: quia completa est malitia adversum dominum nostrum, et contra omnem domum ejus: et ipse est filius Belial, ita ut nemo possit loqui ei.
verses.english: “Therefore, now consider and see what you must do, because evil is determined against our master and against all his household. For he himself is such a wicked and worthless man that no one can speak to him — (he will not listen to reason).”

verses.latin: Festinavit itaque Abigail, et tulit ducenta panum, et duos utres vini, et quinque arietes coctos, et quinque sata parapsidum, et centum ligaturas uvæ passæ, et ducentas massas caricarum, et imposuit super asinos.
verses.english: So Abigail hurried and took two hundred loaves of bread, two wineskins of wine, five cooked sheep — (rams) — five measures of roasted grain, one hundred clusters of raisins, and two hundred cakes of figs, and she loaded them onto donkeys.

verses.latin: Dixitque pueris suis: Præcedite me: ecce ego sequor post tergum vestrum. Servis autem suis non indicavit.
verses.english: She said to her young men: “Go ahead of me; behold, I will follow behind you.” But she did not tell her husband, Nabal, about any of this.

verses.latin: Cum autem ascendisset super asinum, et descenderet ad radices montis, apparuit ei David et viri ejus descendentes contra eam, et illa occurrit eis.
verses.english: As she was riding on the donkey and descending by a hidden path of the mountain, David and his men were coming down toward her, and she met them.

verses.latin: Dixerat autem David: Vere sine causa custodivi omnia quæ hujus erant in deserto, et nihil amissum est de universis quæ pertinent ad eum: et reddidit mihi malum pro bono.
verses.english: Now David had just said: “Surely, it was for nothing that I guarded all this man’s possessions in the wilderness, and nothing was lost of all that belonged to him. Yet he has repaid me evil for good.”

verses.latin: Hæc faciat Deus inimicis David, et hæc addat, si de his omnibus quæ pertinent ad eum, reliquero de masculo usque ad matinum.
verses.english: “May God do so to David’s enemies, and more also, if by morning I leave a single male alive from all that belongs to him.”

verses.latin: Vidit autem Abigail David, et festinavit, et desiluit de asino, et cadens ante pedes David, adoravit super terram.
verses.english: When Abigail saw David, she quickly dismounted from her donkey and fell down at David’s feet, bowing low to the ground in reverence and supplication.

verses.latin: Et cecidit ad pedes ejus, et ait: In me sit, Domine mi, hæc iniquitas: obsecro, loquatur ancilla tua, audiente te, et audi verba famulæ tuæ.
verses.english: She fell at his feet and said: “Upon me alone, my lord, let this iniquity fall. I beg you, let your servant speak in your hearing, and please listen to the words of your handmaid.”

verses.latin: Ne ponat, oro, dominus meus, cor suum super virum istum Belial, Nabal: quoniam secundum nomen suum, stultus est: et stultitia est cum eo. Ego autem ancilla tua non vidi juvenes tuos quos misisti.
verses.english: “Please, my lord, do not take to heart this worthless man, Nabal. For according to his name, he is a fool — (Nabal means 'fool') — and folly is with him. But I, your servant, did not see the young men whom you sent.”

verses.latin: Nunc igitur, Domine mi, vivit Dominus, et vivit anima tua, quia prohibuit te Dominus ne venires in sanguinem, et ne ulcisereris manu tua: et nunc sint sicut Nabal, inimici tui, et qui quærunt Domino meo mala.
verses.english: “Now therefore, my lord, as the Lord lives and as your soul lives, it is the Lord who has restrained you from coming to bloodshed and from avenging yourself with your own hand. Now let your enemies and those who seek evil for my lord be like Nabal — (worthless and overcome by divine judgment).”

verses.latin: Benedictionem hanc, quam attulit ancilla tua tibi, Domine mi, da servis tuis qui sequuntur te.
verses.english: “May this blessing, which your servant has brought to you, my lord, be given to your servants who follow you.”

verses.latin: Ignosce iniquitati ancillæ tuæ: et faciens faciet Dominus Domino meo fidelissimum domum, quia prælium Domini tu præliaris, et bona inventa sunt in te omni tempore vitæ tuæ.
verses.english: “Please forgive the iniquity of your servant. For the Lord will surely make a lasting and faithful house for my lord, because you fight the battles of the Lord, and good things have been found in you all the days of your life.”

verses.latin: Si surrexerit homo persequens te, et quærens animam tuam, erit anima Domini mei custodita quasi in fasciculo viventium apud Dominum Deum tuum: animas vero inimicorum tuorum quasi in impetu turbinis rota fundentur.
verses.english: “If a man rises up to pursue you and seek your life, the life of my lord will be guarded as in a bundle of the living with the Lord your God. But the lives of your enemies will be hurled away like a stone from a sling.”

verses.latin: Cum ergo fecerit Dominus Domino meo omnia bona quæ locutus est de te, et præceperit te ducem super Israël, non erit tibi in singultum, et in scrupulum cordis Domino meo, quod effuderis sanguinem frustra, et ultus sis per te. Aut cum benefecerit Dominus Domino meo, recordaberis ancillæ tuæ.
verses.english: “When the Lord has done for my lord all the good things He has spoken concerning you, and has appointed you leader over Israel, then this will not be a cause for stumbling or a troubled conscience for my lord — (the thought) — that you shed blood needlessly or avenged yourself. And when the Lord has dealt well with my lord, then remember your servant.”

verses.latin: Dixit David ad Abigail: Benedictus Dominus Deus Israël, qui misit te hodie obviam mihi, atque huic sermoni tuo.
verses.english: David said to Abigail: “Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, who sent you today to meet me, and blessed be your counsel!”

verses.latin: Et benedicta eloquentia tua, et tu benedicta, quæ prohibuisti me hodie ne irem in sanguinem, et ne ulciserer manu mea.
verses.english: “And blessed be your wisdom, and blessed be you, who have restrained me today from going to shed blood and from avenging myself with my own hand.”

verses.latin: Alioquin, vivit Dominus Deus Israël, qui prohibuit me ne malum facerem tibi: si non citius venisses obviam mihi, non remansisset de Nabal usque ad luciferum, mingens ad parietem.
verses.english: “Otherwise, as surely as the Lord God of Israel lives, who has kept me from doing evil to you, if you had not come quickly to meet me, there would not have been left to Nabal by morning light a single male person — (meaning, every male in his household would have been destroyed).”

verses.latin: Et suscepit David de manu ejus quæ attulerat ei: et dixit ei: Vade in pace in domum tuam: ecce audivi vocem tuam, et honoravi faciem tuam.
verses.english: Then David received from her hand what she had brought to him, and he said to her: “Go up in peace to your house. Behold, I have listened to your voice and I have shown you favor.”

verses.latin: Venit autem Abigail ad Nabal: et ecce convivium in domo ejus, quasi convivium regis: et cor Nabalis lætum erat, et ebrius erat nimis: et non indicavit ei verbum exiguum, usque mane.
verses.english: Abigail came to Nabal, and behold, he was holding a feast in his house, like the feast of a king. Nabal’s heart was merry, for he was exceedingly drunk. So she did not tell him anything at all until the morning.

verses.latin: Mane vero facto, digesto vino Nabalis, indicavit ei uxor sua verbum hoc: et attonitum est cor ejus intra eum, et quasi lapis factus est.
verses.english: But in the morning, when Nabal had sobered up from his wine, his wife told him these things. And his heart died within him, and he became like a stone — (paralyzed by fear or a stroke).

verses.latin: Et post dies decem percussit Dominus Nabal, et mortuus est.
verses.english: And about ten days later, the Lord struck Nabal, and he died.

verses.latin: Audivit autem David quod mortuus esset Nabal: et ait: Benedictus Dominus, qui judicavit causam opprobrii mei de manu Nabal, et servum suum custodivit a malo, et malitiam Nabalis reddidit in caput ejus. Misit ergo David, et locutus est ad Abigail, ut eam acciperet sibi uxorem.
verses.english: When David heard that Nabal was dead, he said: “Blessed be the Lord, who has judged the cause of my reproach from the hand of Nabal, and has kept His servant from evil. He has returned Nabal’s wickedness upon his own head.” So David sent and spoke to Abigail, to take her as his wife.

verses.latin: Et venerunt servi David ad Abigail in Carmelum, et locuti sunt ad eam, dicentes: David misit nos ad te, ut acciperet te sibi uxorem.
verses.english: David’s servants came to Abigail at Carmel and spoke to her, saying: “David has sent us to you, to take you as his wife.”

verses.latin: Venerunt autem Ziphaei de desertis ad Saul, dicentes: Ecce David latitat in colle Hachila, quae est ex adverso solitudinis.
verses.english: But the Ziphites came from the wilderness to Saul, saying: 'Look! David is hiding on the hill of Hachilah, which is opposite the wilderness.'

verses.latin: Et surrexit Saul, et descendit in desertum Ziph, et cum eo tria millia virorum de electis Israel, ut quaererent David in deserto Ziph.
verses.english: So Saul got up and went down into the wilderness of Ziph, and with him were three thousand men, chosen from Israel, to search for David in the wilderness of Ziph.

verses.latin: Et castrametatus est Saul in colle Hachila, quae est ex adverso solitudinis, in via: David autem habitabat in deserto. Videns autem, quod venisset Saul post se in desertum,
verses.english: Saul made his camp on the hill of Hachilah, which is opposite the wilderness, by the road. But David was living in the wilderness at that time, and seeing that Saul had come after him into the wilderness,

verses.latin: misit exploratores, et didicit certissime quod venisset Saul.
verses.english: David sent out scouts, and learned with certainty that Saul had indeed come.

verses.latin: Et surrexit David, et venit ad locum ubi erat Saul: cumque vidisset locum in quo dormiebat Saul, et Abner filius Ner, princeps militiae ejus, et Saul dormientem in tentorio, et reliquum vulgus per circuitum ejus,
verses.english: So David got up and went to the place where Saul was. He saw the exact place where Saul was sleeping, and Abner, the son of Ner, who was the commander of Saul's army, and Saul sleeping inside his tent, while the rest of the people were encamped all around him.

verses.latin: ait David ad Achimelech Hethaeum, et Abisai filium Sarviae, fratrem Joab, dicens: Quis descendet mecum ad Saul in castra? Dixitque Abisai: Ego descendam tecum.
verses.english: David then said to Ahimelech the Hittite, and to Abishai, son of Zeruiah, Joab's brother, saying: 'Who will go down with me to Saul in the camp?' And Abishai said: 'I will go down with you.'

verses.latin: Venit ergo David, et Abisai ad populum nocte, et invenerunt Saul jacentem et dormientem in tentorio, et hastam ejus fixam in terra ad caput ejus: Abner autem et populus dormiebant in circuitu ejus.
verses.english: So David and Abishai came to the people by night, and they found Saul lying down and sleeping in his tent, and his spear was stuck in the ground at his head. But Abner and the people were sleeping all around him.

verses.latin: Dixitque Abisai ad David: Conclusit Deus inimicum tuum hodie in manu tua: nunc ergo perfodiam eum hasta in terra semel, et secundo, aut ultra non opus erit.
verses.english: Then Abishai said to David: 'God has delivered your enemy into your hand today. Therefore, now I will pierce him with his own spear into the ground, just once, and a second time will not even be needed!'

verses.latin: Et ait David ad Abisai: Ne interficias eum: quis enim extendit manum suam in christum Domini, et innocens erit?
verses.english: And David said to Abishai: 'Do not kill him; for who can stretch out his hand against the Anointed of the Lord and be innocent?'

verses.latin: Et dixit David: Vivit Dominus, quia nisi Dominus percusserit eum, aut dies ejus venerit ut moriatur, aut in praelium descendens perierit,
verses.english: And David said: 'As the Lord lives! Unless the Lord strikes him down himself, or his day comes for him to die naturally, or he goes down into battle and perishes there;'

verses.latin: absit a me ut extendam manum meam in christum Domini. Nunc ergo tolle hastam, quae est ad caput ejus, et scyphum aquae, et abeamus.
verses.english: 'Far be it from me to stretch out my hand against the Anointed of the Lord! Now then, take the spear that is at his head, and the jug of water, and let us go.'

verses.latin: Tulit ergo David hastam et scyphum aquae qui erat ad caput Saul, et abierunt: et nemo fuit qui videret, et intelligeret, et evigilaret, sed omnes dormiebant: quoniam sopor Domini irruerat super eos.
verses.english: So David took the spear and the jug of water that was at Saul's head, and they left. And there was no one who saw, or understood what was happening, or woke up; instead, all of them were sleeping, because a deep sleep from the Lord had fallen upon them.

verses.latin: Cumque abisset David ex adverso, et venisset in verticem montis procul, et esset grande intervallum inter eos,
verses.english: When David had crossed to the other side of the valley, and had come to the top of a distant mountain, so that there was a great distance between them,

verses.latin: clamavit David ad populum, et ad Abner filium Ner, dicens: Nonne respondens Abner? Et Abner respondens ait: Quis es tu, qui clamas, et perturbas regem?
verses.english: David called out to the people and to Abner, son of Ner, saying: 'Won't you answer, Abner?' And Abner answered and said: 'Who are you, who calls out and disturbs the king?'

verses.latin: Et ait David ad Abner: Nonne vir es tu? et quis similis tui in Israel? quare ergo non custodisti dominum tuum regem? Ingressus est enim unus de populo ut interficeret regem dominum tuum.
verses.english: And David said to Abner: 'Are you not a man of valor? And who is like you in all of Israel? Why then did you not guard your lord the king? For one of the people came in to kill your lord the king!'

verses.latin: Non est bonum hoc, quod fecisti: vivit Dominus, filii mortis estis vos, qui non custodistis dominum vestrum, christum Domini. Nunc ergo vide ubi est hasta regis, et ubi scyphus aquae, qui erat ad caput ejus.
verses.english: 'This thing that you have done is not good! As the Lord lives, you are men worthy of death, because you did not guard your lord, the Anointed of the Lord! Now then, look where the king's spear is, and where the jug of water was, which was at his head!'

verses.latin: Et cognovit Saul vocem David, et ait: Num vox tua haec est, fili mi David? Et dixit David: Vox mea, domine mi rex.
verses.english: And Saul recognized David's voice and said: 'Is this your voice, my son David?' And David said: 'It is my voice, my lord, O King!'

verses.latin: Et ait: Quare dominus meus persequitur servum suum? quae aut quid feci? aut quod est in manu mea malum?
verses.english: And David said: 'Why does my lord pursue his servant? What have I done? Or what evil is in my hand?'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo audi, obsecro, domine mi rex, verba servi tui: si Dominus incitat te adversum me, odoretur sacrificium: sin autem filii hominum, maledicti sint in conspectu Domini, qui ejecerunt me hodie ut non commorerer in haereditate Domini, dicentes: Vade, servi diis alienis.
verses.english: 'Now therefore, please hear, my lord the King, the words of your servant: If the Lord is inciting you against me, then let Him accept an offering. But if it is men who are doing this, then let them be cursed in the sight of the Lord! For they have driven me out today from living in the inheritance of the Lord, by saying: "Go, serve other gods!"'

verses.latin: Et nunc non effundatur sanguis meus in terra coram Domino: quoniam egressus es ut quaereres pulicem unum, sicut persequitur quis perdicem in montibus.
verses.english: 'And now, let my blood not be poured out on the ground away from the presence of the Lord; for you have come out to search for a single flea, just as one pursues a partridge in the mountains.'

verses.latin: Et ait Saul: Peccavi, revertere fili mi David: nequaquam enim ultra quaeram te, eo quod pretiosa fuerit anima mea in oculis tuis hodie: stultus egi, et erravi nimis.
verses.english: And Saul said: 'I have sinned. Return, my son David. For I will never again seek to harm you, because my life was precious in your eyes today. I have acted foolishly, and have greatly erred.'

verses.latin: Et respondens David ait: Ecce hasta regis, transeat unus de pueris, et tollat eam.
verses.english: And David answered and said: 'Here is the king's spear! Let one of the young men come over and take it.'

verses.latin: Et Dominus reddet unicuique secundum justitiam suam, et fidem suam: eo quod noluerim extendere manum meam in christum Domini.
verses.english: 'And the Lord will repay to each person according to his righteousness and his faithfulness, because I was unwilling to stretch out my hand against the Anointed of the Lord.'

verses.latin: Et sicut magnificata est anima tua hodie in oculis meis, sic magnificetur anima mea in oculis Domini, et liberet me de omni angustia.
verses.english: 'And just as your life was valued greatly today in my eyes, so may my life be valued greatly in the eyes of the Lord, and may He deliver me from all trouble.'

verses.latin: Et ait Saul ad David: Benedictus tu fili mi David, siquidem faciens facies, et potens poteris. Abierunt ergo David in viam suam: et Saul reversus est in locum suum.
verses.english: And Saul said to David: 'Blessed are you, my son David! For indeed, you will certainly do great things, and you will surely prevail!' So David went on his way, and Saul returned to his own place.

verses.latin: Et venerunt Ziphaei ad Saul in Gabaa, dicentes: Nonne David latitat in colle Hachila, quae est ex adverso solitudinis?
verses.english: Then the Ziphites came to Saul in Gibeah, saying: "Is David not hiding himself on the hill of Hachila, which is opposite the desert wilderness?"

verses.latin: Et surrexit Saul, et descendit in desertum Ziph, et cum eo tria millia virorum electorum de Israel, ut quaereret David in deserto Ziph.
verses.english: So Saul arose and went down into the desert of Ziph, and with him were three thousand chosen men from Israel, to search for David in the desert of Ziph.

verses.latin: Et moratus est Saul in Gabaa Hachila, quae est ex adverso solitudinis, in via: David autem habitabat in deserto. Vidit itaque David quod venisset Saul post se in desertum.
verses.english: And Saul encamped on the hill of Hachila, which is opposite the desert wilderness, by the road. But David was living in the desert. Therefore, David saw that Saul had come after him into the desert.

verses.latin: Misit ergo exploratores David, et didicit quod venisset Saul certissime.
verses.english: So David sent out scouts, and he learned for certain that Saul had indeed come.

verses.latin: Et surrexit David, et venit ad locum ubi erat Saul: cumque vidisset David locum in quo dormiebat Saul, et Abner filius Ner, princeps militiae ejus, et Saul dormiebat in medio carrorum, et Abner et ceteri per circuitum ejus.
verses.english: Then David arose and came to the place where Saul was. When David saw the place where Saul was sleeping, and Abner the son of Ner, who was the commander of his army, Saul was sleeping in the middle of the camp, and Abner and the others were all around him.

verses.latin: Et ait David ad Achimelech Hethaeum, et Abisai filium Sarviae, fratrem Joab, dicens: Quis descendet mecum ad Saul in castra? Dixitque Abisai: Ego descendam tecum.
verses.english: And David said to Ahimelech the Hittite, and to Abishai the son of Zeruiah, Joab’s brother, saying: "Who will go down with me to Saul in the camp?" And Abishai said: "I will go down with you."

verses.latin: Venit ergo David et Abisai ad populum nocte, et invenerunt Saul jacentem et dormientem in castris, et lanceam ejus fixam terrae ad caput ejus: Abner autem et populus dormiebant in circuitu ejus.
verses.english: So David and Abishai came to the people by night, and they found Saul lying down and sleeping in the camp, with his spear fixed in the ground at his head. But Abner and the people were sleeping all around him.

verses.latin: Dixitque Abisai ad David: Conclusit Deus inimicum tuum hodie in manu tua: nunc ergo perfodiam eum lancea in terra semel, et secundo opere non indigebo.
verses.english: And Abishai said to David: "God has delivered your enemy into your hand today. Now therefore, I will pin him to the ground with the spear once, and I will not need a second blow."

verses.latin: Et dixit David ad Abisai: Ne interficias eum: quis enim extendet manum suam in christum Domini, et innocens erit?
verses.english: But David said to Abishai: "Do not kill him. For who can stretch out his hand against the anointed of the Lord and remain innocent?"

verses.latin: Et dixit David: Vivit Dominus, quia nisi Dominus percusserit eum, aut dies ejus venerit ut moriatur, aut in praelium descendens perierit:
verses.english: And David said: "As the Lord lives, either the Lord will strike him down, or his day will come for him to die, or he will perish by going down into battle."

verses.latin: Propitius sit mihi Dominus, ne extendam manum meam in christum Domini. Nunc ergo tolle lanceam quae est ad caput ejus, et scyphum aquae, et abeamus.
verses.english: May the Lord be merciful to me, that I may not stretch out my hand against the anointed of the Lord. Now therefore, take the spear that is at his head and the jug of water, and let us go.

verses.latin: Tulit ergo David lanceam et scyphum aquae qui erat ad caput Saul, et abierunt: et nemo fuit qui videret et intelligeret et vigilaret, sed omnes dormiebant: quoniam sopor Domini irruerat super eos.
verses.english: So David took the spear and the jug of water that was at Saul’s head, and they departed. And no one saw or understood or was awake, for they were all sleeping, because a deep sleep from the Lord had fallen upon them.

verses.latin: Cumque transisset David ex adverso, et stetisset in vertice montis procul, et magnum intervallum esset inter eos:
verses.english: When David had crossed over to the other side and stood on the top of the mountain far away, with a great distance between them:

verses.latin: clamavit David ad populum, et ad Abner filium Ner, dicens: Nonne respondes, Abner? Et respondens Abner, ait: Quis es tu qui clamas et inquietas regem?
verses.english: David cried out to the people and to Abner the son of Ner, saying: "Do you not answer, Abner?" And Abner answered and said: "Who are you who cries out and disturbs the king?"

verses.latin: Et ait David ad Abner: Numquid non vir es tu? et quis similis tui in Israel? quare ergo non custodisti dominum tuum regem? Ingressus est enim unus de populo ut interficeret regem dominum tuum.
verses.english: And David said to Abner: "Are you not a man? And who is like you in Israel? Why then have you not guarded your lord the king? For one of the people came in to kill your lord the king."

verses.latin: Non est bonum hoc, quod fecisti: vivit Dominus, quoniam filii mortis estis vos, qui non custodistis dominum vestrum, christum Domini. Nunc ergo vide ubi sit hasta regis, et ubi scyphus aquae ejus, qui erat ad caput ejus.
verses.english: This thing that you have done is not good. As the Lord lives, you are men deserving of death, because you have not guarded your lord, the anointed of the Lord. Now therefore, look where the king’s spear is, and where his jug of water was, which was at his head.

verses.latin: Cognovit autem Saul vocem David, et ait: Num vox tua haec est fili mi David? Et dixit David: Vox mea, domine mi rex.
verses.english: Then Saul recognized David’s voice and said: "Is this your voice, my son David?" And David said: "It is my voice, my lord the king."

verses.latin: Et addidit dicens: Quam ob causam dominus meus persequitur servum suum? quae commisi? aut quod malum est in manu mea?
verses.english: And he added, saying: "For what reason does my lord pursue his servant? What have I committed? Or what evil is in my hand?"

verses.latin: Nunc ergo audi, obsecro, domine mi rex, verba servi tui: si Dominus incitat te adversum me, placeat illi sacrificium: si autem filii hominum, maledicti sint in conspectu Domini, qui ejecerunt me hodie ut non habitem in haereditate Domini, dicentes: Vade, servi diis alienis.
verses.english: Now therefore, please hear, my lord the king, the words of your servant: "If the Lord stirs you up against me, let an offering be pleasing to Him. But if men have done this, may they be cursed in the sight of the Lord, for they have driven me out today from dwelling in the inheritance of the Lord, saying: 'Go, serve foreign gods.'"

verses.latin: Et nunc non effundatur sanguis meus in terra coram Domino: quoniam egressus es ut quaereres animam meam, sicut persequitur pardus in montibus.
verses.english: And now, let not my blood be shed on the ground before the Lord. For you have come out to seek my life, as one pursues a leopard in the mountains.

verses.latin: Et ait Saul: Peccavi, revertere fili mi David: nequaquam enim ultra quaeram vitam tuam, eo quod pretiosa fuerit anima mea in oculis tuis hodie: ecce stulte egi, et ignoravi multa nimis.
verses.english: And Saul said: "I have sinned. Return, my son David. For I will never again seek your life, because my life was precious in your eyes today. Behold, I have acted foolishly, and I have made many great errors."

verses.latin: Et respondens David, ait: Ecce hasta regis, veniat unus de pueris, et tollat eam.
verses.english: And David answered and said: "Behold the king’s spear! Let one of the young men come over and take it."

verses.latin: Et Dominus reddat unicuique justitiam et fidem suam: eo quod noluerim mittere manum meam in christum Domini.
verses.english: And the Lord will repay each man for his righteousness and his faithfulness, because I was unwilling to put forth my hand against the anointed of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et sicut magnificata est anima tua hodie in oculis meis, sic magnificetur anima mea in oculis Domini, et liberet me de omni angustia.
verses.english: And just as your life was valued greatly in my eyes today, so may my life be valued greatly in the eyes of the Lord, and may He deliver me from all trouble.

verses.latin: Et ait Saul ad David: Benedictus tu fili mi David, siquidem faciens facies, et potens poteris. Abiit ergo David in viam suam, et Saul reversus est in locum suum.
verses.english: Then Saul said to David: "Blessed are you, my son David. You will surely accomplish great things, and you will certainly prevail." So David went on his way, and Saul returned to his own place.

verses.latin: Dixit autem David in corde suo: Nunc aliquando cadam in manu Saul: nonne melius est ut fugiam, et salver in terra Philisthinorum, ut desperet Saul, cessetque me persequi in cunctis finibus Israël? Sic evadam de manu ejus.
verses.english: But David said to himself: 'Eventually, I will be killed by Saul. Wouldn't it be better for me to escape and find safety in the land of the Philistines? Then Saul will give up hope and stop pursuing me throughout all the territory of Israel. This way I will escape from his power.'

verses.latin: Et surrexit David, et abiit ipse, et sexcenti viri cum eo, ad Achis filium Maoch, regem Geth.
verses.english: So David got up and went, along with his six hundred men, to Achish, the son of Maoch, who was the king of Gath.

verses.latin: Et habitavit David cum Achis in Geth, ipse et viri ejus: unusquisque cum domo sua: David et duae uxores ejus, Achinoam Jezrahelitis, et Abigail uxor Nabal Carmeli.
verses.english: David lived with Achish in Gath, he and his men, each with his own household. David brought his two wives, Achinoam from Jezreel, and Abigail, who had been Nabal's wife from Carmel.

verses.latin: Et nuntiatum est Saul quod fugisset David in Geth, et non addidit ultra quaerere eum.
verses.english: When Saul was told that David had fled to Gath, he no longer tried to find him.

verses.latin: Dixitque David ad Achis: Si inveni gratiam in oculis tuis, detur mihi locus in una urbium hujus regionis, ut habitem ibi: cur enim manet servus tuus in civitate regni tecum?
verses.english: Then David said to Achish: 'If I have found favor in your sight, please give me a place in one of the towns in this region where I can live. Why should your servant remain with you here in the royal capital?'

verses.latin: Dedit ergo ei Achis in die illa Siceleg: ob hanc causam factus est Siceleg regum Juda usque in diem hanc.
verses.english: So on that very day, Achish gave him Ziklag. This is why Ziklag has belonged to the kings of Judah even to this present day.

verses.latin: Fuit autem numerus dierum quo habitavit David in regione Philisthinorum, annus et quatuor menses.
verses.english: The total time David lived in the territory of the Philistines was one year and four months.

verses.latin: Et ascendit David, et viri ejus, et agebant praedas de Gessuri, et Gerzi, et Amalecitis: hae enim erant gentes antiquitus incolentes terram, quando ingrediebaris Sur usque ad terram Aegypti.
verses.english: David and his men would go up and raid the Geshurites, the Girzites, and the Amalekites. These were the peoples who had lived in that land from ancient times, all the way from Shur to the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et percutiebat David omnem terram, nec relinquebat viventem virum et mulierem: tollensque oves, et boves, et asinos, et camelos, et vestes, revertebatur, et veniebat ad Achis.
verses.english: David would attack the entire land, leaving no man or woman alive. He would take the sheep, oxen, donkeys, camels, and clothing, then return and come back to Achish.

verses.latin: Dicebatque Achis: In quam partem irruisti hodie? Respondebatque David: Contra meridiem Juda, et contra meridiem Jerameel, et contra meridiem Ceni.
verses.english: Achish would ask, 'Where did you raid today?' David would answer, 'Against the south of Judah, or against the south of the Jerahmeelites, or against the south of the Kenites.'

verses.latin: Virum et mulierem non vivificabat David, nec adducebat in Geth dicens: Ne forte loquantur adversum nos, et dicant: Hæc fecit David. Tale aliquid, inquam, fecit omnibus diebus quibus habitavit in terra Philisthinorum.
verses.english: David would not spare a single man or woman to bring them back to Gath, reasoning: 'Otherwise, they might speak against us and reveal what David truly did.' This was David’s practice for all the time he lived in the land of the Philistines.

verses.latin: Credidit ergo Achis David, dicens: Aversione aversus est a populo suo Israël, et erit mihi servus sempiternus.
verses.english: So Achis believed David, thinking: 'He has truly made himself detestable to his own people, Israel, and so he will be my servant forever.'

verses.latin: Factum est autem in diebus illis, ut Philisthim congregarent agmina sua ut pugnarent contra Israël. Dixitque Achis ad David: Scito interea, quia mecum egredieris in castris tu, et viri tui.
verses.english: It happened in those days that the Philistines gathered their armies to fight against Israel. And Achis said to David: "Know this for sure, you and your men will go out with me into the camp."

verses.latin: Et dixit David ad Achis: Nunc scies quae faciat servus tuus. Et ait Achis ad David: Et ego custodem capitis mei faciam te cunctis diebus.
verses.english: And David said to Achis: "Now you will see what your servant can do." And Achis said to David: "Then I will make you the guardian of my life for all time."

verses.latin: Interea Samuel mortuus est, et planxit eum universus Israël: et sepelierunt eum in Rama, urbe sua. Et Saul abstulit magos et ariolos de terra.
verses.english: Meanwhile, Samuel had died, and all of Israel mourned for him. They buried him in his city, Ramah. And Saul had removed the mediums and diviners from the land.

verses.latin: Congregati sunt itaque Philisthim, et venerunt, et castrametati sunt in Sunam: congregavit autem et Saul universum Israël, et venit in Gelboe.
verses.english: So the Philistines gathered and came and set up camp in Shunem. Saul also gathered all of Israel and came to Gilboa.

verses.latin: Et vidit Saul castra Philisthinorum, et pertimuit, et expavit cor ejus nimis.
verses.english: And Saul saw the Philistine camp and was greatly afraid; his heart was utterly terrified.

verses.latin: Consuluitque Dominum, et non respondit ei Dominus, neque per somnia, neque per sacerdotes, neque per prophetas.
verses.english: So he consulted the Lord, but the Lord did not answer him—not through dreams, nor through priests, nor through prophets.

verses.latin: Et dixit Saul servis suis: Quaerite mihi mulierem habentem pythonem, et vadam ad eam, et interrogem per illam. Et dixerunt ei servi sui: Est mulier habens pythonem in Endor.
verses.english: And Saul said to his servants: "Find me a woman who possesses a spirit of divination, so I can go to her and consult through her." And his servants said to him: "There is a woman with a spirit of divination in Endor."

verses.latin: Commutavit ergo se Saul, et induit vestimenta alia: et abiit ipse et duo viri cum eo, et venerunt ad mulierem nocte. Dixitque ei: Divina mihi in pythone, et suscita mihi quem dixero tibi.
verses.english: So Saul disguised himself and put on other clothes. He went with two men, and they came to the woman at night. He said to her: "Divine for me using your spirit, and bring up for me whomever I tell you."

verses.latin: Et ait illi mulier: Ecce tu nosti quae fecerit Saul, et quomodo abstulerit magos et ariolos de terra: quare ergo insidiaris animae meae, ut occidar?
verses.english: And the woman said to him: "Behold, you know what Saul has done, and how he has removed the mediums and diviners from the land. Why then are you setting a trap for my life, so that I may be killed?"

verses.latin: Et juravit ei Saul per Dominum, dicens: Vivit Dominus, quia non veniet tibi quidquam mali propter hanc rem.
verses.english: And Saul swore to her by the Lord, saying: "As the Lord lives, no harm will come to you because of this matter."

verses.latin: Dixitque ei mulier: Quem suscitabo tibi? Quae ait: Samuelem mihi suscita.
verses.english: And the woman said to him: "Whom shall I bring up for you?" And he said: "Bring up Samuel for me."

verses.latin: Cum vidisset autem mulier Samuelem, exclamavit voce magna, et dixit ad Saul: Quare imposuisti mihi, quia tu es Saul?
verses.english: But when the woman saw Samuel, she cried out with a loud voice and said to Saul: "Why have you deceived me, for you are Saul!"

verses.latin: Et ait illi rex: Noli timere: quid vidisti? Et dixit mulier ad Saul: Deos vidi ascendentes de terra.
verses.english: And the king said to her: "Do not be afraid. What did you see?" And the woman said to Saul: "I saw divine beings ascending from the earth."

verses.latin: Dixitque ei: Qualis est forma ejus? Quae ait: Vir senex ascendit, et ipse amictus est pallio. Intellexit autem Saul quod Samuel esset, et inclinavit se super terram, et adoravit.
verses.english: He said to her: "What is his appearance?" And she said: "An old man is ascending, and he is wrapped in a cloak." Then Saul understood that it was Samuel, and he bowed himself to the ground and worshipped.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Samuel ad Saul: Quare inquietasti me, ut suscitarer? Et dixit Saul: Coartatus sum nimis a Philisthim pugnantibus adversum me: insuper et Deus recessit a me, et exaudire me noluit, neque in manu prophetarum, neque per somnia: idcirco vocavi te, ut ostenderes mihi quid faciam.
verses.english: But Samuel said to Saul: "Why have you disturbed me, to bring me up?" And Saul said: "I am in great distress because the Philistines are fighting against me. Moreover, God has departed from me and will no longer hear me, neither through the hand of prophets nor through dreams. Therefore, I have called you to show me what I should do."

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel: Quid interrogas me, cum Dominus recesserit a te, et transierit ad proximum tuum?
verses.english: And Samuel said: "Why do you ask me, since the Lord has departed from you and has gone over to your neighbor?"

verses.latin: Faciet enim tibi Dominus sicut locutus est in manu mea: et scindet regnum de manu tua, et dabit illud proximo tuo David:
verses.english: For the Lord will do to you exactly as He spoke through me: He will tear the kingdom from your hand and give it to your neighbor, David.

verses.latin: Quia non obedisti voci Domini, neque fecisti iram ejus in Amalec: et idcirco quod nunc pateris, fecit tibi Dominus.
verses.english: Because you did not obey the voice of the Lord, nor did you carry out His fierce anger against Amalek—for this reason, the Lord has done to you what you are suffering now.

verses.latin: Et dabit Dominus etiam Israël tecum in manu Philisthinorum: cras igitur tu, et filii tui mecum eritis: sed et castra Israël dabit Dominus in manu Philisthinorum.
