verses.english: And the Lord will also give Israel, along with you, into the hand of the Philistines. Therefore, tomorrow, you and your sons will be with me, and the Lord will also give the army of Israel into the hand of the Philistines.

verses.latin: Statimque Saul cecidit pronus in terram, extimuit enim valde propter sermones Samuelis: et robur non erat in eo, quia non comederat panem tota die illa.
verses.english: Immediately, Saul fell full length upon the ground, for he was greatly terrified because of Samuel's words. And he had no strength in him because he had not eaten any food all that day.

verses.latin: Ingressa est itaque mulier ad Saul, et vidit quod turbatus esset valde. Dixitque ad eum: Ecce obedivit ancilla tua voci tuae, et posui animam meam in manu mea, et audivi verba tua quae locutus es mihi.
verses.english: So the woman came to Saul and saw that he was greatly distressed. And she said to him: "Behold, your handmaid obeyed your voice, and I risked my life to listen to the words you spoke to me."

verses.latin: Nunc ergo et tu obedi consilio ancillae tuae, et ponam coram te buccellam panis, et comede, ut reficiaris, et possis iter facere.
verses.english: Now therefore, you also obey the counsel of your handmaid. Let me place a morsel of bread before you. Eat it so you may be refreshed and able to travel.

verses.latin: Qui resistit, et ait: Non comedam. Coegerunt autem eum servi sui, et mulier: et tandem audivit vocem eorum, et surrexit de terra, et sedit super lectulum.
verses.english: But he refused and said: "I will not eat." However, his servants and the woman compelled him, and at last he listened to their voice. He rose from the ground and sat upon the couch.

verses.latin: Erat autem mulieri vitulus saginatus in domo, et festinavit, et interfecit eum: tollensque farinam miscuit, et coxit sub cinere azymos panes.
verses.english: Now the woman had a fatted calf in the house. She hurried and killed it, then she took flour and mixed it and baked unleavened bread under the ashes.

verses.latin: Et posuit coram Saul, et coram servis ejus. Et comederunt, et surrexerunt, et ambulaverunt nocte illa.
verses.english: And she set it before Saul and before his servants. They ate, and then they rose and traveled that same night.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in diebus illis, ut Philisthim congregarent exercitus suos, ut pugnarent contra Israël: dixitque Achis ad David: Sciens scies quia mecum egredieris in castris tu et viri tui.
verses.english: It happened in those days that the Philistines gathered their armies to fight against Israel. Achis then said to David: 'You must know for certain that you and your men will go out with me in the battle camp.'

verses.latin: Et dixit David ad Achis: Nunc scies quid faciat servus tuus. Et ait Achis ad David: Et ego custodiam te et caput tuum cunctis diebus.
verses.english: And David said to Achis, 'Now you will see what your servant is able to do.' Achis then said to David, 'Then I will keep you as my personal guard and protect your life every day.'

verses.latin: Interim Samuel mortuus est, et planxit eum universus Israël, et sepelierunt eum in Rama civitate sua. Et Saul abstulerat magos et ariolos de terra.
verses.english: Meanwhile, Samuel had died, and all of Israel mourned for him. They buried him in Ramah, his own city. And Saul had previously removed all the mediums and diviners from the land.

verses.latin: Congregati igitur Philisthim, venerunt, et castrametati sunt in Sunam: congregavit autem et Saul universum Israël, et venit in Gelboe.
verses.english: So the Philistines gathered and came to encamp in Shunem. But Saul also gathered all of Israel, and they came to Gilboa.

verses.latin: Et vidit Saul castra Philisthinorum, et pertimuit, et expavit cor ejus nimis.
verses.english: And when Saul saw the Philistine camp, he became terrified, and his heart was overwhelmed with fear.

verses.latin: Consuluitque Dominum, et non respondit ei Dominus, neque in somniis, neque per sacerdotes, neque in prophetis.
verses.english: So he consulted the Lord, but the Lord did not answer him—neither through dreams, nor through the priests using the Urim and Thummim, nor through prophets.

verses.latin: Et dixit Saul ad servos suos: Quærite mihi mulierem habentem pythonem, et ibo ad eam, et interrogabo per illam. Et dixerunt servi ejus ad eum: Est mulier habens pythonem in Endor.
verses.english: Then Saul said to his servants, 'Search for a woman who has a familiar spirit, and I will go to her to inquire through her.' His servants then told him, 'There is a woman with a familiar spirit in Endor.'

verses.latin: Mutavit ergo Saul habitum suum, et induit se vestimentis aliis: et abiit ipse et duo viri cum eo, et venerunt ad mulierem nocte. Dixitque ei: Divina mihi in pythone, et suscita mihi quem dixero tibi.
verses.english: So Saul changed his appearance and put on other clothes. Then he, with two men, went and came to the woman by night. And he said to her, 'Perform divination for me by your familiar spirit, and bring up for me the one I will tell you.'

verses.latin: Et ait illi mulier: Ecce tu nosti quæ fecerit Saul, et quomodo abstulerit magos et ariolos de terra: quare ergo insidiaris animæ meæ, ut occidar?
verses.english: And the woman said to him, 'Look, you know what Saul has done and how he has removed the mediums and diviners from the land. Why then are you setting a trap for my life, that I may be killed?'

verses.latin: Et juravit ei Saul per Dominum, dicens: Vivit Dominus, quia non veniet tibi quidquam mali propter hanc rem.
verses.english: And Saul swore to her by the Lord, saying, 'As the Lord lives, no harm will come to you because of this matter.'

verses.latin: Dixitque mulier: Quem suscitabo tibi? Qui ait: Samuel mihi suscita.
verses.english: Then the woman said, 'Whom shall I bring up for you?' And he replied, 'Bring up Samuel for me.'

verses.latin: Et vidit mulier Samuelem, et exclamavit voce magna, et dixit ad Saul: Quare imposuisti mihi, quia tu es Saul?
verses.english: And when the woman saw Samuel, she cried out with a loud voice. She said to Saul, 'Why have you deceived me? You are Saul!'

verses.latin: Et ait illi rex: Noli timere: quid vidisti? Et dixit mulier ad Saul: Deos vidi ascendentes de terra.
verses.english: And the king said to her, 'Do not be afraid. What did you see?' And the woman said to Saul, 'I saw a divine being ascending from the earth.'

verses.latin: Et dixit ei: Qualis est forma ejus? Quæ ait: Vir senex ascendit, et ipse amictus est pallio. Et intellexit Saul quod Samuel esset, et inclinavit se super terram, et adoravit.
verses.english: Then he said to her, 'What is his appearance like?' She replied, 'An old man is coming up, and he is wrapped in a cloak.' And Saul understood that it was Samuel. He then bowed himself to the ground and paid homage.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Samuel ad Saul: Quare inquietasti me, ut suscitarer? Et ait Saul: Coarctor nimis: siquidem Philisthim pugnant adversum me, et Deus recessit a me, et nihil mihi respondit, neque in manu prophetarum, neque per somnia: idcirco vocavi te, ut ostenderes mihi quid sim facturus.
verses.english: But Samuel said to Saul, 'Why have you disturbed me, causing me to be brought up?' Saul replied, 'I am in great distress. The Philistines are fighting against me, and God has departed from me. He has answered me nothing, neither through prophets nor through dreams. That is why I have called upon you, so you may show me what I am to do.'

verses.latin: Et ait Samuel: Quid consulis me, cum Dominus recesserit a te, et transierit ad vicinum tuum?
verses.english: And Samuel said, 'Why do you consult me, since the Lord has departed from you and has gone over to your neighbor, David?'

verses.latin: Faciet enim tibi Dominus sicut locutus est in manu mea, et scindet regnum de manu tua, et dabit illud proximo tuo David:
verses.english: For the Lord will do to you exactly what He spoke through me. He will tear the kingdom from your hand and give it to your neighbor, David.

verses.latin: quia non obedisti voci Domini, neque fecisti iram vindictæ ejus in Amalec, idcirco quod nunc pateris, fecit tibi Dominus.
verses.english: Because you did not obey the voice of the Lord, nor did you carry out His fierce wrath against Amalek, therefore the Lord has done to you what you now suffer.

verses.latin: Et dabit Dominus etiam Israël tecum in manu Philisthinorum: cras tu et filii tui mecum eritis: sed et castra Israël dabit Dominus in manu Philisthinorum.
verses.english: And the Lord will also give Israel, along with you, into the hand of the Philistines. Tomorrow, you and your sons will be with me in the realm of the dead. And the Lord will deliver the entire army of Israel into the hand of the Philistines.

verses.latin: Statimque Saul cecidit rectus in terram, et extimuit nimis propter verba Samuelis: et robur non erat in eo, quia non comederat panem tota die illa.
verses.english: Immediately, Saul fell full length to the ground, terrified by Samuel's words. He had no strength left in him, for he had eaten no food all that day and night.

verses.latin: Accessit ergo mulier ad Saul, quem viderat turbatum nimis: et ait ad eum: Ecce obedivit ancilla tua voci tuæ, et posui animam meam in manu mea, et audivi sermones tuos quos locutus es mihi.
verses.english: So the woman came to Saul, seeing that he was greatly troubled. She said to him, 'Look, your handmaid obeyed your voice, and I risked my life by performing this for you, and I listened to your words that you spoke to me.'

verses.latin: Nunc igitur audi et tu vocem ancillæ tuæ, et ponam coram te buccellam panis, et comede, ut reficiaris, et possis iter facere.
verses.english: Now, please listen to your handmaid's voice. Let me set a morsel of bread before you, and eat, so that you may regain your strength and be able to travel.

verses.latin: Qui renuit, et ait: Non comedam. Coegerunt autem eum servi sui et mulier. Et tandem audita voce eorum, surrexit de terra, et sedit super lectulum.
verses.english: But he refused, saying, 'I will not eat.' However, his servants and the woman urged him strongly. At last, yielding to their persistence, he rose from the ground and sat upon the couch.

verses.latin: Erat autem mulieris boves altilis in domo, et festinavit, et interfecit eum: et accipiens farinam, miscuit, et coxit sub cineribus azymos panes.
verses.english: Now the woman had a fattened ox in her house. She quickly killed it and, taking flour, mixed it and baked unleavened bread under the ashes.

verses.latin: Et posuit coram Saul et coram servis ejus: et cum comedissent, surrexerunt, et ambulaverunt nocte illa.
verses.english: And she set it before Saul and his servants. When they had eaten, they rose and departed that very night.

verses.latin: Igitur Philisthim congregaverunt omnes turmas suas in Aphec: et Israël castrametati sunt super fontem qui est in Jezrahel.
verses.english: So the Philistines gathered all their military companies and forces at Aphek, a strategic location for battle. Meanwhile, the army of Israel set up their camp by the spring located in Jezreel, another key tactical position.

verses.latin: Et satrapae Philisthinorum incedebant per centurias et mille viros: David autem et viri ejus incedebant in novissimo cum Achis.
verses.english: The Philistine commanders were marching their troops, arrayed by companies of hundreds and thousands. David and his men were marching at the very rear, accompanying King Achis.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque principes Philisthinorum: Qui sunt isti Hebraei? Et ait Achis principibus Philisthinorum: Nonne iste est David qui fuit servus Saul regis Israël, et est apud me diebus et annis, et non inveni in eo quicquam ex quo transfugit ad me usque in hunc diem?
verses.english: Then the Philistine commanders asked, 'Who are these Hebrews joining our ranks?' And Achis responded to the Philistine commanders, saying, 'Is this not David, who was a servant of King Saul of Israel? He has been with me for a long time, for days and years, and I have found no fault in him or any sign of disloyalty since he defected to me until this very day.'

verses.latin: Irascebantur autem super eo principes Philisthinorum, et dixerunt ei: Recede vir, et revertatur in locum suum, in quo constituisti eum: et non descendat nobiscum in proelium, ne fiat nobis adversarius cum fuerimus in pugna. Et in quo poterit sibi placare dominum suum, nisi in capitibus istorum virorum?
verses.english: However, the Philistine commanders became angry with Achis concerning David. They told him, 'Send this man away. Let him return to the place where you assigned him. He must not go down with us into battle, lest he become our adversary during the fight. How else could he regain favor with his own master, Saul, except by turning against us and sacrificing the lives of these very men?'

verses.latin: Nonne iste est David, cui cantabant per choros dicentes: Percussit Saul mille, et David decem millia?
verses.english: They further questioned, 'Is this not the same David about whom they sang in their dances, saying: Saul has struck down his thousands, but David his tens of thousands?'

verses.latin: Vocavit ergo Achis David, et ait ei: Vivit Dominus, quia rectus es tu, et bonus in conspectu meo, et egressus tuus et introitus tuus mecum est in castris: et non inveni in te quicquam mali ex die qua venisti ad me usque in hodiernum diem: sed satrapis non places.
verses.english: So Achis called David and said to him, 'As the Lord lives, you are upright, and you have been good in my sight. Your coming and going with me in the camp has been without issue. I have found nothing evil in you from the day you came to me until this very day. However, you do not please the other Philistine commanders.'

verses.latin: Revertere ergo, et vade cum pace, et non offendas oculos satraparum Philisthinorum.
verses.english: 'Therefore, turn back now and go in peace. Do not displease the eyes of the Philistine commanders by remaining with us.'

verses.latin: Dixitque David ad Achis: Quid enim feci, aut quam rem invenisti in servo tuo a die qua fui in conspectu tuo usque in hodiernum diem, ut non veniam et pugnem adversum inimicos domini mei regis?
verses.english: David then said to Achis, 'What have I done? Or what fault have you found in your servant from the day I have been in your sight until this very day, that I should not come and fight against the enemies of my lord, the king?'

verses.latin: Respondensque Achis, ait ad David: Scio quia bonus es in oculis meis sicut Angelus Dei: verumtamen principes Philisthinorum dixerunt: Non ascendet nobiscum in proelium.
verses.english: Achis answered David and said, 'I know that you are good in my eyes, as blameless as an angel of God. Nevertheless, the Philistine commanders have declared: He shall not go up with us into battle.'

verses.latin: Igredere igitur mane, tu et servi domini tui, qui venerunt tecum: et cum de nocte surrexeritis, et cœperit illucescere, abite.
verses.english: 'Therefore, depart early in the morning, you and the servants of your lord, the men who came with you. And when you have risen in the night and dawn begins to break, go your way.'

verses.latin: Surrexit itaque David mane ipse et viri ejus, ut irent profecti diluculo, et reverterentur in terram Philisthinorum: Philisthim autem ascenderunt in Jezrahel.
verses.english: So David and his men rose early in the morning to depart at daybreak and return to the land of the Philistines. Meanwhile, the Philistines themselves marched up to Jezreel, ready for battle.

verses.latin: Porro Philisthim congregaverunt universas turmas suas in Aphec: Israhel autem castrametatus est super fontem qui est in Iezrahel.
verses.english: The Philistines gathered all their military divisions at Aphek. But Israel set up their camp by the spring in Jezreel.

verses.latin: Et satrapae Philisthinorum incedebant per centurias et millia: David autem et viri ejus agmen claudebant cum Achis.
verses.english: The Philistine lords marched with their armies, organized into groups of hundreds and thousands. David and his men were bringing up the rear of the military column with Achish.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque principes Philisthinorum ad Achis: Quid sibi volunt Hebraei isti? Et dixit Achis ad principes Philisthinorum: Nonne iste est David qui fuit servus Saul regis Israhel, et est apud me multis diebus vel annis, et non inveni in eo quicquam ex quo transfugit ad me usque in hunc diem?
verses.english: And the Philistine commanders said to Achish, "What are these Hebrews doing here?" Achish replied to the Philistine commanders, "Is this not David, who was a servant of Saul, the king of Israel? He has been with me for many days, even years, and I have found nothing wrong in him since he defected to me, up until this very day."

verses.latin: Irati sunt ergo super eum principes Philisthinorum, et dixerunt ei: Redeat vir, et sedeat in loco suo in quo eum constituisti, ne descendat nobiscum in praelium, ne fiat nobis adversarius cum fuerimus in pugna. Et quomodo poterit placare dominum suum, nisi in capitibus virorum istorum?
verses.english: Therefore, the Philistine commanders became angry with Achish and said to him, "Let the man go back and stay in the place where you assigned him. He must not go down with us into battle, lest he become hostile towards us when we are engaged in battle. And how else could he appease his master, if not by turning against these very men of ours?"

verses.latin: Nonne iste est David cui cantabant per choros dicentes: Percussit Saul mille, et David decem millia?
verses.english: "Is this not the David about whom they sang in their festive dances, saying: 'Saul has slain a thousand, but David has slain ten thousand'?"

verses.latin: Vocavit ergo Achis David, et ait illi: Vivit Dominus, quia rectus es tu, et bonus in conspectu meo, et egressus tuus et introitus tuus mecum est in castris: et non inveni in te quicquam mali ex die qua venisti ad me usque in hunc diem: sed satrapis non places.
verses.english: So Achish called David and said to him, "As the Lord lives, you are upright and good in my sight. Your conduct, both your coming and going among us in the camp, has been above reproach. I have found nothing wrong in you from the day you came to me until this very day. But you are not pleasing to the Philistine commanders."

verses.latin: Revertere ergo, et vade cum pace, ne injuriam facias satrapis Philisthinorum.
verses.english: "Therefore, return and go in peace, so that you do not give offense to the Philistine commanders."

verses.latin: Dixitque David ad Achis: Quid enim feci, aut quam invenisti in me servo tuo, ex die qua fui coram te usque in hunc diem, ut non veniam et pugnem adversum inimicos domini mei regis?
verses.english: David then said to Achish, "What wrong have I done? Or what fault have you found in me, your servant, from the day I first came before you until this very day, that I should not be allowed to come and fight against the enemies of my lord, the king?"

verses.latin: Et respondens Achis David, ait: Scio quia bonus es tu in oculis meis, sicut angelus Dei: verumtamen principes Philisthinorum dixerunt: Non ascendet nobiscum in praelium.
verses.english: Achish answered David, "I know you are good in my eyes, like an angel of God. But the Philistine commanders have plainly declared: 'He must not go up with us into battle.'"

verses.latin: Igitur consurge mane, tu et servi domini tui qui venerunt tecum: et cum de nocte surrexeritis, et lucem videritis, abite.
verses.english: "Therefore, rise early in the morning, you and your men who came with you. And as soon as you have risen while it is still dark, and then see the first light of day, you must depart."

verses.latin: Surrexit itaque David mane ipse et viri ejus, ut proficiscerentur de terra Philisthinorum: Philisthiim quoque ascenderunt in Iezrahel.
verses.english: So David and his men rose early that morning to depart from the land of the Philistines. The Philistines, for their part, advanced into Jezreel.

verses.latin: Cum ergo venisset David et viri ejus in Sicelag die tertia, invenerunt depopulatam urbem, et igni succensam.
verses.english: When David and his men arrived back at Ziklag on the third day, they found the city completely raided and burned to the ground by fire.

verses.latin: Et captivas ductas uxores, et filios, et filias eorum, qui minus ætatis erant, et qui majoris.
verses.english: Their wives, sons, and daughters—both the young and the old—had been taken away as captives.

verses.latin: Igitur David et populus qui erat cum eo, levaverunt voces suas, et ploraverunt donec deficerent in lacrimis.
verses.english: So David and all the people with him began to weep loudly, crying until they were completely exhausted and had no more tears left to shed.

verses.latin: Siquidem et duæ uxores David captivæ ductæ fuerant, Achinoam Jezrahelitis, et Abigail uxor Nabal Carmeli.
verses.english: Among those taken captive were David's two wives: Ahinoam of Jezreel and Abigail, who had been Nabal's wife from Carmel.

verses.latin: Et anxiatus est David vehementer: arbitrarentur enim populus ut lapidarent eum, quia amara erat anima uniuscujusque viri super filiis suis, et filiabus: et confortatus est David in Domino Deo suo.
verses.english: David became terribly distressed because the people began to talk about stoning him, for everyone's spirit was bitter over the loss of their sons and daughters. But David strengthened himself in the Lord, his God.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad Abiathar sacerdotem filium Achimelech: Affer mihi ephod. Et attulit Abiathar ephod ad David.
verses.english: Then David said to Abiathar the priest, son of Ahimelech, 'Bring me the ephod.' So Abiathar brought the ephod to David.

verses.latin: Et consuluit David Dominum, dicens: Persequar fures istos, et apprehendam eos, an non? Dixitque ei Dominus: Persequere: eo quod consequens comprehendas, et eruens eruas.
verses.english: And David inquired of the Lord, saying, 'Should I pursue these raiders? Will I overtake them or not?' The Lord replied to him, 'Pursue them: for you will surely overtake them and rescue everyone and everything.'

verses.latin: Abijt ergo David, et sexcenti viri qui erant cum eo: et venerunt usque ad torrentem Besor: et lassi quidam refecerunt se ibi.
verses.english: So David went, along with the six hundred men who were with him. And they came to the Wadi Besor, where some of the exhausted men rested there.

verses.latin: Porro David sequebatur, et quadringenti viri: ducenti autem sederunt, qui lassi non valebant transire torrentem Besor.
verses.english: David continued the pursuit with four hundred men, while the two hundred who were too weary to cross the Wadi Besor remained behind.

verses.latin: Et invenerunt virum Ægyptium in agro, adduxeruntque eum ad David: dederuntque ei panem ut comederet, et aquam ut biberet,
verses.english: They found an Egyptian man out in a field and brought him to David. They gave him some bread to eat and water to drink,

verses.latin: sed et partem massæ ficorum, et duas ligaturas uvarum passæ. Quibus cum comedisset, reversus est spiritus ejus, et refocillatus est: non enim comederat panem, et aquam non biberat tribus diebus et tribus noctibus.
verses.english: They also gave him a piece of fig cake and two clusters of raisins. After he ate, his spirit returned to him, and he was revived, because he had not eaten any food or drunk any water for three full days and three full nights.

verses.latin: Dixit itaque ei David: Cujus es tu, aut unde venis, aut quo vadis? Qui respondit: Ego sum puer Ægyptius, servus viri Amalecitæ: et reliquit me dominus meus, ægrotantem jam ante tres dies.
verses.english: David then asked him, 'Whose servant are you? Where do you come from? And where are you going?' The Egyptian replied, 'I am a young Egyptian man, a servant of an Amalekite. My master abandoned me three days ago because I became ill.'

verses.latin: Siquidem nos depopulati sumus meridiem Cerethi, et contra Juda, et contra Caleb, et Sicelag succendimus igni.
verses.english: He continued, 'Indeed, we raided the Negev of the Cherethites, and the territory against Judah, and the territory against Caleb, and we burned Ziklag with fire.'

verses.latin: Et dixit ei David: Potes me ducere ad turbam hanc? Qui ait: Si juraveris mihi per Deum, quod non occidas me, neque tradas me in manu domini mei, ducam te ad turbam hanc.
verses.english: David asked him, 'Can you lead me to this raiding party?' The Egyptian answered, 'If you swear to me by God that you will not kill me or hand me over to my master, I will lead you to this party.'

verses.latin: Juravit ergo ei David. Et duxit eum: et ecce dilapsi jacebant super faciem universæ terræ, comedentes, et bibentes, et quasi die festo lædentes pro universa præda, et spoliis, quæ ceperant de terra Philisthinorum, et de terra Juda.
verses.english: So David swore to him. And the Egyptian led him, and there the raiders were, scattered across the entire open country, eating, and drinking, and celebrating as if it were a feast day, because of all the great plunder and spoil they had taken from the land of the Philistines and from the land of Judah.

verses.latin: Et percussit eos David a mane usque ad vesperam alteram, et non evasit ex eis quisquam, nisi quadringenti viri juniores, qui ascenderant camelos, et fugerant.
verses.english: And David attacked them from dawn until the evening of the next day, and not a single one of them escaped, except four hundred young men who had mounted camels and fled.

verses.latin: Et eruit David omne quod tulerat Amalec ab uxoris suis usque ad parvulos, et nihil penitus deprædaverant de minoribus et majoribus, et de filiis et filiabus, et de spoliis, et de omnibus quæ rapuerant: universa reduxerat David.
verses.english: And David recovered everything the Amalekites had taken, from his own wives down to the little ones. They had plundered absolutely nothing of the smaller or larger items, nor of the sons and daughters, nor of the spoil, nor of anything else they had carried off. David had brought everything back.

verses.latin: Et omnem pecora, et armenta abegerunt: et prædæ illius dixerunt: Hæc est præda David.
verses.english: They also drove away all the flocks and herds. And concerning that plunder, they declared, 'This is David's plunder!'

verses.latin: Et venit David ad ducentos viros, qui lassi non potuerant sequi David, et quos sedere fecerat in torrente Besor: qui egressi sunt obviam David, et obviam populo qui erat cum eo.
verses.english: When David returned, he came to the two hundred men who had been too weary to follow him, and whom he had made to stay by the Wadi Besor. They came out to meet David and to meet the people who were with him.

verses.latin: Accedens autem David ad populum, salutavit eos pacifice.
verses.english: As David approached the people, he greeted them peacefully.

verses.latin: Et respondens omnis vir pessimus et iniquus de viris, qui ierant cum David, dixit: Quia non venerunt nobiscum, non dabimus eis quidquam de præda, quam eripimus: sed sufficiat unicuique uxor sua, et filii, cum eos duxerint, proficiscantur.
verses.english: But every wicked and worthless man among the men who had gone with David responded, saying, 'Because they did not go with us, we will not give them any part of the plunder we recovered. Rather, let it be enough for each man to take his wife and children; when they have them, they can leave.'

verses.latin: Dixit autem David: Non facietis hoc, fratres mei, de his quæ Dominus tradidit nobis, et custodivit nos, et dedit fures, qui irruerant in nos, in manus nostras.
verses.english: But David said, 'My brothers, you must not do this with what the Lord has given us. He protected us, and delivered the raiders who attacked us into our hands.'

verses.latin: Nec audiet vos quisquam super sermone hoc: æqua enim pars erit descendentis ad prælium, et remanentis ad sarcinas, et similiter divident.
verses.english: Nor should anyone listen to you concerning this matter: for the share will be equal for those who went down to the battle and for those who remained with the supplies. They shall divide it similarly.'

verses.latin: Et factum est hoc, ex illo et usque ad præsentem diem, quasi præceptum, et judicium, et justitia in Israël.
verses.english: And it came to pass that, from that time and up to the present day, this was established as a statute, and a judgment, and a just custom in Israel.

verses.latin: Venit ergo David in Sicelag, et misit de præda senioribus Juda proximis suis, dicens: Accipite benedictionem de præda Domini,
verses.english: So David came to Ziklag and sent some of the plunder to the elders of Judah, his friends, saying, 'Accept this blessing from the Lord's plunder!'

verses.latin: his qui erant in Bethel, et qui in Ramoth ad meridiem, et qui in Jether,
verses.english: He sent portions to those who were in Bethel, to those in Ramoth in the Negev, and to those in Jattir,

verses.latin: et qui in Aroer, et qui in Sephamoth, et qui in Esthamo,
verses.english: and to those in Aroer, and to those in Siphmoth, and to those in Eshtemoa,

verses.latin: et qui in Racal, et qui in urbibus Jerameel, et qui in urbibus Ceni,
verses.english: and to those in Racal, and to those in the cities of the Jerahmeelites, and to those in the cities of the Kenites,

verses.latin: et qui in Horma, et qui in Borasan, et qui in Athach,
verses.english: and to those in Hormah, and to those in Borashan, and to those in Athach,

verses.latin: et qui in Hebron, et in reliquis locis, in quibus commoratus fuerat David ipse et viri ejus.
verses.english: and to those in Hebron, and to all the remaining places in which David himself and his men had lived and traveled.

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum venisset David et viri ejus in Sicelag die tertia, et Amalechitæ impetum fecerant ad australem plagam et in Sicelag: et percusserant Sicelag, succenderantque eam igni:
verses.english: When David and his men returned to Ziklag on the third day, they discovered that the Amalekites had launched a surprise attack into the southern region and Ziklag itself. The Amalekites had raided Ziklag, and they had set the entire place on fire.

verses.latin: et captivas duxerant mulieres et omnes qui erant in ea, a minimo usque ad maximum: et neminem occiderant, sed secum duxerant.
verses.english: They had also taken the women captive, and everyone else who was there—from the youngest child to the oldest person. They hadn't killed anyone, but they had taken them all away.

verses.latin: Venit ergo David et viri ejus ad civitatem, et ecce succensa erat igni: et uxores eorum et filii et filiæ ducti fuerant captivi.
verses.english: So David and his men came to the city, and behold, it had been burned down with fire. Their wives, their sons, and their daughters had been taken captive.

verses.latin: Sublevavit ergo David et populus qui erat cum eo, voces suas, et ploraverunt donec consumerentur in eis lacrimæ.
verses.english: Then David and the people who were with him raised their voices and wept until they could no longer shed tears.

verses.latin: Siquidem et duæ uxores David captivæ ductæ fuerant, Achinoam Jezrahelites, et Abigail uxor Nabal Carmeli.
verses.english: For David's two wives had also been taken captive: Ahinoam of Jezreel, and Abigail, Nabal the Carmelite's wife.

verses.latin: Et anxiatus est David vehementer: arbitrabatur enim populus ut lapidaret eum: quia amara erat anima cujusque viri de filiis suis et de filiabus suis: confortatus est autem David in Domino Deo suo.
verses.english: And David was greatly distressed, because the people were planning to stone him. For every man was bitter in his soul over his sons and his daughters. Yet, David strengthened himself in the Lord, his God.

verses.latin: Et dixit David ad Abiathar sacerdotem filium Achimelech: Affer mihi ephod. Et affert Abiathar ephod ad David.
verses.english: Then David said to Abiathar the priest, son of Ahimelech, 'Bring me the ephod.' And Abiathar brought the ephod to David.

verses.latin: Et consuluit David Dominum, dicens: Persequar latrunculos istos, et comprehendam eos, an non? Dixitque Dominus ad eum: Persequere: eo quod comprehendas et eruas.
verses.english: And David inquired of the Lord, saying, 'Should I pursue these raiders? Will I overtake them, or not?' And the Lord said to him, 'Pursue them, because you will surely overtake them and rescue everyone.'

verses.latin: Abiit ergo David et sexcenti viri qui erant cum eo: et venerunt usque ad torrentem Besor: et lassi quidam substiterunt.
verses.english: So David went, along with the six hundred men who were with him. They came as far as the Wadi Besor, where some of the men, exhausted, stayed behind.

verses.latin: Persecutus est autem David cum quadringentis viris: substiterant enim ducenti, qui imbecilliores erant, et transire non poterant torrentem Besor.
verses.english: But David pursued with four hundred men, for two hundred men had stayed behind because they were too weak and could not cross the Wadi Besor.

verses.latin: Et invenerunt virum Ægyptium in agro, adduxeruntque eum ad David: dederuntque ei panem ut comederet, et aquam ut biberet,
verses.english: And they found an Egyptian man in the field and brought him to David. They gave him bread to eat and water to drink,

verses.latin: sed et fragmen massæ caricarum, et duas ligaturas uvarum passarum. Quas cum comedisset, reversus est spiritus ejus, et refocillatus est: non enim comederat panem, et aquam non biberat tribus diebus et tribus noctibus.
verses.english: And they also gave him a piece of fig cake and two clusters of raisins. When he had eaten these, his spirit returned to him and he was refreshed, for he had not eaten bread or drunk water for three days and three nights.

verses.latin: Dixitque ei David: Cujus es tu, aut unde es? Qui ait: Ego sum juvenis Ægyptius, servus viri Amalecitæ: et reliquit me dominus meus, ægrotantem jam ante tres dies.
verses.english: Then David said to him, 'Whose are you, and where are you from?' He replied, 'I am a young Egyptian man, a servant of an Amalekite. My master abandoned me because I became ill three days ago.'

verses.latin: Siquidem in australem partem Cerethi, et contra Juda, et ad australem Caleb, impetum fecimus, et Sicelag succendimus igni.
verses.english: Indeed, we raided the southern region of the Cherethites, and against Judah, and the southern part of Caleb's territory, and we burned Ziklag with fire.

verses.latin: Et dixit ei David: Potes me ducere ad turbam hanc? Qui ait: Jura mihi per Deum, ne occidas me, et ne tradas me in manu domini mei, et ducam te ad turbam hanc.
verses.english: David asked him, 'Can you lead me to this raiding party?' He replied, 'Swear to me by God that you will not kill me, and that you will not hand me over to my master, and I will lead you to this raiding party.'

verses.latin: Et duxit eum: et ecce prostrati erant super faciem universæ terræ, comedentes et bibentes, et quasi die festo celebrantes pro universa præda et spoliis, quæ ceperant de terra Philisthinorum, et de terra Juda.
verses.english: And he led him. And behold, they were spread out over the surface of the entire land, eating and drinking, and celebrating as if it were a festival, because of all the plunder and spoils they had taken from the land of the Philistines and from the land of Judah.

verses.latin: Et percussit eos David a mane usque ad vesperam alteram, et evasit nemo ex eis, nisi quadringenti viri juvenes qui ascenderant camelos, et fugerant.
verses.english: And David struck them from dawn until the evening of the next day. No one escaped from them, except four hundred young men who mounted camels and fled.

verses.latin: Et eruit David omnia quæ ceperant Amalechitæ: et duas uxores suas eruit David.
verses.english: And David rescued everything the Amalekites had taken. David also rescued his two wives.

verses.latin: Et non defuit quicquam ab eis a parvo usque ad magnum, tam de filiis quam de filiabus, et de spoliis, et ex omnibus quæ rapuerant: omnia reduxit David.
verses.english: And nothing was missing for them, from the least to the greatest, neither sons nor daughters, nor spoils, nor anything else they had stolen. David brought everything back.

verses.latin: Et tulit David universum gregem et armentum, et minavit ante faciem suam, et dixerunt: Hæc est præda David.
verses.english: And David took all the flocks and herds, and drove them before him. And the people said, 'This is David's plunder.'

verses.latin: Venit autem David ad ducentos viros, qui lassi substiterant, et transire non quiverant torrentem Besor: et occurrerunt David, et populo qui erat cum eo. Et accedens David ad viros, salutavit eos pacifice.
verses.english: Then David came to the two hundred men who had been too exhausted to continue and had not been able to cross the Wadi Besor. They came out to meet David and the people who were with him. And when David approached the men, he greeted them peacefully.

verses.latin: Responditque omnis vir pessimus et iniquus de viris qui ierant cum David, dicens: Quia non ierunt nobiscum, non dabimus eis quicquam de præda quam eruimus: sed rapiat unusquisque uxorem suam et filios, et abeat.
verses.english: Then every wicked and evil man among those who had gone with David responded, saying, 'Because they didn't go with us, we will give them nothing from the plunder we rescued. Let each man just take his wife and children and go away.'

verses.latin: Et dixit David: Non facietis hoc, fratres mei, postquam salvavit nos Dominus, et tradidit in manibus nostris latrunculos qui irruerant in nos:
verses.english: But David said, 'You shall not do this, my brothers, after the Lord has saved us and delivered into our hands the raiders who attacked us.'

verses.latin: neque audiet vos quisquam sermone hoc: æqua enim pars erit descendentis in prælium, et remanentis ad sarcinas, et similiter divident.
verses.english: And no one will listen to you in this matter. For the share will be equal for the one who goes down to battle and the one who remains with the baggage. They shall divide it equally.

verses.latin: Et ex hoc die in antea, statutum est, et præceptum quasi lex, et justitiam facit in Israel usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: And from that day forward, this was established and commanded as a law, and it has set a standard of justice in Israel even to this present day.

verses.latin: Venit ergo David in Sicelag, et misit de præda senioribus Juda proximis suis, dicens: Accipite benedictionem de præda Domini.
verses.english: When David returned to Ziklag, he sent some of the plunder to the elders of Judah, his close associates, saying, 'Receive a blessing from the Lord's plunder.'

verses.latin: His qui erant in Bethel, et qui in Ramoth ad australem plagam, et qui in Jether,
verses.english: To those in Bethel, and to those in Ramoth of the Negev (the southern region), and to those in Jattir,

verses.latin: et qui in Aroer, et qui in Sephamoth, et qui in Esthamo,
verses.english: And to those in Aroer, and to those in Siphmoth, and to those in Eshtemoa,

verses.latin: et qui in Rachal, et qui in urbibus Jerameel, et qui in urbibus Ceni,
verses.english: And to those in Rachal, and to those in the cities of the Jerahmeelites, and to those in the cities of the Kenites,

verses.latin: et qui in Horma, et qui in Borasan, et qui in Athach,
verses.english: And to those in Hormah, and to those in Bor-ashan, and to those in Athach,

verses.latin: et qui in Hebron, et in ceteris locis, in quibus commoratus fuerat David ipse et viri ejus.
verses.english: And to those in Hebron, and in all the other places where David himself and his men had stayed.

verses.latin: Porro Philisthiim pugnabant adversum Israël, et fugerunt viri Israël ante faciem Philisthiim, et ceciderunt interfecti in monte Gelboe.
verses.english: The Philistines were fighting against Israel, and the men of Israel fled from the Philistines. Many of them were killed on Mount Gilboa.

verses.latin: Irrueruntque Philisthiim in Saul, et in filios ejus: percusseruntque Jonathan, et Abinadab, et Melchisua filios Saul.
verses.english: The Philistines attacked Saul and his sons. They killed Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua, all sons of Saul.

verses.latin: Et gravatum est prælium super Saul: inveneruntque eum sagittarii, viri iaculantes, et vulneratus est vehementer a sagittariis.
verses.english: The battle raged fiercely around Saul. The archers, skilled with their bows, found him and wounded him severely with their arrows.

verses.latin: Dixitque Saul armigero suo: Evagina gladium tuum, et percute me: ne forte veniant incircumcisi isti, et interficiant me, et illudant mihi. Et noluit armiger ejus: nimio enim timore perterritus erat. Arripuit itaque Saul gladium, et irruit super eum.
verses.english: Saul said to his armor-bearer: "Draw your sword and kill me, so that these uncircumcised Philistines do not come and kill me and make sport of me." But his armor-bearer refused, because he was terrified by the great fear. So Saul took his own sword and fell upon it.

verses.latin: Quod cum vidisset armiger ejus, videlicet quia mortuus esset Saul, irruit et ipse super gladium suum, et mortuus est cum eo.
verses.english: When his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he also fell upon his own sword and died with him.

verses.latin: Mortuus est ergo Saul, et tres filii ejus, et armiger illius, et universi viri ejus in die illa pariter.
verses.english: So Saul died, along with his three sons, his armor-bearer, and all his men died together on that day.

verses.latin: Videntes autem viri Israël, qui trans vallem erant, et trans Jordanem, quod fugissent viri Israël, et quod mortuus esset Saul, et filii ejus, dereliquerunt civitates suas, et fugerunt: et venerunt Philisthiim, et habitaverunt ibi.
verses.english: But the men of Israel who were on the other side of the valley, and those beyond the Jordan River, saw that the men of Israel had fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead. They abandoned their cities and fled. Then the Philistines came and settled in those places.

verses.latin: Facta autem die altera, venerunt Philisthiim ut spoliarent interfectos: et invenerunt Saul, et tres filios ejus jacentes in monte Gelboe.
verses.english: On the next day, the Philistines came to strip the bodies of the slain. They found Saul and his three sons lying dead on Mount Gilboa.

verses.latin: Et præciderunt caput Saul, et spoliaverunt eum armis suis: et miserunt in terram Philisthiim per circuitum, ut annunciaretur in templo idolorum suorum, et in populis.
verses.english: They cut off Saul's head and stripped him of his armor. Then they sent messengers throughout the Philistine land to announce the news in the temples of their idols and to their people.

verses.latin: Et posuerunt arma ejus in templo Astaroth, et cadaver ejus suspenderunt in muro Bethsan.
verses.english: They placed Saul's armor in the temple of Astaroth, and they hung his body on the wall of Beth-shan.

verses.latin: Audientes autem qui habitabant in Jabes Galaad, quæcumque fecerant Philisthiim Saul,
verses.english: But when the inhabitants of Jabesh-Gilead heard what the Philistines had done to Saul,

verses.latin: surrexerunt omnes viri fortissimi, et ambulaverunt tota nocte, et tulerunt cadaver Saul, et cadavera filiorum ejus de muro Bethsan: veneruntque in Jabes Galaad, et combusserunt ea ibi:
verses.english: all their valiant men rose up and marched all night. They took the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons from the wall of Beth-shan. Then they came to Jabesh-Gilead and burned the bodies there.

verses.latin: et tulerunt ossa eorum, et sepelierunt in luco Jabes, et jejunaverunt septem diebus.
verses.english: And they took their bones and buried them under a tamarisk tree in Jabesh, and they fasted for seven days.
